"Hey Yugi! Wait up!" he heard someone call out to him, and turned around to see Tea walking over to him.

"Oh, good morning Tea." Yugi greeted her.

"Its blank? Thats weird." he said as he took it from her. It was green, indicating it was a spell card, but there was no name, picture or text.

"I just found it on the ground and figured that I'd show it to you since you know more about the cards than I do."

"Its deffinitely wierd." he said as he looked it over. Then suddenly, the card began to glow, and emitted a bright light that engulfed the two.

'Agreeded' was Tea's answer before the continued on there way to school.

choices: They run into Joey and Tristan
11132212212.content:
As the two stood there, worried about their current situation, they suddenly felt disoriented and light headed, though it quickly passed.

Blinking a bit as the feeling went away, the expression on Yugi's face had changed. Moments ago, it had been one of embarrassment. But now, it was much more cheerful. His posture had also changed, and seemed a bit more feminine. Tea's expression had also changed, and had become more passive, and she crossed her arms on her chest.

Yugi looked around with curiosity. "Where are we?" he asked with interest as he turned to Tea.

"I don't know." Tea replied with a shrug.

"Can we explore, teacher?" Yugi asked hopefully.

"I suppose we can." Tea replied.

"Thank you!" he said as the two began to walk around.

The reason for their new, odd behavior was the card. It hadn't just changed their clothes, but their minds as well. The two of them now believed that they were what they were dressed as. Yugi believed that he was a Dark Magician Girl, and Tea believed that she was a Dark Magician.
11132212212.title: They begin to act as if they are Dark Magician ...

choices: The change is contagious. Joey and Tristan's clothes become duel monster clothes
Joey and Tristan try to find out what going on with their friends.
111322122121.content:
As Yugi and Tea, who both now believed that they were the Dark Magician Girl and Dark Magician, wandered about as they explored the city, the two encountered two familiar people that they knew well, though Yugi and Tea wouldn't know who they were in their current state. The same could not be said for Joey and Tristan, who imediately recognized them.

They were briefly speechless at the sight of their friends dressed like that, though the feeling quickly passed as they broke out in laught. "Yo Yug, Tea, whats with the get ups?" Joey asked, both he and Tristan snickering at the sight of Yugi dressed in such a girly outfit.

"Um, do we know you?" Yugi questioned. with a look of confusion. "Who are "Yug" and "Tea?" And could you please tell us where we are?" he asked, oblivious to the reason they were laughing.

"Huh? What are you talking about, Yug?" Joey asked, a little suprised.

""Yug?" No, I'm Dark Magician Girl." Yugi said, introducing himself as who he believed himself to be. "And this is my teach, and very good friend, Dark Magician." he said, gesturing to Tea.

Joey and Tristan were now staring at the two. They could tell that Yugi sounded serious, and they really thought they were what they were dressed as.

Now, whoever the clothes of whoever they encountered would magically change into those of another duel monster, and then they would begin to believe that they were that duel monster. And Yugi, Tea, and anyone else effected wouldn't know the difference.

And on that cue, Jeoy and Tristan felt something strange. What they were wearing felt different all of a sudden, they saw that their own clothes had changed as well now, and were now wearing...

Follow Joey and Tristan as the Gemini Elf sisters
11132212212112.content:
As the two looked down, they were shocked by what they were now wearing. They looked absolutely ridiculous!

Joey now wore a short blue dress that was lined wih white fur at the top and bottom. Along with the dress, he had on matching blue gloves that went all the way up to his shoulders, also having white fur on the end. And on his feet were matching knee-length blue boots with heels, that like his other bits of new attire, had white fur on the end. As for Tristan, he now wore a short, purple dress, and on his feet were matching purple boots. Their new clothes would have also given ample view of cleavage if either of the two actually had any. On their faces were also matching markings, with Joey's being blue, and Tristan's being green. Joey also had pink lipstick, while Tristan had green lispstick that matched his new facial markings. The two were now dressed like the Gemini Elf monster.
http://images1.wikia.nocookie.net/__cb20...

"What just happened?!" Joey let out in shock.

"I have no clue!" Tristan responded.

Before they could talk more, they suddenly felt a bit hazy as the mental changes followed. The two then looked around with confusion then turned to one another. "Sister, how did we get here?" Joey asked Trsitan, now speaking with a bit of a sultry tone.

"I don't really know. And where are we, anyway?" Tristan replied, now speaking with a similar tone.

"We were wondering that, too." Yugi said. "Me and my teacher were taking a look around. Would you like to join us?"

"Thanks, but no thanks." Joey replied. "My sister and I will just take a look around on our own."

"Well, okay then. I guess we'll see you two around some time." And with that, the two pairs parted ways.
11132212212112.title: The clothes of female duel monsters

1113221222.title: What happens next

choices: The villager's treat Tea as the teacher of magic school there
A few male monsters attempt to flirt with Yugi
11132212221.content:
As the two of them stood there, wondering what they were going to do about their current situation, there was suddenly another bright flash of light. This time, the two also lost consciousness this time...

-------------------------------

When Yugi awoke, he stood up, and noticed with a frown that he was still dressed like the Dark Magician Girl. He also noticed Tea lying nearby, still dressed as the Dark Magician as well. He then got up, and looked around, and instantly noticed his location had changed. He was no longer on the streets of Domino City! In fact, they definitely weren't in a city. They now appeared to be in some sort of a forest, with trees taller than any he had ever seen before.

"Where are we?" he wondered out loud. He then walked over to Tea, and gently shook her to waker her up.
"Yugi? What happened? Where are we?" she asked him.

"I don't know. Lets have a look around." he said, and the two followed a path that, lucky enough, led them outside the forest. Once they exited it, they saw what they could only describe as a magical countryside. There were many fantastic, and familiar creatures. Yugi recognized many of them as ones from various cards he had seen. They saw a village in the distance.

"Tea, I think we may be in some kind of Duel Monster's world." he said.

"What? But how?" she asked with worry.

"I don't know." Yugi replied. "But for now, maybe we should head for that village."

"Okay."

As they made their way there, they noticed several of the creatures observing them. As they continued, a small group of fairies suddenly flew right by Yugi, and waved at him, and they heard a few of them say "Hello Dark Magician Gil!" and the fairies flew on.

"...did they just call you "Dark Magician Girl?"" Tea asked.

"I... think so?" Yugi asked, unsure of what else to say. He was just as surprised. He may have been wearing her clothes, but he looked nothing like the spellcaster. What he and Tea didn't know was that along with bringing them to this world, the card made it so that the two were now viewed as what they were dressed as, effectively taking the place of the Dark Magician and Dark Magician Girl.

Not long after, the two arrived in the village.
11132212221.title: There is a flash of light, and they are telepor...

choices: She begins teaching the class instinctively
She pretends to know what to do
111322122211.content:
As Yugi and Tea entered the village, a very excited looking Kuriboh hopped up to them.

"Hello Dark Magician! Welcome back!" it greeted them.

"Uh, thanks?" Tea said, not quite sure what to say.

"I hope you enjoyed your vacation," the Kuriboh said, "But I also hope you're ready to get back the work. We don't want the students falling behind, do we?"

"The... students?" Tea asked, as she and Yugi blinked in confusion.

"Of course. Don't forget, you and your lovely apprentice are our only magic teachers," Kuriboh said. As Yugi and Tea's jaws dropped, it continued, "Well, come along then, no time like the present to start teaching."

As the Kuriboh turned and started hopping away, Yugi and Tea reluctantly following (not that they had much choice), Tea leaned into Yugi and whispered, "What's he talking about?"

"Apparently he thinks we really are Dark Magician and Dark Magician Girl, and apparently, they're teachers here," Yugi replied, thinking about what had just happened.

"Well what do we do? I don't know anything about magic!"

Before Yugi could think of a solution, they reached a small, one floor hut in the middle of the village, Kuriboh jumping up to grab the knob and open the door.

"Well, I'll just leave you to it," it said.

"Thanks," Tea muttered, before she and Yugi walked into a room that was filled with various Duel Monsters milling about. Noticing Tea and Yugi enter, the group straightened up, and bowed together.

"Welcome back, Dark Magician-sensei!" they chorused.

"Uh, thanks," Tea replied.
111322122211.title: The villager's treat Tea as the teacher of ...

111322122212.content:
As the two of them entered the village, they noticed groups of Duel Monsters moving about the town, carrying out rather ordinary tasks, such as buying food or trading in a market. Yugi and Tea stared in wonder at all this, barely even noticing as two monsters - the Flame Swordsman and the Legendary Fisherman - slowly walked over towards them. The two monsters' looked them over, a glint appearing in their eyes as they looked at Yugi.

"Hey, Dark Magician Girl," Flame Swordsman said, startling the kids out of their fascinated staring.

"Um, hi?" Yugi said, still not entirely sure why everyone was referring to him as Dark Magician Girl.

"You're looking good today," Legendary Fisherman said with a lecherous smirk.

"How'd you'd like to... hang out?" Flame Swordsman asked.

Yugi's face reddened as he realized the two male monsters not only seemed to think he was Dark Magician Girl, but actually seemed to be flirting with him.

"Uh, er, no thanks," he replied, backing up, only for the Legendary Fisherman to not-so-gently grab his arm.

"Now don't be like that, cutie," the Fisherman said, "We just want to have some fun."

At this point, Tea decided to step in; it was funny to watch at first, but now it was getting disturbing.

"Back off," she spoke up, "Leave hi- er, I mean her, alone."

Yugi glared at Tea for calling him a "her", but she merely shrugged apologetically as the monsters turned to look at her.

"Standing up for your student Dark Magician?" Fisherman asked, while Flame Swordsman started looking nervous.

"Yes, I am," Tea replied, holding up her staff in what she hoped was a threatening manner. It seemed to work, as the Swordsman started tugging on the Fisherman's arm.

"C'mon Fisherman, let's go," he said, "I'd rather not get turned into a toad."

The Fisherman frowned, but let go of Yugi's arm, winking at him once before quickly walking off with the Swordsman. As they left, Yugi and Tea both gave a sigh of relief.

"Thanks Tea," Yugi said.

"No problem," Tea replied, "That was getting kind of creepy."

"I know - could this get any weirder."

Yugi shouldn't have said that, because as soon as he did...
111322122212.title: A few male monsters attempt to flirt with Yugi

choices: They head out of town to try and learn how to use their new magical powers
They go to the towns library to study some spell books to learn how to use them
1113221222121.content:
"Ah, at last we meet again, Dark Magician!" the two heard a loud, booming voice call out. Turning around to look at the souce, they saw a large, armored fiend-type monster carrying an axe. Next to the monster was another, a woman elf like ears and long white hair. She wore a red, black, and white dress and had black, shoulder-length gloves holding a spear.

Yugi recognized the two cards as those of the ritual monsters Demise, King of Armageddon, and Ruin, Queen of Oblivion.
(http://images4.wikia.nocookie.net/__cb20...)
(http://images2.wikia.nocookie.net/__cb20...)

"Oh no, please don't tell me that I'm the one hes talking to..." Tea muttered low enough that only Yugi heard her, and she glanced around the area, desparately hoping that there was a real Dark Magician nearby.

Unfortunately for her, no such luck. The two Duel Monsters walked right over to the two of them. As the two approached them, other monsters started to lear the area fearfully, not wanting to be involved in this situation. "Its been a long time since we all ran into each other, Dark Magician." Demise said.

"Long time no see, Dark Magician Girl." Ruin taunted.

"After our last encounter, I've been looking for you in hope of getting revenge for defeating me then." Demise said as he raised his axe. "Now, this time I'll kill you!" he said as he was suddenly surrounded by an aura of blue flames and that flew up from it and fired a powerful blast at the Tea and Yugi, who leaped out of the way in fear. At this, the other Duel Monsters that had still been in the area all started to run until it was only Yugi, Tea, Demise, and Ruin left in the area.

'Oh man, what are we going to do!?' Yugi thought, the two had gone in separate directions, and Demise was focusing his attention on Tea. Looking around, for something to help her, he watched as Demise charged at herwith his axe. "Hey, leave us alone!" he shouted as he waved his hand that held the wand that hae had got ten with the Dark Magician Girl's clothes. As he did this, he watched as a box floated up, and fly at Demise and hit him in the head, causing him to stumble. 'Did I do that?' Yugi wondered as he ran over to Tea while Demise recovered from the surprise. The two backed off, and Yugi swung his wand again, but this time, nothing happened.

"C'mon, fight back, Dark Magician!" Demise taunted. "Or I you too afraid to face me? If that is the case, just surrender now and let me kil you!"

Racking his brain for a solution to avoiding this fight that they were sure to lose, Yugi came up with a plan to at least delay it. "Listen! Te-The Dark Magician isn't going to fight you here, not when it would put others in danger!" he said as he steeled all of his courage. "If you want to fight him, then you'll just have to do it somewhere else!"

"Yugi!" she hissed low enough for only Yugi to hear. She was terrified, and wanted to avoid the fight altogether.

"Listen Tea, just trust me. Just play along and say that you'll do this tomorrow, outside town." Yugi whispered.

Deciding that she would trust him, she put on her bravest face and turned to face Demise. "Yu-uo heard her." she said, cuttinger herself off as she almost said 'Yugi is right.' "I'm not going to fight you here and now. If you want to fight me so badly, then we'll do it tomorrow, outside of town where it won't put anyone in danger."

"Fine then, we'll finish this tomorrow." Demise reluctantly agreed. "Nut know this! If you're not there tomorrow, then me and Ruin will be back, and we'll make sure to destroy this town, and then you'll have no excuse to avoid us then!" As demise said this, Ruin leaned over and whispered to him who nodded to whatever she said, before turning back to the two humans and walked over to Yugi, who tensed up as she held her spear close to his neck.

"Instead of just letting the men fight alone, us ladies will join in as well." Ruin said to him. "I'll enjoy killing someone as pretty as you." she said before lowering her spear and turning and leaving with Demise.

With a sigh of relief, Yugi turned to Tea. "Yugi, what are we going to do?" she asked worriedly. "If we go to that fight, we'll be killed! Maybe we should just get out of here while we can..."

"We can't do that, Tea. You heard him, he'll destroy this town if we don't face him. We can't just let him do that and kill the inhabitants of this town because we were too afraid to do anything."

"Yeah, you're right." Tea said. The inhabitants of this village may have been duel monsters, but here, they were just as real s her and Yugi. She couldn't just let them die. "But what can we do? We may have their clothes, and everyone else may think that we're really the Dark Magician and Dark Magician Girl, but that doesn't mean we actually are them. We're just regular, powerless humans in a world full of monsters."

"Maybe, but maybe not." Yugi said as he held up the wand in his hand. "When that monster charged at you earlier and I told it to stop, I happened to wave my wand, and a box floated up and hit Demise. Apparently, along with these clothes bringing us here and making everything thinking we really are the Dark Magician and Dark Magician Girl, it also gave us their magical powers as well. I tried to use them again after that, but it didn't work that time. So all we have to do is figure out how to use them properly, and we might be able to beat Demise and Ruin."

"I sure hope so." Tea said as she looked at the staff she held.
1113221222121.title: Confrontations

choices: They keep experimenting with their powers
11132212221211.content:
"Okay," Yugi said as he and Tea walked back out into the forest outside, "We need to try and figure out how to use the powers that apparently come with these clothes, and it would probably be better if no one who thinks we're actually Dark Magician and Dark Magician Girl saw us - there'd be too many questions about why we can't use "our" own abilities."

"So, how exactly did you manage to use move that box earlier?" Tea asked as they entered a clearing.

"I don't know; I wasn't even trying, and when I did try, nothing happened," Yugi frowned, trying to think of a way to use the magic now apparently at his disposal.

"Maybe you weren't concentrating enough?" Tea suggested, as she lifted her staff and pointed it at a nearby rock. She furrowed her brow in concentration, and lifted the staff. When nothing happened, she frowned and move the staff around some more. The rock still didn't move.

"I guess it's not concentration based," Yugi said, Tea growling in frustration.

"Oh, for crying out loud! Why won't this thing work?" she shouted, before slamming the butt of the staff into the ground - at which point a blast of energy shot out of the staff and into a tree branch above them, which broke off and crashed into the ground between them. They jumped in surprise, and then stared at the slightly burning branch on the ground.

"Well," Yugi said after a moment of silence, "That's something, at least."
11132212221211.title: They head out of town to try and learn how to u...

choices: They had back to town to check its library for spellbooks for some tips
111322122212111.content:
"Hm... Maybe we're trying to hard?" Yugi suggested.

"What do you mean?" Tea asked.

"Well, maybe its gotta feel natural, like I'm sure we've gotta think about what we want to do, but if we concentrate too hard or try to force it to work, it won't work." Yugi said, giving it a bit of thought. "Lets see, I remember when I made that box fly at him, I was looking for something to try and distract Demise, but didn't see anything right away, so I just tried to get his attention away from you and called out to him instead. And thats when I waved the wand." Yugi said, demonstrating with a swing, but nothing happened.

"Thats all well and good, but how do we make doing something we've never done before 'feel natural?'" Tea asked.

"I don't know." Yugi said. "But we've gotta figure out." Yugi said, swing ing his wand again for no reason, and nothing happened, and tried again, but still nothing. He groaned. If they couldn't figure thinks out, they were gonna die... 'No! I can't think negatively or I'll just give up. I've gotta be brave!' he thought as he pointed the wand forward, and a magical blast launched out from the tip, much to both of their surprise.

"How did you do that?" Tea asked.

Yugi thought for a moment when an idea popped into his head. "I think I've got it!" Yugi exclaimed. "Okay, we can't force it, and its gotta be natural, so we can't think too hard about what we're doing, but maybe the magic also respondes to our emotion along with everything?"

"Emotion?"

"Yeah, for example, I just wanted to protect you with something in town, and when you fired that blast, you were a bit frustrated! And just then, I strongly thought 'I've gotta be brave!' as I pointed my wand forward, and that magical blast shot forward!" he explained. "So then, I think we can do this!" he said, another swing, and magical energy gathered at the tip, but this time, it seemed to backfire, and explode in Yugi's face. "Ow... This is gonna take a lot of work." he groaned.

"Well, I guess thats why Dark Magician Girl is just the apprentice..." Tea remarked.
111322122212111.title: They keep experimenting with their powers

choices: They find the spellbooks, but can't read them
1113221222121112.content:
"So, we've established that this magic is emotion based, but other than that we don't really know how control it," Yugi summed up a few minutes of trying later. The two of them were covered in scorch marks from backfired spells, while the clearing was trashed by the few successful, but uncontrollable, spells they'd managed to perform.

"What do we do now, then?" Tea asked.

"Well, I noticed a library back in town," Yugi said after a moment of thought, "They might have some spellbooks or something we can look up. Those might help us learn how to control these powers."

"I guess if anyone gets curious I'll just say we're brushing up on our skills for the fight," Tea reasoned, "I just hope we can find something that helps."

With that, they walked brushed themselves off and walked back into town, heading for the library. They soon found and entered the large building, nodding in greeting to the apparent librarian, a Time Wizard, before setting off in search of any spellbooks.
1113221222121112.title: They had back to town to check its library for ...

choices: They head back to the forest to practice
They're hungry and decide to get something to eat first
11132212221211121.content:
Inside, the library was fairly large, with rows of bokshelves. There also didn't appear to be anyone else there. "So what exactly are we looking for?" Tea asked.

"Some spellbooks to help us use our magic." Yugi said.

"I know that. What I mean is, how do we know which of these books can help us?

"Well, we'll just have to look. Now, lets see..." Yugi said as he walked down a few rows of books for a while with Tea following begind him, checking for any writing on them that would identify them as a spellbook. After a while of, he caught sight of one book in particular. It seemed vaguely familiar looking to him for some reason, so reaching over, he pulled it off the shelf and looked at the cover. While there was no writing on it, he realized why he recognized it right away. "Tea, I've got one! This one will be perfect for us to use!"

"Are you sure?"

"Positive." he said as he handed it to her to look at the cover. "I recognize it, from a card. Its the same one on the "Magic Formula" Spell card. Its an equip spell that can raise the ATK of Dark Magician or Dark Magician Girl specifically, so this one would be our best bet to check out first."

The two then opened the book and read through a bit, and sure enough, just like Yugi said, it was definitely a spelbook. It had a variety of spells inside, some of which Yugi recognized as the effects of cards he had seen like the 'Magical Hats' and 'Thousand Knives' cards, and others. And not just spells, it also detailed how to use their new magical abilities properly, and properly show them how to activate and control them.

"You were right Yugi, this definitely looks like it will be a big help." Tea said. And with that, the two of them headed over to the Time Wizard they had saw earlier reading a book. It looked up from its book as they approached it, and Tea held up the book. "We're going to be taking this book for now." she said.

"Of course, it is your book afterall." the Time Wizard replied. "I'm just holding onto it for you while the two of you have been staying in town. Good luck with your fight tomorrow." it said, before returning to reading its book.

"Thank you." And with that, the two left.
11132212221211121.title: They find the spellbooks

choices: Skip ahead to the next morning
111322122212111211.content:
Once they got back to the clearing where they had been practicing earlier, Yugi propped his staff up against a tree and flipped the book open.

"So where do we start?" Tea asked, crossing her arms and staff over her chest.

"Well, according to this, this magic is emotion based, but there are specific emotions to go with different spells," Yugi replied as he read through the first few pages, "Offensive spells tend to be powered by anger, and their strength tend to be connected to what type of anger; if it's frustration or righteous anger, the spells are easier to control but are less dangerous to the target, and if it's closer to hate they're harder to control but are more damaging.

"Defensive spells actually require a small amount of fear to them, as that is the most defensive emotion. But if you're too afraid, it makes it hard to also use offensive spells, as the magic will be more focused on protection.

"And more neutral spells require clarity of mind, combined with a focused purpose for the magic."

"That sounds a little complicated," Tea said, "But I guess it's a start."

"Right," Yugi said, picking up his staff and flipping to another page, "We should probably start with the defensive spells first..."
111322122212111211.title: They head back to the forest to practice

choices: They head right out of town to meet with Demise and Ruin
1113221222121112112.content:
The two spent nearly all day practicing, only stopping for meals such as lunch and dinner. Eventually the two got the hang of things, and by the end of the day, they had managed to gain a pretty good control over their new powers. As the Dark Magician, Tea's magic also seemed to be more powerful than Yugi's.

They had also learned a variety of things, such as how to use their basic but powerful magical blasts, levitation, and several spells, such as the usage of ones such as the 'Magical Hats' and various others.

-------------------------------

The next morning, Yugi awoke with a yawn and got out of a comfortable bed. As it turned out, the Dark Magician and Dark Magician Girl that they had seemingly replaced here had been renting a small one room house in the village while they stayed there. They had found this out by chance, after Yugi had quite literally accidentally bumped into what turned out to be their landlord while they had wandered around town while searching for a place to stay for the night.

Looking out the window, it appeared to be morning, and glancing at a clock, he saw that it was ten o'clock. Looking over to Tea, she was still asleep. With a quik growl from his stomach, he decided to look for something to eat. Looking around, he saw a few supplies like eggs and such, and with them, he began to make an omlet for Tea and his breakfast.

Just as he began to finish, he noticed Tea began to get up. "Something smells good..." she mumbled as she rubbed her eyes before walking over to where Yugi was finishing.

"Oh good, you're awake." Yugi said. "I made breakfast. Theres plenty of omlet for the both of us, so have some."

"Sounds good." she said as they sat down and Yugi placed a plate in front of each of them. As they ate, Tea lookedover to Yugi. "So, after we settle this thing with those two monsters, what are we going to do next?" she asked.

"Well, we should probably start looking into how to fix things and get back to normal." Yugi replied. "I feel ridiculous in this outfit, and I don't really like the idea of being seen as a female."

"Yeah, I agree. And you do look ridiculous in that." Tea said. "So then how should we start?"

"Well, first we should worry about the fight." Yugi said. "How to get back to normal won't matter much if we don't live."
1113221222121112112.title: Skip ahead to the next morning

11132212221211121122.content: Do Yugi and Tea notice something different about each others' appearance?
11132212221211121122.title: Something else

choices: They decide to focus on the duel for now
111322122212111211221.content:
As they continued eating, Tea reached up to scratch her head. Yugi absentmindedly followed the action with his eyes, and blinked as he noticed that Tea's hair, which had been covered by the Dark Magician helmet, now seemed to be sticking out of it.

"Hey Tea, is your hair... longer?" he asked.

Tea blinked, and grabbed a lock of hair at the side of her head, pulling it slightly to bring it into view.

"Huh? How'd this happen?" she asked, before her attention turned back to Yugi and she gasped, "Yugi! Your hair!"

Fearing what he would find, Yugi reached up and grabbed a lock of his own hair, which was now hanging down out of the back of his own helmet to his neck. And worse, this particular section of hair should have been black; instead, the color seemed to drained from it slightly, making it look closer to the blond hair on Yugi's forehead.

Or on Dark Magician Girl's whole scalp.

"Wha... what? How did we not notice this sooner?" he stuttered out.

"It must be another part of whatever that card did to us," Tea reasoned, "You don't think... are we going to change into them completely?"

"I hope not," Yugi swallowed nervously.
111322122212111211221.title: Different looks

1113221222122.content:
Suddenly Yugi felt an itching sensation on the back of his head. He raised one arm to scratch his hair when he felt his scalp getting more irritated, as if his hair was rustling and moving by itself. Tea watched from the back and saw Yugi's hair grow longer right before her eyes. Tea gasped in surprise as she quickly told Yugi what was happening to him.

"Yugi, your hair" she said. Yugi then turned around to her and said. "Huh, what are you talking abou- suddenly he felt something fuzzy on the back of his neck. Pulling it towards his face he saw it was his own hair, but it was not where he would usually feel it. No, this flock of hair was resting on the back of his neck and was long enough to pull across his head. In addition, the color was a bit off. Instead of his usual black, he saw a dim shade of blonde. In addition, the blonde hair looked a bit curled towards the tips of it. "Gasp, n-no way, my hair is longer" he said in a panic as quietly as he could, trying not to attract attention from the villagers.

It was with a shock that yugi realized what this hair looked like and what could be happening. "Tea, I think I know who's hair this looks like" he said with worry in his voice. "You don't think" she said. "I really hope not" They said discussing ther secret worry."We gotta get out of here before more weird stuff happens" Tea said. And so they ran.

11133221.content:
As the light died down, Yugi groaned as he rubbed his head.

"What on earth was that...?" he muttered, as something suddenly occured to him; he was sitting down. That wouldn't be a cause for alarm, if everything didn't seem to be at the same height.

"Wh-wha...?" Yugi began, as he glanced around. Something was wrong, he was nowhere near that tall. Gulping he tentatively glanced downward.

And found himself staring at Tea's impressive chest.

"WAAAH!!" Yugi screamed as he jumped to his feet... and promptly fell over, not used to his new center of balance. His scream, on the other hand, woke up Tea, who immediately sat up.

"What is it? What's wrong?"

Spotting Yugi, Tea's eyes grew to the size of dinner plates when she saw his head perched atop her slender, shapely body. Her mouth quivered for a bit, as she tried to form words, before finally looking down at herself. And her fears were confirmed as she saw a quite young, quite MALE body clad in Domino High's male uniform, with the Millenium puzzle draped around her neck.

Unable to come up with anything to saw, Tea's eyes rolled to the back of her head as she fainted.

"Great..." muttered Yugi, as he quickly glanced around. Good, no one could see them. What to do now...?

"Yeah, seem to be," answered the brown-haired girl. "No evil Egyptian curse, no being taken over my a mustached fat man, same ol Tea right here."

Tea watched in fear as Yugi went into some sort of trance, but her attention was pulled away from him as her too-large clothes suddenly started glowing. The clothes started shrinking and changing shape, and wrapped themselves around her nude body. When they stopped glowing, she saw that what had before been her school uniform was now a little girl's dress, bright pink with a sunflower design over it.

Before she could even process this, the light from the card disappeared, and the card itself dropped from Yugi's limp hand. Yugi blinked for a few moments, coming out of the trance, and as he noticed Tea in front of him, a confused expression crossed his face.

"Tea?" he asked. Before she could respond, he gave a friendly smile and leaned down so he was even with her, before asking, "What are you doing here? This isn't kindergarden."

"Kindergarden?" Tea asked, "I not go to kindergarden, I a big girl!"

Tea's hand shot to her mouth, her eyes widening in surprise.

'Why'd I say?" she thought in a panic, 'I don't talk like that!'

For his part, Yugi merely laughed and reached out a hand to playfully ruffle her hair.

"I know, you're a very big girl," he said, "But this school is for really big kids. You have to wait a few years before you can come here."

Taking one of her hands in his, he added, "Now c'mon, we should have one of the teachers call your parents before they get worried about you."

Tea then...

1113322222222222222222222222222222112212.content:
As the flash dimmed, Tea suddenly became aware of two things: 1) she was on all fours, and 2) more importantly, she was completely naked, save for a collar attached to a leash Yugi was suddenly holding.

Completely shocked, Tea could only gape at herself and blush as she tried to process this, while Yugi rubbed his eyes to clear them.

"Well that was weird," he said, "This card just flashed and nothing happened."

That was enough to snap Tea out of her shock, and she stared at Yugi in surprise.

"What do you mean, nothing happened?!" she yelled, "I'm naked! And on a leash, and-"

She stopped yelling as she suddenly realized that while she could understand herself, she was hearing barking sounds.

"What? Why am I barking?"

"Whoa, what is it Tea?" Yugi asked, squatting down and taking her head in his hands petting her head soothingly, "Calm down, girl. It's okay, just calm down, that's a good dog."

Tea could only stare at Yugi in further confusion. "You think I'm a dog?"

"Good girl," Yugi said, getting to his feet and picking up the leash again, "Now come on, let's get going."
1113322222222222222222222222222222112212.title: Viewed as an animal

1113322222222222222222222222222222112212.content:
"Well, come on girl," Yugi said, tugging on the leash, "I think that's enough exercise for the day, and I need to get to school, so let's drop you off at home, okay?"

With that, he started walking. Hesitantly, Tea started following, face blushing bright red at the fact that she was walking down the street on all fours, completely naked, with her best friend pulling her along on a leash. The blush deepened as they passed other people on the street, but the one upside of the situation was that no one paid the two any attention; apparently, whatever had happened also made the rest of the world see her as a dog, too.

'What did that card do?' she thought miserably, 'And why did this have to happen to me?'

After a few minutes, the two reached the Kame Game shop and entered.

"Hello, Grandpa, I'm back!" Yugi called. When no answer came he shrugged, "Huh. He must be running an errand or something."

That said, Yugi led Tea behind the counter, before unhooking the leash from her collar. Tea barely noticed, as she was distracted by the rather disturbing sight of two bowls in the corner of the room - one full of water, the other of wet dog food - both with her name written on them. Her attention was pulled back to Yugi as she heard him opening a drawer; looking up, her eyes widened in shock as she saw him pull the weird card that had caused this mess out of his pocket and place it in an open drawer behind the counter, which he soon closed.

"I need to remember to tell Grandpa about that card, maybe call Ishizu if he doesn't know anything," Yugi muttered to himself, before brightening up and smiling down at Tea, "You sure are lucky you don't have to deal with stuff like this, Tea. I'll see you later, okay girl?"

He patted her on the head affectionately, before turning and walking out the door. Tea waited a few minutes until she was sure he was gone, then jumped up and grabbed the drawer, trying to open it.

"Come on, open damn it!" she yelled, "If that stupid card could do this to me, it can change me back, so open so I can grab it!"

Unfortunately, Tea couldn't get the drawer open - her hands were refusing to work right, and she couldn't seem to balance properly on just her feet. After a few minutes of trying, she gave up and sat back down on all fours.

"Oh, now what am I supposed to do?" she said, not noticing the dog-like whine that accompanied it.

Just then, there was a bell chime as the front door opened.



Who walked in?
1113322222222222222222222222222222112212.title: Yugi finishes Tea's walk before he has to g...

1113322222222222222222222222222222112212.content:
Rebecca had stopped by the Kame Game Shop in the hopes of running into Yugi before he left for school. She certainly hadn't been expecting to find Tea there, crouched on the floor completely naked, save for what looked like a dog collar on her neck.

Rebecca could only stare at the older girl, jaw agape, as she tried to process what was happening. Finally, she blurted out, "Tea?! What the hell happened to you?!"

"Rebecca!" Tea barked in surprise, "You recognize me?"

"Of course I... why are you barking? What's going?!"

"Oh, thank God!" Tea said, tears of relief starting to form in her eyes, "Listen to me, something bizarre is happening. It all started when I found this weird card..."

It took a few minutes, but Tea quickly filled Rebecca in on what had happened. Rebecca listened in stunned silence and sat in silence for a few more minutes before walking over to the drawer holding the card. She opened it up and picked up the card, examining it.

"This is the card, right?" she asked, showing it to Tea.

"Yeah, that's it," Tea responded, "We just need to figure out how it works and I can get back to normal... You will help me, right"

Rebecca looked at the hopeful look on Tea's face, then turned her attention back to the card and said...
1113322222222222222222222222222222112212.title: Rebecca

1113322222222222222222222222222222112212.content:
Tea blinked in surprise at what she heard, before stuttering out, "Wha... what did you just say?"

Rebecca smirked evilly as she pocketed the card. "You heard me. I'm not going to be helping you."

"What are you talking about?!" Tea bark-yelled, "Why won't you help me? What's wrong with you?!"

"Oh, it's simple really," Rebecca replied as she folded her arms, "With you out of the way, Yugi's all mine."

"What?!"

"But don't worry, I won't leave you hanging," Rebecca added as she started walking towards the door, "Once we're together, I'll convince him to adopt a nice mutt for you to have puppies with."

"You bitch!" Tea literally growled, before leaping up to pounce on the smaller girl.

"Heel!" Rebecca shouted, pointing a finger at Tea. Without even meaning to, Tea dropped back to the floor and lowered herself to her haunches, blinking in confusion as she tried to process what she had just happened. Rebecca, meanwhile, clutched her sides as she burst into laughter.

"Oh my God, I can't believe that worked!" she said through her laughter. Collecting herself, she turned back to the door and started on her way out. Pausing in the doorway, she turned back to Tea and added, "Oh, and don't worry about this nasty card, either. I'll make sure to put it somewhere Yugi will never find it, so it won't hurt him... or help you."

Tea snapped out of her stupor at that and charged at Rebecca, only for the door to slam shut in her face. She tried to open it, only to find that she couldn't remember how. With a very dog-like whine, she collapsed into a heap on the floor and started weeping.
1113322222222222222222222222222222112212.title: I don't think so

choices: The card makes Rebecca be viewed as a dog as well
1113322222222222222222222222222222112212.content:
Rebecca continued to chuckle to herself as she walked down the street away from the Kame Game Shop.

"Call me a bitch, will you? Well, looks like you're the bitch now," she said to herself with a laugh, "Heh, should have said that. Oh well, doesn't matter now. Tea's out of the way, and now Yugi's all mine."

Pausing in her walk, Rebecca pulled the mystery blank card out of her pocket and examined it again.

"And it's all thanks to you," she said, looking it over, "Hmm, I wonder if it does anything else..."

Rebecca's musings were cut short as the card started to glow, causing her eyes to widen in surprise.

"What the-" was all she managed to say before there was a flash of light, blinding her.
1113322222222222222222222222222222112212.title: Follow Rebecca

1113322222222222222222222222222222112212.content:
As the light died down and Rebecca blinked to clear her eyes, she realized that her glasses had disappeared. Looking down at herself, her eyes widened in fear and shock as she saw her clothes were likewise gone, and she was crouched down on all fours.

"What..." she started to say, only to yelp as she realized she had heard a bark. Quickly realizing what had just happened, she started to panic.

"No... no, no, no, no, no!" she bark-shouted, "It's not fair! This wasn't supposed to happen to me too!"

A thought suddenly occurred to her, and her head whipped around as she started searching the area.

"The card. Where's the card?!"

It took a few moments, but Rebecca finally spotted the card... fluttering in the air as a strong breeze blew it down the street.

"Come back here!" she shouted at the card as she started running after it. However, she was brought to a sudden stop as something grabbed her by the neck. Blinking in surprise, she turned around to look above and behind herself and saw...

"Well then Tea, let's go home," said Rebecca.

The change was instantaneous as both Joey and Mai were enveloped in the bright light which lasted for a few seconds before quickly dimming. As soon as the two of them felt it was safe to open their eyes, they noticed the obvious changes. It seemed that the two of them had somehow switched clothing. Joey was now sporting Mai's short-sleeved purple coat which her white corset-like tube top,which showed off his stomach, along with purple high-heeled boots. It also seemed that he had obtained Mai's oversized hair and light touch of makeup."Hey what's goin on here?" Joey said as he panicked, trying to figure out exactly how he got in Mai's outfit.
Mai was freaking out as well, though admittedly she was taking it much better once she got a good look at Joey. "Oh god I don't know what's going on, but dear lord is it funny!" She nearly fell over laughing. She was now sporting Joey's usual long blue open jacket with a raised collar, a white T-shirt underneath and blue jeans.
"No it ain't!" Joey let out a low growl. "If anything I'd say that it was incredibly unfunny!" He blushed as he looked down at his new outfit. "How exactly am I supposed to walk in these boot thingies anyway?
All of a sudden, a familiar face made his way into the room where they were having their duel. "Oh hey guys playing a game?" He seemed rather unfazed by the fact that his super macho friend Joey was dressed up like a girl.
Joey blinked in confusion "uh.. Yugi do you happen to notice anything different here?" He said as he pointed to his hair. "Anything at all?!"
Yugi looked at him nervously. "Uhh.. Sorry Mai I didn't notice you got a haircut. Later guys" He gulped as he quickly ran out of the room.
Mai mused the situation over for a second. "Hmm.. As far as I can figure out, we've somehow switched lives with each other. She gave a giggle. "And now everyone things that we're each other."
"Glad you find this so funny." Joey pouted. "What are we supposed to do now?
"Hmm.." Mai tapped her foot as she thought. It seemed that she had a little idea forming in her head.

11331121112.content:
Raising his head from the desktop, Kaiba's mind immediately sharpened as he realized that the strange card must have been designed to knock him out. Fears of sabotage and thievery sent him bolting from his chair, but a tight constriction around his legs almost sent him stumbling over before he reached the door. Peering down to see what it was, he was soon thankful that he hadn't made it outside his office in what looked to be a purple skirt. More than that, he realized in shock, as his eyes darted from the matching gogo boots and mini-jacket, to the white corset and soft lavender arm sleeves. He didn't even need to lift the skirt to realize his underwear had been changed as well. The sheer disbelief of it all stalled his memory for a long, silent moment before he could recall that he had seen this ensemble before, on one Mai Valentine. Stomping over to the mirror in his walk-in closet, the final indignity was suffered as he saw his hair had even been styled into a shorter but matching style to the Harpy Queen.

"What. The. Hell?!" he growled, restraining the urge to howl out in rage, which ironically caused his new locks to bounce about and tickle his face playfully. Somebody had gone through a lot of effort to humiliate him today in his own building, it seemed, and he was eager to return the favor once he found out who. The initial suspect was Mai herself, but while they had never found one another endearing, he questioned what her motives would be for something of this scale. She had never been the type to shy away from a duel. As another point, he realized as he slowly began to calm down, he gave the woman enough credit intellectually to not form a plan the hinged on Kaiba forgetting he had another closet right here inside his own office. Just as he began calculating how long fixing his hair would take, however, the phone rang. Probably nothing of import, but given the circumstances he wanted to know if any more packages had his name on them. "Yes, this is Kaiba," he barked into the receiver, swatting the hair out of his eyes.

"Looking good today, cutey," a distorted voice responded slowly, causing Kaiba to stiffen to alertness.

"Who is thi-"

"Ugh, just as I thought. Dressed to the nines and he still wants to play the big man on campus. Well, in that case..."

As the light faded, Kaiba realised something was very wrong. He was still sitting, but he was no longer in his office. Instead, he was seated on a throne, overlooking an arena where two women wear dueling. Oh, but they weren't using Duel Monsters; they were using spears.

As he turned his head to look at the crowds cheering in horror, he became aware of an odd noise and movement near his ears. Reaching up, he felt a pair of hoop earrings, designed to resemble coiled snakes. That called attention to his outfit.

His usual trench coat was gone; instead, the only thing covering his upper body was a red top that didn't really cover his upper body. It was split down the middle right to the body, revealing his muscular chest to anyone who was interested. Why, if he didn't know any better, he'd say it was designed to show off cleavage...

Not helping that notion was the equally revealing skirt that currently clad his legs. Red with a Medusa-like pattern, the skirt was split on either side, causing it to cover his legs very little. Closer inspection revealed that his legs were now completely devoid of hair; as a matter of fact, he also noticed that his otherwise unchanged hands now ended in perfectly manicured nails, and there was a definate smell of perfume coming from his body.

If that wasn't proof he was currently dressed as a woman, the bright red high heels that currently adorned his feet were.

Before Kaiba could react to his new appearance in anyway, a green-haired woman with a large head approached him.

"Is there something wrong, sister?" she asked, a long, thin tongue extending out of her mouth.

Kaiba briefly considered how to answer...

choices: Serenity looks around for the card
Some other mermaids come up to her
1153322221.content:
As the light disappeared, Serenity blinked to clear her eyes, and suddenly realized that her surroundings had changed. Rather than standing in a park, she now appeared to be underwater; water surrounded her, fish swam about her, and not too far away was a large coral reef.

Serenity gasped in surprise, and instantly slapped her hands over her mouth, only to once again be surprised as she realized she wasn't drowning. As she tried to process this, something swished underneath her. Looking down, she gained her third surprise in as many moments - rather than her legs, she was staring at a large fish tail, covered in bright pink scales. And on top of that, her clothes had disappeared, leaving only a pair of seashells on her chest to preserve her modesty.

"I'm... I'm a mermaid?" she muttered in shock, barely even processing that she was managing to talk underwater, "Did that card do this?"
1153322221.title: Mermaid Serenity

11533222212.content:
Serenity was trying to take in the fact that she was now a mermaid. She wanted to take deep breaths and calm down, but was to nervous to breathe underwater even if she could. Then again, if you were an air breather and suddenly had to breathe water you'd be pretty hesitant too, seeing as you now needed new respiratory requirements. Serenity took in a swish of fresh seawater and inhaled it. She could feel the water filling her lungs as she breathed it in, still a bit nervous about taking it in, but she then exhaled it. She watched as the water flowed out of her calmly.The breathing felt normal. It felt just like fresh air to her. Relieved a bit she said "well at least I know I'm safe here" she said reassuringly.

While she knew she could breathe underwater now she needed to find a way back home on dry land, though getting there wasn't going to be easy. Seeing as she was underwater and had a fish tail she knew she had to get used to swimming to get around places. She attempted to swim, putting her arms out and moving her arms while swishing her tail up and down, but to no avail. there was no way to get in sync as her legs were no longer there. For a normal swimmer who was human i would be easy to move in sync with your arms and legs moving at the same time, but for a newbie human/fish hybrid with a fish tail its not exactly easy to get in sync with one fish tail. She simply flailed about as she tried to swim.

Thats when she heard a voice. "Hey, you over there" said the voice. turning around Serenity saw 3 other mermaids swimming toward her, quite professionally as well. She saw the mermaids calling out to her. One mermaid had blue hair and a blue tail with a pearl necklace, one had green hair with green tail and pearl bracelets and one had blonde hair with pigtails and a yellow tail with a bracelet attached to the fin. "Hi there", said the girl with blue hair.Serenity just looked shyly upon the 3 mermaids as they introduced themselves.

"I'm Serena" said the blue haired mermaid.
"I'm Melody" said the green haired mermaid.
"Im Felicia" said the yellow haired mermaid.

Serenity said her name as she introduced herself. "I-I'm Serenity" she said shyly as she wasn't used to talking to mythical creatures, even if she was one herself.

"What are you doing out in the middle of the ocean like this Serenity?" Asked Serena. "I, um, uh" Serenity stammered as she talked, not sure how to say that she was a human turned into a mermaid.

"Oh, you must be a newcomer" said Melody cheerfully. "Well not exactly said Serenity. I'm not really from around here or the ocean for that matter" she said. The mermaids looked confused at her last statement. "That's silly, of course your from the ocean, your a mermaid silly" Felicia said as she tried to tell Serenity the obvious truth. "But I'm not, I'm a human and I was turned into a mermaid" "A Human" the trio said. "Yes" Serenity said. She proceeded to explain what happened.

"A human who turned into a mermaid from a card? weird" said Felicia.

"Well, don't worry we'll help you out" said Serena as she swam forward and reassured Serenity with a pat on her bare shoulders.

"Thanks" Serenity said gratefully.

"Alright, if your gonna be a mermaid you have to learn how to swim like a mermaid" said Melody. "I saw that you had some trouble swimming so I'll teach you" Serenity looked happy to find friends who would help her. "You'll swim like a pro in no time" Melody said.

Rather than standing in a park, she was now standing in what appeared to be a large, white marble courtyard. More surprisingly, directly opposite her she could see the Sphinx and the Great Pyramids beyond, surrounded by desert sands.

"What? How did I get to Egypt?" she asked, before a breeze picked up and drew her attention to another surprise - rather than her own clothes, she was now wearing a white silk dress, the bottom of which was billowing around her legs in the wind. She was also wearing gold bracelets and, though she couldn't see them, a gold necklace and a gold circlet on her head.

"What's going on? Did that card do this?"

"Oh man, it's so hot" she said, looking up slightly while shielding her eyes from the sun with her new bracelet adorned arm, the light shining off the gold of her bracelets into the sky and some still hitting her smooth white skin. She averted her eyes and looked down at her other arm "Where did all this jewelry come from" she said. She put one of her hands on a bracelet and tried pulling it off but it wouldn't budge. It was as though it was glued to her arm. "Oh man, come off already". She pulled and pulled but to no avail. It wouldn't come off. She finally gave up, panting heavily from how much she tried to pry her clothes off. She was stuck wearing these bracelets and her new egyptian dress that went up to her knees in the middle of Egypt but she didn't know why. "I've gotta find that card" she said, hoping that it would take her back to Domino city.

She decided to bend down and search in the sand, she dug sand everywhere with her delicate fingers, her bracelets shining light into her eyes a bit as she dug, the hood of her dress coming over her head and her circlet and necklace jingling as she searched. She was able to search long seeing as her dress protected her from sunlight, of course that didn't mean that she wasn't going to get a tan from how hard the sun was beating on her. "Bingo, found something" she said with confidence and hope. Hoping to have found the card she pulled it out but to her misfortune it wasn't the card. As Serenity looked around in confusion, she saw some people walking up to her, also dressed in Ancient Egyptian clothing. The men were wearing simple skirts and tunics, while the women were wearing dresses made of some rougher fabric than Serenity's own. Serenity was about to ask them to explain to her what was happening, but just as she opened her mouth, she was interrupted.

"Princess, we've been looking for you," one of the women said.

"What?" Serenity blurted out.

"Yes, your father the Pharaoh sent us," one of the men explained, "He needs to speak to you immediately."

"Oh. Of-of course," Serenity stammered, deciding to play along until she knew what was going on, "Lead the way."

The apparent servants bowed, then turned and walked back the way they had come, Serenity briskly following after them. They entered the nearby building - a palace, she supposed - and walked through a series of passageways until they reached a large set of doors. Two of the servants pushed the doors open, while the others ushered Serenity into the room beyond. Once inside, Serenity looked up to see a figure sitting on a large throne at the back of the room.

115332222221.content:
As the light disappeared, Serenity blinked her eyes to clear them, and then blinked them again in surprise as she realized that her surroundings had changed. Rather than a park, she now seemed to be in a forest, standing in the middle of a dirt road, and nearby, she could see what appeared to be a large, Medieval-style village.

Feeling something rough on her body, she looked down and was surprised to find that her clothes had changed; rather than her own clothes, she was now wearing green-and-brown clothes that looked like they were made from wool and - to her slight disgust - animal hide. But that wasn't even the biggest surprise, for as she looked down she caught her reflection in a nearby puddle and saw to her shock that her ears were pointed!

"Wh-what?" Serenity stammered in shock as she reached up and felt her ears to confirm their new shape, "I-I'm an elf?! How did this happen? Was it that card?"
115332222221.title: Serenity the Elf

1153322222211.content:
Serenity couldn't believe it. One moment she was walking by leisurely in domino city one when she found the card and the next moment she found herself in a medieval themed forest dressed in primitive rags near a village. Her most breathtaking surprise was the fact that she wasn't even human anymore. She rubbed her ears, feeling their length as she rubbed her finger to the tip of her pointed right ear. "Oh, what happened to me" she said in a sad voice.

Putting her newfound ears aside she knew she had to find a way back home and back to being human. She could see the villagers walking by in the close-by village she eyed. "Maybe someone in there could help" she said with hope. Running along, her feet splashed in the puddle she gazed in to see her reflection. While she ran she noticed something, she seemed to be more agile, running faster without having to catch her breath for one second. She took brief notice of her newfound athleticism and agility. "Woah, since when could I run so fast" Serenity asked herself in confusion. She remembered how hard it was for her to run in school without catching her breath, now she could do it easier as though it was natural to her. She stopped for a moment, looking down at her feet, which were within a pair of pointed animal skin shoes. She could feel empowered and eager. Looking at a tree branch curiously, she squatted down and then jumped up to grab the tree branch and hop off it to go faster. To her surprise she lunged off the ground more than 3 feet and used her dainty fingers to grab hold of the branch and swing herself onto it, supporting herself as she perched on top of it without making it break. Serenity looked at her right hand in awe while her left held the branch. She was never this athletic and fast before. She felt overwhelmed by her new abilities. All of this was a bit much to take in. she felt a bit scared looking down from the tree, mentally criticizing herself for even performing such a stunt. She didn’t know how all of this was possible, her turning from a human into an elf, running and jumping flexibly. She wished that her brother Joey was with her, helping her out and giving her support.

She looked down, still uneasy with her new athletic form. Gulping as she looked below she sucked in her fear and jumped to the ground. Landing perfectly on her feet without losing her balance at all she was amazed and shocked at her power. “Looking down she confirmed that there was no doubt about it, she had become very athletic. Becoming an elf must’ve changed her body in more ways than one. She confirmed this in her head as she finally took it in, but also remembered what she needed to be doing. So putting her abilities aside she went with it and ran with incredibly fast speed to the village.

As soon as she got to the village she slowed her pace to normal walking. Looking from the entrance she saw something she couldn’t believe. The entire village was full of elves just like her. The village was very reminiscent of a primitive medieval village with cobblestones on the roads and buildings that looked like small cottages made out of stone with wooden door windows. “No way” she said as she felt her ears again, still not believing she’s an elf, or that she’s seeing an entire community of elves for that matter. She took small steps into the village, the stones beneath her echoing out her steps. As she pressed looked forward she noticed that the townspeople didn’t act strangely to her in any way. She of course knew this was because she was an elf like them, but it still seemed strange to not have any surprised looks gaze upon her for having pointy ears.

As she looked right and left at the different people and buildings, a voice said to her from behind “are you lost dear”. Serenity turned around in surprise as she saw…

As the light disappeared, Serenity blinked to clear her eyes, and then gasped as she realized she had somehow suddenly been trapped in something, metal walls surrounding her on all sides. Panicking, she started pounding on the nearest wall, and tried to kick it... only to not feel anything move. Looking down again, she gasped again as she saw that her legs were gone; in place of them was a tail of pink vapor swaying slightly in the air.

Looking around in shock, Serenity took note of her reflection in the metal - in addition to the loss of her legs, her clothes had also changed. For a top she was now wearing only a closed pink vest; in addition to that she wore a green cloth belt around her waist just above her new tail, gold rings around her wrists, large gold earrings, and a small pink veil over the lower half of her face. Also, her hair was now pulled up in a long ponytail. All in all, she barely recognized herself.

"I'm... a genie," she said in shock, "How did this happen? Was it that card?"

Before she could even fully process this, the room - lamp? - she was in suddenly started shaking, and a light appeared from a hole above her. She tried to call for help, but before she could her body suddenly dissolved into smoke and shot up through the hole, before re-solidifying. She shook her head to clear, and looking around saw she was now floating in the air, apparently still in the park.

11533222222222221.content:
As the light cleared and Serenity blinked her eyes to clear them, she immediately realized two things were wrong. For starters, rather than standing on her feet, she was hunched over on all fours. Secondly - and most importantly - her clothes had disappeared, leaving her stark naked in the middle of the park.

Blushing brightly, Serenity attempted to cover herself, but found that her arms weren't working right, and also that she couldn't stand up properly; she could balance on her feet for a few moments, but it was shaky, and she ended up falling back onto her hands.

"What's going on!" she screamed, "Why am I naked?! Why can't I stand up?! Wha-"

She cut herself off as she realized something else. Despite her screaming, she wasn't hearing her words - she was hearing barking.

"What?" Serenity gasped, and was greeted by another "Woof!"

"Why am I barking like a dog?!" she screamed in another series of barks.

"Hey, look at that," a voice spoke up. Somehow managing to blush even harder, Serenity's head whipped up - and her eyes widened in further shock. There were some people walking towards her, except they were also naked and walking on all fours. More to the point, they were being led on leashes by dogs - dogs that were walking upright and wearing clothes.

As Serenity continued to stare in shock, the dog wearing jeans and a shirt said, in perfect English, "Looks like a stray human."

"Are you sure?" the dog wearing a dress asked, "Better check to see if she has a collar."

Serenity was frozen in shock, unable to move as the male dog handed his leash to the female, then walked over to her, pulling her hair back to check her neck.

They both arrived to class just in time. Jaden took his a different seat next to Mindy and Jasmine while Alexis took Jaden's old one next to Syrus and Hassleberry.

As class ended, everyone began to file out of the classroom. But before Jaden and Alexis could leave with their friends, the teacher called out to them. "Excuse me, Jaden Yuki, and Alexis Rhodes, would you please stay behind, I'd like to speak with you about something. Everyone else is dismissed."

Doing as he said, the two walked over to the front of the room where he was. "What do you need?" Jaden asked.

"It is about your dorms." the teacher replied.

"Our dorms? What about them?" Alexis asked.

"As you know, Ms. Rhodes, you are not the most attentive student, always sleeping in class, while in contrast Mr. Yuki, you are quite the model student, and your grades are at the top of your class."

At first the two were a bit confused. Jaden knew that this had been the very first time he had ever payed any attention in class, while Alexis had never slept in class before. However, as they thought about this, they were unaware that their memories started to alter a bit, and thus their thoughts changed.

'Wait what am I thinking?' Jaden thought as he brushed aside his previous confusion. 'I always pay attention in class and work my hardest in them to get the best grades I can. I never sleep during class.'

'Oh yeah, I do sleep in class all the time.' Alexis thought. 'Class can be pretty boring and its hard paying attention to.'

Though they were now convinced that things had always been that way, there were still some lingering doubts in the back of their minds that something was off, they put it aside for now and let the teacher continue. "Since you two both have grades and such that contrast those normally associated with students of your color and fit better with those of each others, its been decided that you two will switch dorms." the teacher told them.

"Switch dorms?" the two questioned in unison.

"Yes. From now on, Ms. Rhodes, you will take Mr. Yuki's place in Slifer Red while Mr. Yuki will take your place in Obelisk Blue."

They thought about protesting. Normally, Jaden had turned down every promotion to a higher dorm that he had been offered in the past, having opted to stay in Slifer Red. But for some reason, he was fine with it today, and looking forward to it. As for Alexis, most students would normally be upset over being demoted to the lowest dorm, but for some reason, she didn't seem to mind. She thought she might enjoy the laid back atmosphere of it.

"Now, at some point today, you two need to move your stuff into the other's room, which will be your new ones." the teacher told them.

"Wait, move our stuff into the other's room? But isn't Alexis's room in the girls dorm? And I'm a boy." Jaden said.

"As I said, you two will be taking each other's place in one another's dorms. This means that you will be part of the Obelisk Blue girls dorm. A special exception is being made for you." the teacher told him.

"Well, okay."

"You don't need to take care of the move right away, but it has to be done today. Now that you two have been informed, you're both dismissed." the teacher said.

As the two headed out of the classroom, they decided to speak with one another about things. "Hey Alexis, does something feel off to you?" Jaden asked.

"Yeah. But I can't put my finger on what it is. Everything seems normal." she replied.

'What about you, Yubel?' Jaden mentally asked his duel spirit.

"Something does feel strange, but I can't tell what it is either." she replied as her spirit appeared next to him.

"Well, I guess we'l just have to pay attention for anything out of the ordinary." Jaden said out loud to both.

"Yeah." Alexis agreed.

Both of them and the duel spirit were completely oblivious to Jaden and Alexis's slowly changing personalities, reality altering with them, and just how odd it was for a boy like Jaden to be placed in the Obelisk Blue girls dorm. They could feel that something strange was going on, but they just couldn't tell what it was.

"I'm not ax crazy anymore, thanks to you." Yubel said with a smirk. "If you're worried about how I might feel, you don't need to. I love you enough that I wouldn't mind having to share you a bit with someone like Alexis."

"Oh be quiet, you." he said out loud.

"What was that?" Mindy asked.

"Nothing." Jaden said.

1213111221221111.content:
"Come on Jaden. Tell us about you and Alexis." Mindy pesterd.

Jaden ignored her and attempted to relax.

"Just tell us, Jaden!" Jasmine whined.

Yubel laughed and Jaden was really starting to get ticked off.

"Well, I'm going to go for a stroll." Yubel said as she got out of the water. She then flew off into the forest and left Jaden alone with Jasmine and Mindy.

"Well, if you don't like boys, are there any girls you like?" Mindy questioned.

Jaden was beet red and finally had enough.
1213111221221111.title: Jaden is getting really annoyed

12131112212211111.content:
"Oh, come on, Jaden. You can tell us." Mindy urged.

"Yeah, tell us." Jasmine agreed.

His face as red as a the Slifer uniform, Jaden finally relented to his friend's questions. "Okay, okay, fine. You two win." Jaden said, his face flush from the embarrassment. He didn't really want to let anybody know. "Come a little closer, I don't want anyone else to overhear." he said as he nervously looked around to make sure no one else was in earshot of them.

Practically giddy at what was going on, the two huddle up with Jaden. "Well? Who is it!" Mindy whispered.

Still blushing, he said "Well, the truth is, I really like..."
12131112212211111.title: Jaden gives in and tells Mindy and Jasmine who ...

121311122122111111.content:
"Well, the truth is, I really like Alexis." Jaden admitted as he continued to blush.

"We knew it!" Mindy said.

"There, now you both know." Jaden said. "Now, will you stop bugging me about it?"

"Not quite." Jasmine said. "So, why don't you tell her?"

"Thats my business." Jaden replied.

"Oh come on. Whats the point of liking someone if you're not gonna tell them?" Mindy asked.A devious

"I get. Jaden here is just too shy." Jasmine said with a smirk.

"T-thats not it at all!" Jaden said, his blushing only getting worse.

"Sounds like you hit the nail on the head." Mindy said.

"Yep." Jasmine said. "Don't be so embarrassed, Jaden. Theres nothing wrong with showing a little interest in someone."

"Of course, from the way Jaden here is acting, I'd say hes got more than just 'a little interest' in Alexis." Mindy said.

Having had enough, Jaden got out of the water, and wrapped his towel around his chest. "I'm going back to the room." he said as he walked off, his face practically a deep crimson from how much he was blushing.

"Well, that was fun." Mindy said.

"Yeah. We should do something nice for Jaden." Jasmine said. A devious smirk then appeared on her face. "Are you thinking what I'm thinking?"

"If you thinking that we should help Jaden confess, then yes." Mindy said, an equally devious grin adorning her's.

"Then we should get started with planning how to do it."

Meanwhile, Jaden felt a shiver down his spine as he made his way back to the room.

As the light died down, the two looked around in confusion, wondering just what happened. And it didn't take long for them to learn just what it was. Their clothes had completely changed! And Yugi recognized what they now all too well. They were dressed like two of their own favorite cards, his Elemental HERO Neos and her Cyber Prima.

Jaden was now wearing a body suit. It was mostly white, with some red lines on the front and a blue circle on the center of his chest. On hhis shoulders and arms were a bit of armor, and a strange antenna-like object sticking out at his elbow, and black gloves on her hands. On his head was a blue and white antenna-like hat going up from his forehead. "Woah, this is pretty weird."

"I'll say."

Alexis meanwhile was now wearing a red and black mask that almost seemed heart shaped, and from the mask were several blue feather-like attatchments on both sides. She was also now wearing a skintight gray bodysuit, along with a blue skirt, and several large rings, with a pair on both arms near her shoulder and an pair on both wrsits, and a strange pair at her waist that seemed to not be connected to her and orbitted her new skirt. On the front of the body suit at the base of her neck there was a strange brooch with a red circle and a pair of blue wings, and on her feet were a pair of blue boots. "Why are we dressed like our ace cards...?" she wodered aloud.

12132222211112.content:
"Well, this is kinda cool, but lets get out of these." Jaden said. He then tugged at his new clothes and discovered something that was cause for alarm. The bodysuit wouldn't come off! It was like they were attached to his body through some kind of magical force or something! He then tried to take off the antenna, but even that was attatched to him somehow. "Alexis, these clothes won't come off of me!" he said, now starting to panic a bit.

"What?" she asked, a hint of worry could be heard in her voice. Afraid of what this mean for her, she attempted to remove her own new clothes. And just like with Jaden's, hers wouldn't come off either. "Mine won't come off either!"

"Well, this sure became a problem." Yubel commented.

And though try as they both might, the clothes they now wore just wouldn't come off. They also seemed practically indestructible, as they wouldn't tear off as they even tried to rip them to get them off, and clung to their skin.

"That card must have done this." Jaden said. "But what could have happened to that card? Where did it go?" he said as he realized he didn't have it anymore.

"You don't think it just disappeared and is gone for good now, do you Jaden?"

"I sure hope not. I don't want to be stuck in this..."

1213222221111221.content:
As the two of them stood there, wondering what they were going to do about their current situation, there was suddenly another bright flash of light. This time, the two also lost consciousness this time...

-------------------------------

When Jaden awoke, he stood up, and noticed with a frown that he was still dressed like his Neos. He also noticed Alexis lying nearby, still dressed as her Cyber Prima as well. He then got up, and looked around, and instantly noticed his location had changed. He was no longer near the Acadmey! In fact, they definitely on the island. They now appeared to be in some sort of a forest, with trees taller than any he had ever seen before.

"Good, you're awake." he heard a voice nearby, and saw Yubel. And to his surprise, her form seemed completely solid, and wasn't the ghostly form the she was usually in.

"Yubel, you've got a body again." he said with surprise.

"Yeah. That flash of light knocked me out as well, and when I woke up just a bit before you, we were all lying here, and I had a body."

"Where are we, anyway?" he wondered out loud.

"I don't know, but we should probably wake up Alexis." Yubel said.

"Yeah." Jaden agreed. He then walked over to Alexis, and gently shook her to waker her up.

"Jaden? What happened? Where are we?" she asked him. Shethen noticed Yubel, and was surprised to see her, having not seen the duel spirit since the events of the other world.

"I don't know. Lets have a look around." he said, and the three followed a path that, lucky enough, led them outside the forest. Once they exited it, they saw what they could only describe as a magical countryside. There were many fantastic, and familiar creatures. They all recognized them as ones from various cards they had seen. They saw a village in the distance.

"Alexis, I think we may be in some kind of Duel Monster's world." he said.

"Again? But how?" she asked with worry. Their last two times in a duel monsters world hadn't gone too well for any of them.

"I don't know. But this would explain my sudden body." Yubel replied. "But for now, maybe we should head for that village. We might be able to learn something about what happened."

"Okay." they both agreed. "At least this place seems brighter and livelier than the last two." Alexis said.

As they made their way there, they noticed several of the creatures observing them. As they continued, they eventually reached the village, the monster guarding it, looked them over. "Elemental HERO Neos, Yubel, and Cyber Prima? Welcome to the village."

As the three walked into the village, Alexis and Jaden exchanged glances. "Did he just call us by the monsters we're dressed as?" Alexis asked.

"I... think so?" Jaden asked, unsure of what else to say. He was just as surprised. He may have been dressed a bit like him, but he didn't relly resemble his ace monster. What he and Alexis didn't know, as well as Yubel was that along with bringing them to this world, the card made it so that the two were now viewed as what they were dressed as, effectively taking the place of the Elemental HERO Neos and Cyber Prima.
