As they sat down, Hasilberry's skull pendant vanished while Syris's sleeves continued shrinking away, currently resting just below his elbows. Also, the yellow on their jackets began to fade a little as their collars continued getting blue.

"Aren't you going to put that card away?", asked Hasilberry as he saw Syris put the card on the desk..

"Nah. I don't want to forget later to take it to the shop. I know I am not bad at remembering things, but I want to have an insurance any way... It sucks this thing isn't magic though."

"Relax, okay? It's not like we need any magic anyways. Especially after all the trouble we went last year, with the whole Obelisk White magic brainwash thing."

"Yeah, you're right. We had enough of that...", smiled Syris as the two waited for the teacher.

A few minutes ago, Jaden was still dozing off, dreaming about another fantastic Duel, with him using Neos to win the battle. But just as Neos landed the finishing blow, a small shiver down his spine woke him up.

"Jeez, and it was getting to the good part too... Did someone let a window open or something? I'm sure it wasn't supposed to be cold today..."

Upon looking around and seeing the other students returning, he could only frown.

"Man, did I sleep so much? I know I stood up late to watch that Pro Dueling Tournament with Chazz last night, but I never thought I was that sleepy. Guess I should stop watching international tournaments late in the night... But it's fine. The teacher didn't say a thing as he didn't try to wake me up, I'm sure of it. It just sucks that I didn't had a chance to talk with Syrus and Hasselberry about that weird talk from before... Oh well, there's time next recess anyway. And man, I sure need some before Crowler's boring class..."

Too distracted with his thoughts, Jaden ignored a slight tingling feeling centered on his feet, as they seemed to get a bit smaller and gained a pedicure as well. Meanwhile, his shoes began to turn completely blue, the red and black being gradually replaced.

When he looked up to see his friends, Jaden was surprised to see someone else in the seats they once stood.

"Huh? Did they ask to change seats? Are they even allowed to do that?"

Before he could scan the room however, the teacher entered the classroom. Jaden didn't mind snoozing in class, but he didn't want to draw attention to himself to not get in trouble, thus deciding to settle for meeting them later.
1233211211122.title: A wish for Jaden

12332112111221.content:
As the students were getting ready, the teacher entered the amphitheater. Jaden groaned a bit realizing that it was a teacher that talked quite slowly, thus making the lesson even more boring. He was willing to stay awake until the roll call, but not any more than that.

Meanwhile, the other students were whispering between then until their name was called. Neither Syris or Hasilberry questioned themselves why they sat in different seats than the ones from before, or why they now went to the higher ones. Despite Syris's promotion into Obelisk Blue happening shortly, he should still be staying in the Ra section of the class. But now, both of them believed that they deserved to stay higher, given that now, their grades were actually higher.

Reality began to slowly warp as their big accomplishments were beginning to vanish from their profiles, but they seemed a lot more consistent in terms of grades as the results of some of their past tests went up by a few points. They weren't exactly getting smarter, but they seemed a lot more competent when it came down to lectures and examinations, more so in Hasilberry's case.

While waiting to be called out, the two noticed a few Obelisk students who were talking a bit louder. They appeared to be talking about asking Crowler and Miss Fontaine to hold out a small tournament for the new Obelisk students that were to become first years. This made the two giggle a bit in their slightly higher voices.

"It's so nice to have such thoughtful students in the blue dorm, isn't it?"

"Yeah, it is. I personally don't mind pairing up with one of those guys."

"Me neither. It definitely would show the new guys how skilled we are... and we would hang out with a group of cool guys too."

As the two were giggling, their faces began taking a much rounder shape, as their chins, especially Hasilberry's became a lot less pronounced. Also their calves started to shift as well as the muscles were starting to get redistributed better as the excess fat began to slowly move up to their thighs. Hassilberry also lot a bit more muscle, so that he wouldn't have issues keeping his center of gravity. Lastly, their pants gradually went up again, now being right below their knees.

Meanwhile, after his responding to his name being called, Jaden was already starting to get sleepy again.

"So boring... Maybe a quick nap before the lesson starts might not be a bad idea."

He began assuming the "thinker" pose as he started to doze off again. But as he tried to, he began to feel a small itch on his scalp as his hair began getting longer. Initially it wasn't so bad, but having to constantly brush off the few bangs that were getting in his face, made him open his eyes in annoyance.

"C'mon, why does this happen? Is my hair that long? I know I didn't cut it recently, but come on...."

Just then...

"Syrin!"

"Present!"

"Haelbery!"

"Present!"

"...Huh?"

As Jaden was trying to understand the situation, his shoes continued changing as they became fully blue as the straps were replaced with a side zipper as the tips got pointier.

"Did the teacher screw up their names? Why would he call Syris and Hasilberry like that... Huh? Wait... Am I getting their names wrong as well? I could swear it was something different... Man, I must be more tired than I thought... Maybe a fifteen minute nap might be in order for me.", thought Jaden as he put his head in his arms.

Initially, Jaden wasn't affected by what was changing Syrin and Haelbery, but with the new wish made, reality was now warping around him and his mind as well.
12332112111221.title: The second class

123321121112211.content:
After the roll call, the teacher began the lesson. He started to explain various methods of using Winged-Beast monsters in various conjunctions with other Types. He explained the necessity of using a deck based on covering the weaknesses and to boost their attack power, as unlike single type decks, unless it was an archetype, it would much more difficult to maintain a good approach.

Syrin and Haelbery were listening to the lesson, and while not taking as many notes as before, they seemed to remain mostly focused on paying attention.

"This stuff is pretty useful, isn't it?"

"Sure is. The whole archetype thing would screw people over big time. If you want to use a Winged-Beast Deck, then just use a Harpy build. Mai Valentine used that kind of Deck and it was many times successful in winning. It's graceful, it combines strength and strategy and is quite easy to use too."

"True. But I never thought you would be so into a Harpy Deck."

Syris was indeed a bit confused too. He never was that much into anything beside Machine Type monsters, but that would soon change, as the two were a bit dazed by a few more mental changes.

In this time, Syrin's blazer and top were now reaching the middle of his biceps as the blazer's color was starting to change from red to black. As for Haelbery's tank top it also began darkening as the material was starting to get thicker. As for the footwear, after a few more minor changes, became two perfect replicas of the one the Obelisk girls had, with their 3-inch heels giving them a bit of ascension.

Once the daze was gone, the two shook their heads a little as new thoughts went through their heads.

"Well of course I am. It is a favorite build for me. I am in fact surprised that you said that."

"Well, I mean... You also use different types of Decks as well. I thought it was just a favorite of many."

"No way. Harpies is a type I always liked. And if Mai got so good with it, I am sure I will too."

"I am glad to see your enthusiasm."

After the two giggled a little, they returned to paying attention to the lesson. As time passed, their hair became silky smooth and a bit wavier as the color of Haelbery's bandanna was starting to fade to a dark-red, beginning to lose most details as the "teeth" vanished as well.

Meanwhile, Jaden was starting to have a little trouble sleeping. It wasn't as much the teacher's voice that disturbed him, but actually his calves, which started to vibrate. Muscles were being remade, getting more shapely in the process as his feet finished becoming petite and dainty.

"Man, my legs feel a bit numb... I know I didn't exercise too much lately, but it shouldn't be that bad. And the fact that the teach keeps talking so loudly isn't helping either... This lesson is boring as heck and it doesn't help me in the slightest. Other than Hummingbird, there isn't any other Winged-Beast monster in my Deck so why should I even bother? And besides, I need to fake myself being awake next class, as I don't want Crowler to make a speech about being a slacker again... I have to try and get some rest for that."

He was genuinely not enjoying the situation he was in. He could pass for the weird feeling in his legs if he would try and ignore the teacher completely. He didn't had his earmuffs, but he still considered it plausible.

In the meantime, his shoes got a lot tighter, becoming of a material more similar to leather, and thus conforming better on his feet, as they began to lose all of its accents as a tiny heel was forming beneath them.

Jaden was about to go with his plan when...

"Still... Who knows, this might be useful.... I didn't meet someone who runs only Winged-Beasts in their Decks, but it could prove useful for a future Duel... Although it would just as better to learn from an actual battle rather than like this... But it's not like I can nap like this either..."
123321121112211.title: During class

1233211211122112.content:
While pondering what he should do, his calves continued morphing into a more slender and sleek shape, with the extra mass slowly climbing towards his thighs. They remained strong however, as it wouldn't pose much trouble if any. Especially if he were to run again, given the many times he had to get to class on time... But slowly his memories were changing as well as in some of the times he got late to class, he now remembered actually being on time... And besides his physical changes, his pants also got a lot tighter on him, hugging his legs better as the light shade began to darken a bit, a slight bluish hue beginning to appear.

With how his legs, and now his pants, were distracting him, Jaden let out a small groan as he straightened his back.

"Damn it... Might as well pay attention to the lesson now. I don't know why my legs feel numb, but I can't get any rest like this. Maybe listening will put me back to sleep again..."

He lazily repositioned himself on his chair as he began listening.

The teacher continued talking about the various combos that could be utilized. After talking about Alector, Simorgh and Raiza, as well as mentioning a few more new Monster Cards that were in the making, and were to appear in future Card Packs, he then moved on to talk about Harpies. After a brief history, he began talking about their utility.

He mentioned that while their attack power was fairly low individually, they become quite powerful once multiple Monsters appear on the field as they all have the ability to have the same name, Harpy Lady while they were on the field. He then began talking about various way to summon them quicker or to use different ways to increase their attack. He also briefed them on a few details regarding new Cards that Industrial Illusions were going to make specific to the archetype.

"They are going to release support for the Harpies?!", exclaimed Syrin slightly. "I know Pegasus has some random times to release supports for different Decks, but if this is true, I am so going to wipe the floor with the guys!"

"I... never thought I'd see you this excited..."

"Why not? Is Jaden allowed to be the only one that can get excited over Dueling others? I can get into the groove as well."

As the two were talking, their tops continued getting whiter, as the white line what was on them, began to also fade towards dark-blue, like the collars. Also, their thighs thickened, being one step closer towards completion. But for Haelbery, his hard-earned muscles were now really starting to fade out on his legs. They still had a somewhat muscular and toned look, but they will not do that for much longer...

"You just say that because you want to impress boys."

"And how is that a bad thing? Getting attention is our goal after all."

"Yeah, you're right. Besides, what I learned from last lesson will also help me too."

The two laughed a little before continuing listening.

Meanwhile, Jaden found himself quite interested in the subject. He still found it quite boring, but he admitted that some of the things were actually not too bad to know.

"Huh... I never knew that Alector could that that much of a pain. I don't know when I will fight a Simorgh, but it is nice to know a way or two about how to counter it I guess..."

As he listened further, his hands began tingling. He initially thought they will get numb like the legs, but this time, it wasn't nowhere near as bad. They began to slim down, as his fingers became longer as the overall aspect became something more dainty and feminine.

When the lesson got to the Harpies Deck, and upon learning a bit about them, he left out a small chuckle.

"Heh. Who knew Harpies could be strong like that... Wasn't Jasmine also saying she would use a Harpy Deck? Well, I am sure she- Wait... How do I know that? She said she would keep it a secret and..."

His thoughts were interrupted when the teacher drew attention by asking someone a question.
1233211211122112.title: He listens to the lesson

12332112111221121.content:
Upon realizing that the teacher was going to ask a question, given how intricate they usually are, Jaden prayed that he wouldn't be the one that was going to get asked.

"Now then, if Harpy Lady 1 is Special Summoned by an effect, what is the best strategy to increase the attack of multiple Monsters you control without the direct aid of a Spell Card, what level 4 or lower Monster could benefit the most from this combo and and how can you ensure that said Monster can inflict as much damage as possible?... Jades, can you please answer the question?"

Jades was quite confused by how the teacher addressed him, thinking he was talking to someone else until he saw his gaze directed at him. But he didn't have the luxury to think about that at the moment... Usually, whenever he was asked something that he didn't know, which happened most of the times, he would laugh nervously and apologize, as it would make the teacher go to someone else. But this time...

"Crap! What do I do? Umm... I can't just laugh it off can I...? Think Jades!"

He didn't notice that the way he addressed himself in his head was also different, as currently he was thinking of an answer. As he did, he didn't notice his hair changing further. It once again grew, now covering his neck as the spiky and wild appearance began to tone down a bit as it became softer. Also, he light brown color from the upper part of his hair also began to envelop parts from his lower part. After a few more seconds of panicking and preparing to call it quits, new information popped up in his head.

"Uh... First you use Inferno Reckless Summon to call another two Harpy Lady 1 for a total of 900 attack points. The Monster that benefits the most is Hunter Owl... because beside the boost from the 3 Harpy Lady 1, he also gains 500 attack points for every other Winged-Beast, so that would leave him... at 3900 ATK. And the best way to inflict damage is with...Double Attack since Hunter Owl is a level 4, it is easy to find a level 5 or higher Monster to discard for him to attack twice..."

"Quite impressive Jades. I am happy you studied for this one. Then again, given your most performances, it shouldn't be that surprising.", said the teacher with a smile before resuming his lesson.

Although he got himself out of hot water, Jades was a bit confused not just by what the teacher said, but also by how he got that answer right. While processing everything, the sleeves of his top and jacket began to recede, beginning so show a bit of his forearms.

"Just... How did I manage to get that right? I mean... I saw some guys play in a similar way with Hunter Owl, but how did I get that so fast? And what did he meant by my "performances"? Did he meant the tournament? But... Chazz is technically the one who won the whole thing. And Chancellor Shepard congratulated me more for beating Sartorius more than the whole thing with the tournament... And was it just me, or did he say my name wrong...? Something weird is going on here..."

Up in the classroom, Syrin and Haelbery were also a bit impressed with their friend's performance.

"Huh... Guess he can learn a few things. I still would've gotten that right too though."

"C'mon Symrin. Can't you praise him a little more? He did study after all."

"Yeah, you're right Haelery. But I am just saying, if he is good at Dueling, he should be good at studying too. I don't know why sometimes he just slacks off."

"Me too. It is quite a paradox, isn't it?"

Their opinion of Jades was slowly improving. While he thought at the start he was their best friend, than a friend that was too lazy, now he was a friend they began to respect. And this would continue as reality changed further...

In the meantime, their boxers began to follow in the steps of the pants, as they got a lot tighter on them. Also, alongside their superb legs, their hips also started to push out a little, putting a little strain for their pants and underwear.
12332112111221121.title: Asking Jaden

123321121112211211.content:
Soon, class finished and the teacher thanked the students for coming. And this time, there no longer was an angry glare directed at Jades for sleeping or not paying attention. Since the recess was bigger, most students were starting to leave the classroom to either eat or chat outside.

"Finally, I can go and talk to the guys.", said Jades so himself as he began walking upwards. He passed the place where Symrin and Haelery were sitting before, not necessary because he saw two different students, but because he was beginning to think they never sat there today. "Hey...", was all he could say when he ran up to his friends, really confused about their looks.

"Oh, hi Jades.", said Haelery smiling a little. "Sorry for leaving you last recess alone."

"I-It's nothing..."

"By the way, great job on answering that question right. If I was asked, I may have known another method for the third part, but congrats to you."

"T-Thanks..."

Jades was holding himself from not asking out-loud what he saw. Aside from their more polite and really different way of talking, with Symrin sounding more confident and a bit laid-back, and Haelery seeming less louder but almost and expressive but still a bit talkative, their appearances really seemed different than how he remembered the two. Symrin was a lot taller, giving him a lanky appearance if it wasn't for his thighs and hips which were still growing slowly, while Haelery looked like he lost quite a lot of muscle. Yet to both of them, it seemed normal.

While gathering his thoughts, he missed seeing Symrin's skin tone tanned a little more, but it wasn't nowhere as significant as the way Haelery's skin got lighter by a few shades, still giving him a tanned look, but not the way it was before. Also, Jades' skin lost any body hair it originally had, becoming smooth and a bit shiny.

"Are you okay Jades? You seem to be in deep thought."

"H-Huh? Oh... No, ... It's nothing important. Don't worry."

"If you say so... By the way, we are going to the Card Shop right now. Do you want to join us?"

"Sure... I don't mind."

"Perfect. We may as well have lunch too. Let's go."

And thus, the three left the classroom, heading towards the shop. Jades was a bit curious about the blank card Symrin was holding onto, but got a bit concerned by how his friends walked, shaking their hips a little with every step.

"Something is wrong. It has to be. I mean, how can they not see how weird they look? Even their clothes seem off... And why is Symrin so casual all of a sudden? I mean, it's not bad that he is a bit more confident in himself but still... Wait... Wasn't his name Syrin? Or is it Symrin? Why am I getting confused over this all of a sudden...?"

While gathering his thoughts, Symrin and Haelery's collars became fully dark-blue while Jades' began darkening towards the same color.

"I know I was tired but still... It's not like there is any more room to sleep anyways. Hey Kuriboh, do you think something is off?" He waited a few moments for his spirit friend to emerge but he was confused as to why he didn't. "Huh? Kuriboh? Neos? Aquos? Anybody?" Still nothing. "Why isn't anyone answering? Did something happen?", asked Jades to himself, getting a bit worried.
123321121112211211.title: Recess starts

1233211211122112111.content:
The three soon got to the card shop, seeing other students already there, looking at different card packs or at the food on display. But Jades was quite worried about his sudden inability to talk to the spirits, so just before they went to the counter, he excused himself.

"Uh, can I look around a bit? I... kind of want to look around a bit."

"Sure. We'll just talk a bit at the counter. It won't take long."

Jades nodded to them and then hid behind other students, at some distance from them, trying to wrap his head around the current situation.

Meanwhile, Symrin and Haelery went towards the front counter, seeing Sadie talking with a customer. The two politely waited for their turn, as they engaged in a little chat. As they did, they didn't notice that their hair changed once more, with Symrin's brown roots spread further, a quarter now being brown as Haelery's seemed to lighten a little, gradually going from back to s dark-gray color. But what was more important for him was that his dreads finally snapped, making his back hair tickle his neck.

Upon noticing, Haelery left out a small groan.

"Ugh... My hair is getting a bit on my nerves."

"You shouldn't leave it free like that. I mean, it is a bit hard to control it if you don't use enough conditioner."

"I don't to use a full can of hair-spray for hair hair though... Wait, I have an idea...."

He then took off the bandanna, which was now almost a complete dark-red except for a few design lines, revealing his fluffier hair, as he used it to tie his hair into a ponytail.

"There. Much better. I don't know why I left it the way it was."

"Maybe you just wanted to try out a new style... Or maybe you just forgot."

"Yeah... I don't know why I even decided to wear a bandanna. It's so not my style."

After a couple more minutes, the client walked off. The two then walked up to Sadie, as she welcomed the two with a smile.

"Good morning guys!"

"Good morning Sadie!", saluted back Symrin as Haelery also greeted him. "Are you alone right now?"

"Yeah. Ms Dorothy said she needed some time to restock a bit in the back. A new semester is coming, and she wants to make sure the new packs are ready... How can I help you guys?"

"Well, it's this.", said Symrin as he gave Sadie the blank card. "I found this at the front gates this morning. I was wondering if someone lost it."

"Hmm... Let me check in the data base."

As she was looking at her computer, the boys felt a little tingling in their necks, similar to the one from before. The two noticed that it wasn't as bad as before, gently rubbing their necks a little as they waited.

Also, their memories and personalities were changing further. Haelery was now really starting to forget about his training regime as as well as his preference for Dinosaur Type Monsters. Instead, he grew a fondness for more girly things like shopping and gossiping, as working hard for muscles no longer seemed an attractive idea for him. Which wasn't something he didn't welcome, as his new personality was slowly erasing his more "army behavior".

Something similar was happening to Symrin. While he wasn't getting as girly-like in terms of personality, as he seemed a bit more laid-back, he still started to enjoy the same things Haelery did. But what was more important in his case was the fact that his memories with Zane were starting to fade out quite a bit, the only ones that remained mostly clear being the ones after he joined the academy.

"Okay...", started Sadie. "I've checked the database, and so far, no one reported any missing blank cards."

"Maybe it belongs to that magician.", said Symrin in a higher voice than before, his tone starting to get similar to someone else's.

"He thinks it may belong to the magician that came here a while ago. Blank cards were used for his magic tricks.", continued Haelery in a higher voice too.

"It's possible... But we never got told anything about that. We will check into it... But it is more likely it is one of the faulty cards we found in our stock. Ms Dorothy says we should send them back as they don't have much value... But thanks for bringing it to me anyways."

"No problem... Say, is the Golden Egg Sandwich still not taken for today?"

"Yup. Who knows, maybe you guys might have your lucky day."

The two giggled as the said "Maybe." in unison before leaving to pick up Jades.
1233211211122112111.title: At the card shop

12332112111221121111.content:
Meanwhile, Jades was pretending that he was checking a few of the shelves, when in reality he was trying to get one of his Duel Monster Spirits to answer back to his call. However, he getting increasingly confused and worried when no one replied back.

"Why isn't anyone answering?... Did what happen when I lost to Aster is happening again? But... it shouldn't. I mean, the Light of Destruction is gone, and there wasn't any indication that something like that happened again... Is there some other phenomenon that is at works here...?"

While thinking really hard about the cause, his hands became dainty and delicate as his fingernails grew in length a little as well. The changes then progresses further up his arms as they began to slim down, with some muscles distributing their mass between each other. As for his clothes, now almost all of his forearms were now uncovered.

Normally, he would freak out at this, but currently, he was preoccupied with something else.

"Huh? Was it just me or did I use some spiffy words back there?... Am I getting smarter? Nah, that's impossible. I mean, it's absurd to think that I somehow learned big words all of a sudden... But back on topic. Why isn't anyone responding? Even Kuriboh, who I could hear and see ever since the start of the first year doesn't answer... What is the cause here?... There was no warning from Neos or anyone else. Sartorius said there shouldn't be any traces of that power from before. And I don't recall any weird Duels either.... Is this somehow related to how Symrin and Haelery are acting? They started talking like some of those guys from Obelisk did back in the first year. They weren't exactly snobby as they were, but still... Back when I was exploring their dorm, some were quite boastful and..."

Jades suddenly stopped, confused at his own thoughts. He was so distracted by them, that he didn't notice that his tighter pants were slowly rising upwards, showing his ankles now as his footwear gained a pointed tip and the heel grew out a bit more as they finished becoming a pair of heeled blue boots that were identical to the ones his friends were wearing.

But that wasn't so important right now, as his memories were also changing. The names he called his friends aside, he was starting to remember times when he spent more time at the Obelisk dorm. But it didn't seem like he was there to ask a Duel or anything, but simply walking around, talking with the other students. He didn't meet many students from Obelisk outside the tournament or the official Duels he had, thus he didn't had much time to interact with them. But his newly developing memories were starting to contradict that. But what was weirder was that in some of those memories, he was actually talking with girls. Usually, the females from the blue dorm wouldn't think much of him, still considering him a slacker like Crowler does. But in the few memories he had of them, they seemed to actually respect him.

Jades was ready to start a debate in his mind over his thoughts, but when he noticed that quite a number of students have began gathering, he paused.

"Damn... Lots of people are now here. It would be weird if I just sit here, in my own world, while blankly looking at the shelves. And Symrin and Haelery are going to get back soon. As much as I would want to wrap my head over what in the world is going on with my head, I have to wait. Maybe I could excuse myself and go somewhere to think. Or I could just ask them what is going on here. They surely had to notice something was off... Although I don't think they did, given how they were acting earlier... But it's not like I can just leave either..."

He then noticed his friends getting back.

"Guess asking them wouldn't hurt..."
12332112111221121111.title: With Jades

123321121112211211112.content:
Upon getting back, Jades greeted his friends.

"Hey guys. Did you finish what you wanted to do?"

"Yeah. We left Sadie a weird blank card I found this morning. She says it might be from a batch of misprinted cards that they were planning to return. None of us knew where it came from since I found it near the gates, but I guess now it's their job to figure that out."

"Blank card?", asked Jades to himself. "... Could it be...", but before he could ponder anymore, Haelery interrupted him.

"So we are thinking we should have lunch now."

"Lunch?"

"Yeah.", said Symrin. "We could eat after Crowler's class ends, but I think eating now is a better idea. And we can try the Golden Egg Challenge as well, as it wasn't won today yet."

"I... guess we could try."

"Then what are we waiting for? Let's go."

The three then headed towards the sandwich box. As they waited for some students to make some way for them to advance, as they too tried winning the challenge, more changes happened. Symrin's sleeves completely vanished, as he now had a sleeveless version of his uniform. It resembled the one Haelery had, except it looked like it was tailored to be sleeveless. Haelery's soon modified itself a bit as well as it became just the Symrin's. Also, his once dark-green undershirt which already started to blacken, conformed better on him as it began covering more of his chest.

As for Jades, his pants continued getting smaller as it reached the middle of his slender calves while it got once again tighter and the bluish hue was starting to get more visible. He found it mildly uncomfortable, but being distracted by his thoughts and the crowd in front of him, he let it pass for the moment.

After a couple more minutes of waiting for the crowd to not monopolize the sandwiches, a few students began to leave.

"Was about time. I know most of the sandwiches here are good, but they shouldn't be this frantic about them, huh Hanery?"

"Yeah. Even the Obelisk guys sometimes seem to forget about manners Samrin. What do you think Jadeis?"

"Huh...? Uh... yeah, sure."

Jadeis was getting quite confused by all that was happening. He brushed off the weird voices his friends seem to have as he thought he was hearing them wrong... or he maybe got too distracted with his worries that he forgot how they sounded for a second... But the whole name change was too weird for him. He was confused by the way they addressed each other, as they didn't sounded like they once did anymore... without finding odd how he himself was called.

"So...", started Jadeis, trying to get his mind out of his problems, without looking nervous in front of his friends. "What kind of sandwiches are you guys hoping for? Except the Golden Egg of course."

"Well... I don't mind the one with chicken or the steak ones. They are quite hardy and have nutrients... But I guess I could also roll for a vegetarian one as well."

"Oh, me too.", said Hanery. "As long as it is healthy, I am fine with it. The hamburger one, as tasty as it sounds, I may pass it on to someone else. I am on a diet."

Was again Jadeis was confused. He never thought he would hear either of his friends talk about healthy food, as was shocked when he heard that Hanery, who loved eating meat was going to skip on one... But the more he thought about it, the more natural it seemed to him why they would choose something healthy. His own preferences were starting to change. While he would love almost all things that could be inside, a desire of something more nutritious or even something more sweet began to fill his head.

In the meantime, Jadeis' hair almost became one color, the darker brown covered most of the lighter one, as it's original, slightly messy appearance was disappearing, becoming a lot more neater. He also began to feel his throat a little sore, but he ignored the feeling as it wasn't necessary too uncomfortable.

When their turn came, Jadeis prayed he would get the Golden Egg sandwich. He really needed something to distract him from this weird day.
123321121112211211112.title: Having lunch

1233211211122112111121.content:
Jadeis was praying he wouldn't get something like sardines or durian. While he doesn't usually mind them, he really wasn't in the mood for them right now... But his tastes were also gradually changing. He was now silently craving for something sweet as well, but the Golden Egg was the best option anyways, so he tried taking hat one. After a little bit of choosing, he picked one that was in the middle of the center pile, while Hanery and Samrin picked the ones next to it.

He unwrapped it and once he looked inside...

"Whoa! You actually got it!"

"Nice going!"

"Hehe... Thanks. But it was luck honestly.", replied Jadeis sheepishly in a slightly higher voice, his vocal chords starting to tighten. "What did you guys get?"

After looking at their sandwiches, both of them smiled.

"Yes! I got jam!", exclaimed Samrin. "I heard Ms Dorothy picked a sugar-free one this week for the filling, so I am excited to try it out."

"I got mixed vegetables.", said Hanery. " I was really up for something like this. I know I will like it."

Jadeis was once again confused by Hanery's tastes. He could understand Samrin liking something sweeter, but regardless, the fact that they didn't any any meat and do not seem bothered at all really stood odd to him. Right now however, he just wanted to dig in, trying to forget all these weird happenings that were going on.

Once he took a bite, and was immediately charmed by the taste. The flavor, texture and creaminess of the yoke were really doing a great job to distract him from his troubles.

"That chicken really hit the mark this time as well. It's as good as always... I just hope I won't put on much weight from eating all these egg sandwiches."

Right as that thought occurred, his thighs expanded a little, as along with the mass that came from his calves, they also filled up a little on their own, getting a little bit of fat over his changing muscles. Also, his pants grew higher once again on his legs, as they were now just below his knees.

"Huh? Why would I think about getting fat? I am fit and I do exercise. And why would I even care about that? It's not like people look at me expecting to look nice or anything... Whatever, just focus on eating Jadeis. The weird thoughts come later.", he murmured to himself as he continued indulging himself.

His friends were also enjoying their meals. Despite the fact that they were quite into their picks, when usually they would just be okay with them. But now, they were liking the fillings quite a lot, a sign, that like Jadeis, their preferences were changing. And just like him, they began getting thoughts of maintaining themselves fit and athletic, but this time, they weren't brushing them, and were actually embracing them.

As they ate, their figures continued changing. Other than their waists compressing a little, their build was also altering. Samrin was once again getting taller, this time stopping with just half a head below Jadeis, giving him a slim physique for the moment, while Hanery didn't get any smaller, but his skin tone lightened up once more. His tanned appearance was now starting to look like a distant memory as his skin was not just a two or three shades darker than his friends. Also, his muscles were really fading out as well, more so his pectoral area, which became quite small, his build beginning to look like Samrin's. The only regions which still had some developed muscles were his abdomen, legs and arms.

After finishing up their meals, Jadeis was about to start talking when he noticed the changed look his friends had.

"Now that was good!"

"Yeah. I am full now. What about you Jadeis?"

"Uh... Yeah. Me too."

"Well, let's head back now. We could chat some more on our way back."

As the three were leaving, Jadeis was really weirded out right now. But there was something else that was bothering him.

"They... look different. I know it. But... why exactly can't I say what's wrong?... They look wrong... right?"

His thoughts were starting to get muddled, as his original memories were starting to contradict with his current ones. But he kept quiet for the moment. He really wanted to just figure it all out right now. But he knew that if he started asking all the questions on his mind, he would be the one that would seem crazy.
1233211211122112111121.title: He gets it

12332112111221121111212.content:
There were many things that didn't make sense to Jadeis at the moment. Not only that his friends were looking different and even their voices were sounding higher than he could remember, but their mannerisms were different, the usually meek Samrin getting bolder, while Hanery becoming more polite as the two seemed to be taken by an aura which made them unaware what was really going on. As for himself, Jadeis was no longer able to communicate with the spirits anymore... And yet, he somehow managed to remain calm and not question aloud all the weird things that were going on. But it was more than just him not freaking out, becoming more composed as the changes progressed, but certain things were starting to make sense to him and thus, he didn't freak out as much as before.

He was so distracted by his thoughts that he didn't notice his friends shaking their hips as they walked, or that he was slowly starting to walk the same like them. With the need to use the restroom, he found an opportunity to also figure things out.

"Can we stop and go to the bathroom?"

"Sure. There is some time left. We will wait for you."

"Thanks."

When they reached the bathrooms, Samrin and Hanery were seemingly going to the women's, before they shook their heads and followed Jadeis to the men's bathroom, something which he noticed. Once inside, he went for a stall as the others waited for him at the sink. Once inside, he found a strange urge to sit down, but he simply complied to it, not feeling in the mood for any other distractions. While doing his business, he recalled all the weird things that happened so far.

"Okay, so what in the world is going on? First they tell me to be more attentive during class, then they leave without me last break, and now they want to eat vegetables? I know people say that time changes you, but this is ridiculous... And what about their look? I know they don't look normal... but why can't I discern what exactly is off about them?... Is this supposed to be a prank or something? Oh, I hope not. Atticus alone is enough to make me lose my patience, I don't need someone else messing with me..."

During his thought process, his thighs thickened further, as they began to create some discomfort for his manhood. He repositioned himself on the seat, ignoring a cushy sensation that was now being felt. Unknown to him, his butt also began to fill out, but there was still a way to go until its final size. But all these things didn't matter too much as Jadeis realized something.

"Huh? How did Atticus pop up in there? First I can't call Kuriboh and now this? And what about Atticus? His jokes are pretty funny, and he's an awesome guy. Sure, he can get a little carried away with some of his ideas at times, but not all of them are so bad... I don't know why sometimes Alexis doesn't cut him some slack and..."

A small headache prompted him to stop his train of thought as he rubbed his temples with his smaller fingers. As he did, his sleeves receded further, now being halfway to his upper arms as the red on the blazer began fading out.

"Although... It doesn't respect people's privacy and choices when he thinks about stuff like becoming a singer and all that... As fun as it is to be around him, it sure can be irritating at times too...", grumbled Jadeis under his breath.

When he finished, he was upset that he didn't figure anything out, but decided to observe things further for a while longer before he could inquire about what's been going on. He pulled up his boxers and pants, which were now tighter on him, before leaving to meet up with his friends.
12332112111221121111212.title: Bathroom break

123321121112211211112121.content:
While Jadeis was in doing his business, Samrin and Hanery were waiting for him at the mirror.

"So... what was going on earlier? Why did we tried to go to the women's bathroom?"

"I don't know. Maybe we were a bit too distracted with our conversation that we didn't notice."

"Maybe, yeah..."

"By the way, don't you think Jadeis is acting a bit strange?"

"What do you mean? Is it about the way he seemed to get flustered and a bit confused today?"

"Yeah... That is odd, but that's not what I am referring to... I mean, wasn't he sleeping during the first class?"

As the conversation went on, their tops became fully black as Hanery's also grew to cover his neck, becoming an exact replica as the top Samrin was wearing.

"Oh yeah... I noticed it too. Was he tired? From what I understood she watched an international Dueling competition or something like that."

"Honestly... I know he loves Dueling, but it is getting a bit out of hand. He knows that today was a day he had to come, so then why...?"

"I guess that's a question to ask him once the day is over. Next we have Crawler's lesson, and despite his position, he is a bit with his heads in the clouds lately."

"Maybe it's because he went back from being the principal to being a teacher. Or maybe he needs some time to get in the stride again after the tournament."

"Probably... But still, his lessons are usually not that exciting. I know he promised this one would be good, but I am a bit on the fence with this one... Still I am sure Jadeis will handle it nicely. He did answer that question perfectly earlier after all."

"Yeah, I am sure he'll manage."

Their perception of Jadeis was gradually changing, as although they weren't getting as close as they originally were, they still were seemingly getting a higher level of respect towards him than when the first class started. This was partially because in their minds, Jadeis was quite smarter now. While there were some inconsistencies with how he still sleeps and even runs late at times, in their mind, he was becoming a smart and studious student of the academy.

When Samrin took a quick glance at the mirror, Hanery did the same as both had a slightly curious look on their faces.

"Say, before you said that we looked weird right?"

"Yeah. I feel like we look better than before, but still something seems off."

Their facial appearances were something that worried the two before, even if their hair was a bigger priority for them at the beginning. While they didn't seem to mind the hair as much as before, their faces seemed off to them. Without even noticing, their eyes got a bit bigger, giving them a slightly more innocent look as their eyelashes grew a bit longer, though they weren't done changing. As for their hair, Samrin's was now almost fifty percent brown as his hair grew a bit longer, all of the spikes he had before now facing downwards. As for Hanery, his mane didn't get longer except for his ponytail, which grew a bit, adding a bit more volume to its wildly look, while his puffy hairdo didn't change much, except for a few bangs in the front which got a bit spiky. Also, Samrin's glasses suddenly vanished, blinking a few times as his eyesight was restored, while Hanery's former bandanna became a regular red hair-tie.

"We do look a bit different. But maybe it's just us...", said Samrin. "We thought something was off before, but now that I look again, I don't see anything wrong with my hair. I mean, it is a bit short, but still..."

"Me too. I guess it was because I forgot to tie my hair..."

The two still had a few unanswered questions, but when they heard Jadeis getting out, they welcomed him back. He looked dazed for them for a second, as he slowly went to wash his hands. They exchanged a quick look of worry, before Jadeis dried his hand with a paper towel and then leaving together with him.
123321121112211211112121.title: With Samrin and Hanery

1233211211122112111121212.content:
Jadeis wanted to ask a hundred things. Not only did the weird thoughts about Atticus persisted, as besides the image of friendship, an idea that he was acting goofy and silly was slowly forming in his head, but the look of their friends really threw him off.

"What's going on?!", he asked himself. "What happened to Samrin's glasses? And their hair... I know for sure Hanery wouldn't style his hair like that... But... why does a part of me think it is normal...? Is it tied somehow to my thoughts about Atticus?"

While thinking, his hair became a full dark-brown, the original light-brown being completely overtaken. On top of that, the color began to lighten slightly, a few strands turning a really dark blond color. as a bang in the front of his head started to get a bit longer than the rest of his hair. Also, Samrin's and Hanery's hips continued growing wider as well, straining their pants even more.

"That's it. I have to ask them."

Just before Jadeis could have the chance to ask, his friends turned towards him with a slightly concerned expression, as Samrin asked him:

"Hey Adeis... Me and Hinedy were wondering if you are feeling okay..."

"Yeah... We saw you pretty out of it during the first class. Samin said you maybe were just tired, but... is there anything else that happened?"

Adeis was not as confused about the new name he was addressed, but by rather the question.

"They are ones acting weird, and they call me for that?", mumbled Adeis under his breath before replying back. "What makes you think something like that?"

"Well, we saw you sleeping during first class. I know you are usually someone who doesn't do that except when the lesson is indeed boring, but..."

"It might be just us, but it's not inspired to sit in a place where the teacher sees you sleeping. But, why exactly were you snoozing off? The lesson itself wasn't so bad."

This was getting ridiculous for Adeis. He swallowed the way how the two chewed him on this morning, but getting told that sleeping during class wasn't his thing was plain stupid. And he knew he couldn't sit in a place where he couldn't be seen as he had to sit in the front.

"What's up with them? They are not making any sense. Why are..."

His thoughts were obscured by a quick wave of vertigo that came as fast as the headache in the bathroom. His thoughts were getting a bit muddled in this time, as certain aspects were now changing in his head. Firstly, he began to stop considering himself a Slifer, as thoughts of being in another dorm were forming in his head. His memories of himself always dozing off in class were gradually replaced of ones where he paid attention, answered the teacher's questions and taking notes. He didn't knew where these memories were coming, but was having a hard time telling himself these were not true. Lastly, a few more memories about Atticus, spending time with him before attending the academy were now being created in his mind as well.

Meanwhile, aside from his lightening blazer, the white line at the chest level, as well as the collar began turning blue, as the pants his friends were shrank once again, this time until they were at the level of their thighs, getting ever tighter on them as their color almost became fully blue.

"Is something wrong...?", asked Samin a bit worried.

"No, I'm fine. I... stood late last night to watch a tournament, that's all. I may be just a bit tired, but that's all, I can assure you."

"Okay, if you say so..."

"This should be a lesson for you. Stop staying late in the night. Even if it is a great Duel on TV, you need to relax. Especially if there is going to be classes the next day."

"Right... Noted..."

"Oh, now don't be mad at us. We were just worried."

"I am not mad. Thanks guys..."

The two smiled at him as Adeis also gave a weak smile. His mind was in chaos right now, but he didn't gave up on figuring out what was going on. As soon as the vertigo stopped, he thought that the fact that he was recalling events with Atticus before entering the academy, might be a good starting point as to what may be going on. Fortunately, he had plenty of time to think. As long as he will not fall asleep and Crowler won't yell at him, he had enough time to sort his thoughts out.
1233211211122112111121212.title: Samrin asks first

12332112111221121111212121.content:
The three soon got back to the classroom, the other students also returning back. Adeis waved to Samin and Hinedy as he went for his seat, not noticing that the two once again went to a different row, this time right in the middle of the Obelisk students. While going down, Adeis felt like his seat wasn't that down, and instead he was supposed to be higher. He shook his head, before going to the place his mind told him to: among the Ra students.

Soon afterward, Crowler entered the class, his voice being loudly heard through the microphone.

"Ahem! Soon we will enter a new year. And for some of you, this will be your last year at the academy. Nonetheless, we will continue to give all the knowledge that we have been invested with to pass on to you, so that you will become great Duelists one day. For those that are here right now, allow me to unofficially welcome to the new semester!", said Crowler, the class slightly impressed by his small hint of consideration. "Anyway, this class is held for those whose studies were interrupted by the incident with the Society of Light, as well as those who either didn't had good grades or performances this year. For the former, I am happy to tell you that a shortened version of the curriculum will be handed down to you about the studies you missed, but you will not be asked to take a test about the subjects. As for the remaining ones... well I suggest you start studying and not always sit on your bums, looking at others Duel, otherwise you will all end as a bunch of slackers."... And soon all the students sweat-dropped at the comment. "Now let's begin today lesson, shall we?"

Adeis wasn't too impressed by the whole speech, but has the feeling that Crowler is a bit more mellow than last year, although this could be just his imagination. He then decided to try and think things through once more.

"Okay... So why do they believe I am the weird one? Can't they see how weird they are? I mean... Sure I might be a bit sleepy after last night, but I needed to rest a bit... Although I guess it was kind of rude... I hope I didn't make the teacher too mad with that... Whatever, I still need to figure out what's the deal with Atticus and him appearing in my memories. I swear I haven't met him before the academy... Did I? Why is it so hard to remember? This can't be just from my tiredness... Hold on. Am I forgetting something? I fell like there was something else that was off... Ugh, I can't concentrate with Crowler talking."

Adeis began having trouble focusing, as Crowler's booming voice was heard. While trying to focus, his hips began expanding, gradually stretching outwards along with his pelvis as a soft layer of fat was forming over them. Also, his thighs finished growing as they even became a bit bigger than the ones his friends had.

Crowler began talking about different strategies to quickly Fusion Summon, and using other cards than Polymerization. He started mentioning various ways to summon Fusion Monsters as the students became a bit more interested in the lesson.

Back with Samin and Hinedy, while they paid a relative amount of attention towards to the lesson, they also listened to the small talk the Obelisk students had. As the subject of the Obelisk tournament for the newcomers was brought back, the two couldn't help but sigh dreamily at some of the boys.

"We sure are fortunate to have such gentlemanly guys around huh?"

"Yeah. And they are good looking as well. I wonder if they would want us as partners for the Duels."

"I sure hope so. How else are we supposed to impress them if we don't Duel?", giggled Samin as Hinedy joined in with the laughter.

While giggling, their butts began to enlarge, as they slowly rose on their seat and their thighs also grew nice and shapely, just a bit smaller than Adeis. Their boxers also grew even tighter on them, as the material began softening, and a bit of their legs shrinking down.

Meanwhile, Adeis was having trouble concentrating, as Crowler's voice was disrupting them. He also couldn't help as he also had a small desire to actually listen for some reason. In that time, his pants grew higher on him once again, stopping at around knee level. With a sigh, he told himself:

"Screw it. I can't focus. I guess I just need to wait until the class is over... And who knows, maybe this will help me in future Duels as well.", he thought with a faint smile on his face.
12332112111221121111212121.title: Back in class

123321121112211211112121211.content:
Deciding there is nothing to lose, and since sleeping isn't an option at this class, Adeis decided to just listen to the lesson. He knew he would always use a strategy to bring out Fusion Monsters regardless, so listening would prove beneficial anyway.

He settled to just pay attention to what Crowler said, as he currently left his troubling thoughts behind a little to see if he could enjoy the class. As he listened, his top he wore under his blazer became tighter on him, becoming a little more formfitting, while the red on the blazer faded a out more, now being a really pale tone.

As for his friends, who were also partially listening, and also thinking about their plan to the welcoming party, their clothes also changed as their blazers became fully white as their rears slowly expanded further.

"So what Deck will you use for the party?", asked Hinedy

"Well of course I will use the brand new one I made and managed to keep it a secret from everyone. What about you? You switched a few up in the past, but you seem to have stayed recently with that Burn Damage one."

"I guess I do. But it felt really good to use that Deck with a bunch of good-looking guys too. I may use it for the ceremony too. I mean, I must show that I can handle something more diverse."

"If you say so. I will just stick with my Harpies. It's about time the guys to get blown off by some wind."

The two giggled a little as their voices also grew another octave, becoming somewhat similar to the voices of another two students they knew, but they never noticed.

As for their conversation, their Decks were also gradually changing, Samin's Roid Cards being gradually replaced with Harpy ones, while Hinedy's Dinosaur Deck was being changed into a Burn Damage one.

The lesson continued, as Crowler went through various methods to use to Fusion Summon, and then listing several cards and archetypes that would benefit from the mentioned techniques.

"And now, we will talk about a special type of Fusion. It is called Contact Fusion. It is made by returning the Fusion Material Monsters from your Field to your Deck without the use of any other cards. The times you can use this type of Fusion it isn't restricted by a number of times, thus if you have the possibility, use the method to bring out your stronger Monsters. A type that is being used is... Neo Spacians...", said Crowler with a grumble, reminding himself of a certain "Slifer slacker" before resuming: "And the Gladiators, a new archetype currently being produced by Industrial Illusions that will have this mechanic. The Cards will be released soon for the public, but when they are, I suggest you learn about them, as the aforementioned method of Fusion if surely going to become really useful."

Adeis couldn't help but laugh a little upon seeing Crowler's grumble, as he watched him.

"Man, he is sure isn't happy talking about this. Well it was to be expected. There is no way he could talk about Contact Fusion without mentioning the Neo Spacians. I am just surprised he didn't turn to look at me when he said that though. I would have expected at least an irritated glare or something.", thought Adeis.

In reality, Adeis wasn't for Crowler someone he should glare at. In fact, he hold a degree of respect for him as he was becoming someone who in his opinion deserved respect.

"Huh, but still... Gladiators, eh? I wonder what they will be like. Well, I am sure I am going to find out, since I am going to Duel whoever is going to pick them up...", told Adeis to himself as he felt a slight tingle in his abdomen as his waist pinched in a little. "And I guess I could use a Ritual Monster or two to mix things up as well."

He didn't notice where that comment came from, as he didn't use Ritual Monsters, but for him it was natural to think that. Inside his Deck, Elemental Hero Neos turned to Cyber Angel Benten.
123321121112211211112121211.title: Listening

1233211211122112111121212111.content:
"Now then, I have a question for you all.", began Crowler with a grin on his face. "The Wicked Dreadroot is on the opponent's field, who has 2500 LP. Having only 100 LP, please state 3 methods to win in one turn by using only Neo-Spacian or Hero related cards and Contact Fusion. And all those times, the win must be brought by a different Fusion Monster. Those who think they can answer raise your hands!"

The question wasn't particularly easy, but a handful of students did raise their hands. Adeis never actually encountered someone using The Wicked Dreadroot, so he didn't actually knew three methods. Also, his familiarity with the archetype was slowly slipping away as well, making it even harder to think of the possibilities. Just when he was about to give up, and somehow manage to avoid getting a scolding from Crowler for not knowing his own Deck properly, new knowledge flooded his mind. Just like with the question from before, Adeis seemed to gain more information about the various cards and effects, thus giving him a better insight. He initially had zero prior knowledge of something like this, usually learning from Duels rather than textbooks, but currently his mind was slowly developing.

Ignoring a small discomfort in his throat, and a feeling of tightness as his boxers became tighter on him, just like his pants, Adeis raised his hand too. Scanning the room for the people who raised their hands, Crowler spotted Adeis, and with a small smile, told him to stand up.

"Well Adeis, if you know the answer please tell us."

"Certainly.", said Adeis compliantly, as he stood up, answering in a slightly higher pitched than before, the tone being almost different from his original one. "The first option is simple. First use Grand Mole and Neos to summon Grand Neos to return Dreadroot to the hand and then attack the opponent directly with Grand Neos. Then you can call forth Air Neos and with its effect, increase it ATK to 3600 and then with Neo Space to 4100 ATK. After destroying Dreadroot, use Contact Out to call back Neos and Hummingbird and then land the finishing blow with Neos. Lastly use Dark Panther and Neos to summon Dark Neos to cancel out the effect of Dreadroot. The by using Skyscraper and H-Heated Heart, you attack, and force a tie. But then by using Reverse of Neos, you can call back Elemental Hero Neos to land the finishing blow."

Crowler and the rest of the class couldn't help but clap upon hearing the answer.

"Marvelous. You truly are a prodigy in this Adeis. That is absolutely correct. There are different methods as well, but all the ones you mentioned are true. Truly, a superb display."

Adeis couldn't help but blush a little at Crowler's praise, as he sat down. He certainly wasn't expected to hear him out of all people congratulate him on a job well done.

"Man, this sure is great. I don't know where all that came from, but I am sure happy that I answered right.", thought Adeis smiling, without noticing that his face took on a much rounder shape, his features starting to soften.

Back with Hinedy and Samin ,the two also clapped loudly for their friend. As they did, they felt some discomfort in their shoulders, thus they moved their arms a little to try and alleviate the pain. The ache soon disappeared as they stopped clapping, as their shoulders rounded out, and their arms became long and thin, with Hinedy still having a little muscle on them visible. Also, their underwear lost a little more of their legs as the material continued getting softer.

"Man, he nailed it once again."

"You could say that again. I am really not surprised by how great he did. He is smart, and really professional when answering as well."

"Yeah! He just needs to find a better passtime."

"Totally. Just hanging out at the Slifer dorm all the time is really boring. I mean, there are so many other places to check out. I really wonder why he goes there sometimes."

Their thoughts and opinion about the red dorm were now changing a lot, from being a second home to actually being a place they don't want to frequent too much. And for Samin his former memories of spending a year there were now disappearing as well. New thoughts of spending time at the blue dorm were instead appearing, with even the memories of being in Ra were now beginning to fade away.
1233211211122112111121212111.title: Crowler asks a question

12332112111221121111212121112.content:
Adeis was slowly starting to let himself relax bit by bit as the lesson progressed. While he still had his doubts over a few thinks and had plenty of unanswered questions, they didn't seem as important right now. Other than his thoughts regarding Atticus, most of his problems didn't seem as urgent as they were before. And even his memories about Atticus, despite a few being kind of odd or out of place, with some even somehow managing to trace all the way back to his childhood, weren't as troubling as they were before, as new flashbacks of time spent together before attending the academy were slowly filling his mind.

"... I don't know why I was so panicked before. Sure, I kind of what to know what the deal with Samin and Hinedy is, but I guess it can wait. It isn't as if there is a time limit or anything. I guess they also thought I was being odd also by seeing my reactions. I guess I just need to take a breather and try to enjoy the lesson, even if it is Crowler the one who's talking.. But was that thought from before, about me forgetting something important...? Eh, maybe it was just my imagination. Or maybe it was another memory with Atticus, or something like that. Anyway, I guess it can wait until I talk with the guys.", thought Adeis, in a more composed state of mind.

What was he forgetting was in fact, the other big issue he discovered: not being able to talk with Duel Monster spirits. However, with his memories gradually changing, the thought of himself being able to communicate with the spirits was vanishing step by step, with currently not being able to recall if he actually did this before. As proof of that, more cards in his Deck changed to new ones, with Elemental Hero Avian becoming Etoile Cyber.

The lesson continued as Crowler then moved to different archetypes that use Fusion Monsters to Fusion Summoning by banishing Monsters, a strategy Chazz was known using. In the meantime, the changes progressed further for all three boys. The pants Adeis wore finished becoming dark-blue as they climbed even further up his legs, now resting at about his lower-thigh. Also, his hips were also almost done growing, as were about the same size his friends had. Lastly, his complexion changed a bit as well, his skin becoming a bit paler, but more peachy in the process.

As for his friends, their butts finished inflating, becoming big bubble-shapes as their waists were gradually reworked, slowly becoming less and less broad, almost finishing their hourglass-figures. Also, at the exit of their now sleeveless blazers, two round blue circles appeared, as the region became a bit thicker to be more visible.

Unlike Adeis, who was now actually entranced by the lesson, the other two would talk to each other, without drawing too much attention to themselves as more thoughts appeared in their heads and more cards got replaced.

"Anyway, what are your plans for today after class?"

"Actually, I don't know Samin. I was thinking hanging out with the guys a little to hear about that party they were planning, but I guess until Crowler gives his approval, I should wait a little bit. I doubt he would let us the entire dorm for any festivities outside the formal ones. The party they give is nice and classy, but I feel it can get a bit monotone. it isn't too exciting, but it is the one he always does."

"You never know. He seems a lot more open this time around. I don't know if it is after going back to being a teacher or he simply had a revelation, but it could be possible. And who knows? Maybe he will like the ideas we bring out.... But I will see tomorrow what they are talking about. I need my beauty sleep after waking earlier than usual. Not only did we had to help for laundry day, but now we had to come here just because we weren't that great in the tournament."

"Well, it's not so bad, as it isn't as stressful as the regular schedule and some of the things they talked about was actually useful... But I agree with you. We didn't join the Society of Light or whatever was that group called, so we shouldn't actually be here."

Their memories changed further, as instead of providing support for Adeis, they actually came to class because they didn't make it too far in the tournament instead. Their pasts changed more as well, as more memories changed into new ones, with Samin's perception of Zane also changing, starting to find him a bit handsome and Hinedy enjoying chatting more than exercising.
12332112111221121111212121112.title: Enjoying the lesson

123321121112211211112121211121.content:
As the lesson, ended Crowler went to the microphone to give his parting words for the day.

"Thank you for coming here today. Even if it isn't something that originally planned, I am happy to see there are people who take studying seriously. The whole Society of Light incident is now over, thus I suggest we try to move on into the new year without anything to hold us back. Once again, thank you for attending. But as a reminder to everyone, no one will be spared from future examinations, especially the ones who performed poorly in the tournament."

The whole class sweat-dropped as Crowler gave his ending speech, not knowing what to think of the combination of gratitude with the stern remark at the end. It surely looked like he wanted to get closer to the students, but it was clearly visible that some tendencies are hard to give up on. Before he took his leave, he took a quick glance at Adeis and gave a small unnoticeable grin.

"Glad to see he still in top form."

As soon as Crowler left, students also began leaving, happy they didn't got chewed on too harshly today from what happened at the tournament. Samin and Hinedy stood up and were waiting for Adeis, ready to leave to their dorm. However, as they waited three Obelisk students approached them.

"Hey Sasmine, Hindy."

"Oh, hi. Did something happen?"

"No, actually we were looking for you. We decided to hold a small tournament to welcome the new students at Obelisk this year. We will make a petition and we are trying to find as many people as we can to convince Crowler and the principal."

"It doesn't have to be at the opening ceremony.", said another student. "We can ask them for the next night or in a day there aren't classes. What do you say?"

While it seemed odd to ask someone who isn't part of the Obelisk dorm for their support, reality changed a lot since the changes started, and currently the two were actually part of the blue dorm now.

As they talked, a small cape appeared from the back of their blazers, as their hair grew a bit longer, with Sasmine's hair now almost touching his shoulders as the color became 75 percent brown as Hindy's hair grew a bit longer, the hair in the ponytail now reaching his mid-back almost as the color was closing on being an ashen shade.

"Sure. We would be happy to help.", said Hindy with a smile.

"But you must let us be part of the exhibition matches.", continued Sasmine.

"Well, aren't we demanding, are we?", replied a student jokingly. "But sure. If you wish to be part of the tournament, we will be happy to let you. And I'm curious what new Deck you've made up Sasmine that you are hiding it up until now."

"Well just wait and see.", replied the boy with a grin.

Adeis on the other hand, also left his seat, but was feeling like his back was a bit stiff and sore.

"Huh? I didn't know just sitting a few hours could make by back hurt a little."

He pushed his back forwards as he massaged it, trying to get rid of the ache. As he was rubbing his back, the sleeves of his top and blazer retracted completely, with the blazer having a blue lining where his arms came out. When he finished, the stiffness was gone, but now his back was arched forward, his spine now being a lot more flexible.

"There, much better. There have been a lot of weird things going on today, but I am glad that the tiredness from this morning is gone. I feel kind of refreshed right now for some reason. It really was from that nap?... I guess it doesn't matter. I don't want to make them wait for me."

He then walked towards the exit, but noticed that his friends were chatting with some boys from the blue dorm. When Sasmine noticed him, he gestured to him:

"Hey Adleis! Come on over!"

"Oh boy...", mumbled Adleis under his breath as he didn't notice once again how was he called. "I sure hope they aren't roping me in in another one of their schemes."
123321121112211211112121211121.title: Plans for the day

1233211211122112111121212111211.content:
Adleis nervously joined Sasmine and Hindy as the students next to them were looking at him expectantly. He hoped the two didn't accept to just spend the time with these guys and said he will join them in whatever idea they had for today.

"So... what's up guys?"

"Well, they have a great idea for you during the next welcoming party."

"Please don't let it be singing...", murmured Adleis.

"Do you wish to be a trainer for the tournament?"

"Huh?"

"We want to organize some matches for the new students of Obelisk, and we want to ask the teachers and the principal if they can let us have the main hall for the tournament. And we were thinking you could be a sort of teacher for the new guys. I mean, you are smart, are a great Duelist and you seem like a great person they could learn from. Sasmine and Hindy recommended you for the task. What do you say?"

Despite wishing his friends would stop making decisions for him, the idea itself wasn't sounding too bad. He was really up to test the newcomers, and he would surely enjoy Dueling just for fun. And somehow, the notion of himself teaching others and giving tips wasn't sounding too bad either. But there was something that bugged him.

"Why exactly do they need me for this? I mean, Chazz could be a better option. He won the tournament after all, and he is very popular right now. But is it okay for them to ask this for people outside the blue dorm? I mean, I am..."

Adleis's mind seized up for a second as his confusion about what dorm was he in was slowly starting to get clearer. In that time, his waist pinched in further as his hips finished growing, as together with his rear, they formed a figure that would be envied by a lot of girls. Also, his blazer became fully white, if it wasn't for the line on his chest and the collar which were continuing turning dark-blue.

The other boys believed Adleis was pondering on the idea, but Sasmine and Hindy looked at him a bit concerned, remembering his pauses from before. Their changes also went on as whatever soreness they had in their throat vanished as their vices went higher one last time. As for their underwear, as they continued shrinking, their design was starting to change. Sasmine's simple white design was beginning to grow some thin baby-blue lines while Hindy's camouflage design vanished, becoming a dull dark-green before the color began to lighten.

Back to Adleis, his mind was starting to recover, the fog in his head starting to clear. The time he spent at the red dorm was now mostly reduced to just visits, as he now recalls being part of Obelisk Blue. On top of all that, more memories of himself and Atticus appeared in his head, with more and more seemingly being from his childhood years. But at this point, he had an urge to just consider everything normal, as he had trouble finding anything wrong with how his memories played out in his head. Inside his Deck, Elemental Hero Burstinatrix became Blade Skater as well.

"That sure came out of nowhere... I hope it was just a small vertigo and nothing else... But should I really accept the offer? I mean, it would be a great experience, but I don't want to come out as bossy or in need of attention for the others. The fact that I have a fan club is already worrying... Still, it could be a good practice to know how to teach..."
1233211211122112111121212111211.title: The proposal

12332112111221121111212121112111.content:
Initially Aldeis wanted to think over the whole situation, as well as trying to get a grip on the mess with his head, but the idea of being a teacher to other students began to sound more and more enticing to him. Sure, it would be a nice thing to do and it would make him gain some popularity, but at the moment, all he was thinking was all the good experience he could gain by doing this. He never actually considered teaching as a career for his future, but he was slowly starting to think it would be amazing to be a teacher. Ignoring a slight tingle in his vocal chords, he answered back:

"Okay, I guess I will." He didn't notice his once again changed voice, which right now started to resemble someone else's. Someone he knew. "I don't know how good I'll be. But I will give it a try."

"Great. Then it's settled. Now all we need is to have the hall for us for half a day or so.", said one of the students. "Once again, thanks. Once we see if we can convince the teachers, we will tell you."

The three noted as the small group left. Sasmine and Hindy giggled a little after they left. As they did, their waists finished slimming down, as Hindy's muscles faded a bit more in that region. Their shoulders also rounded out, as their new forms were one step closer to completion.

"Might I ask what is so funny?", asked Aldeis, not amused at all.

"We were just laughing a little at how predictable your answer was. We were sure you would accept."

"Well you could warn me before you make decisions in my name. You seem to be doing this a lot lately."

"But it's not like it's a bad thing. You always said you wanted some practice training others. And we thought how great this opportunity would be for you."

"We admit the offer came a bit sudden, but we knew you were up for it."

"Thanks... I guess.", answered Aldeis a bit flattered.

"And it's not like it's something fishy like the stunts Atticus likes to pull off... And we thought you could benefit a little. After all, talking with boys should be a priority for you as well."

Aldeis simply rolled his eyes at the remark. While it was true that some of the ideas Atticus came up with were being more childish, stupid or crazy, including one where he remembered Atticus wanting to turn him into a singer, the part with the boys came out naturally to him. While spending time with boys might have been and still is something he does, he now quickly registers the message his friends are sending him.

"Really? Again? I thought I told you I am not interested in things like these."

"C'mon. It's like there is any harm in it."

"Of course there is. What if people start thinking I want to draw attention from the boys? It's already bad enough there are rumors about that. I don't need someone to think that."

"No one will think that. You've been here for over two years. It's pretty hard to change one's reputation without proof."

"And I will try to maintain appearances, so please don't think of plans of me being surrounded by boys, with them asking me for a match or anything else."

""Fine...", replied the two in unison.

During the conversation, Aldeis' hair grew once again longer, now resting at about his mid-back as its color changed to a sandy brown, on the verge transitioning towards blond in the process. As for his friends, their pant-legs finally gave out as they completely fused together, forming two small skirts, held in place by a small blue belt.

"So what are your plans for today?"

"We were thinking we should just head back to the dorm and relax a little."

"Already? But it's barely in the afternoon."

"We are just a bit tired. With the earlier wake-up call and the classes, we wan to take a small break."

Aldeis was not sure about the idea, as for some reason, he was feeling a lot more invigorated than in the morning. He didn't knew if it was because of his earlier nap or because of another reason, but for the moment, he just headed towards the dorm with Sasmine and Hindy, as he thought not just of another option to spend his afternoon, but also about his confusion from before.
12332112111221121111212121112111.title: He accepts

123321121112211211112121211121111.content:
The three exited the school and were now slowly going to the blue dormitory. As Sasmine and Hindy were chatting with each other, Aldeis stood a bit behind, to once again gather his thoughts. He then tried to review the whole situation one more time, but this time he was finding a lot more difficulty in doing so. Not only did his communication ability with the spirits was foreign to him now, he actually believed it was silly. And as for the praise he got from the teachers, he was now really believing that he was a hard-working student. The times of him sleeping or coming late to class were replaced with memories of him actually paying attention, taking notes and scoring high grades on tests, as his knowledge of the Duel Monster Game was even now expanding, as more information was developed into his mind.
