13133121.content:
The light died down, and things were obviously different for them. First, they had apparently swapped positions, with Yusei now standing where Akiza had been and Akiza standing where Yusei was. The second, and much more pronounced differece was their clothes.

Yusei now wore a red corset and skirt with short, puffy light green sleeves, and over the corset he wore a magenta coat. He also now wore black gloves were elbow length and thigh high socks of the same color and red high heeled pumps. Around his neck was a red chocker and a necklace with an emerald crested golden cross medallion, and rolled in the front of his hair was also a silver device. On his face, his criminal mark was not there.

Akiza now wore a long sleeved blue jacket with amber gems on the elbows and shoulders and under that was a sleeveless black shirt with a red design, and brown gloves. She also had black jeans and brown boots. On her face was also the yellow criminal mark that was now absent from Yusei's.

Both of them were now dressed in the other's clothes. And despite their different sizes, they fit them perfectly, as if they were what they were made for them.

As she took the sight before her in, Akiza recoiled back in surprise. "Wh-whats going on here?" she sputtered out. "What just happened? And why are you in my clothes? And why are you in mine!?"

"I have no idea." Yusei said, trying to remain calm and calm down the girl before him. "Just relax and lets figure this out. We won't figure anything out if you start freaking out."

Akiza breathed in deeply, and did as he said. "You're right. Freaking out won't solve anything."

"Okay, now lets try to figure this out." Yusei said. However, before they can discuss things further, they heard the door of the garage open, and two people enter.

"Geez, how many times do I have to tell you? Stop wasting our money at that damn coffe shop!" Crow yelled.

"And how many times do I have to tell you thet you can't tell me what I can and can't do!" Jack yelled back.

"Well maybe if you got a job and contributed to our finances it wouldn't be a problem. Oh, but wait, you can't hold a job. So stop wasting money on needless things!"

"How dare you insult Jack Atlas like that!"

The two of them shouted a bit more as they entered the main area of the garage. "Hey Yusei. Oh, and hey Akiza. Didn't know you stopped by." Crow said. Neither him nor Jack seemed to react to their current attire. They both just continued their argument.

Aki was a little surprised and confused that neither of them found her or especially Yusei's state of dress to be strange. Yusei on the other hand, while embarrassed by being seen like this, wanted to investigate it further. "Jack was at the coffee shop again, wasn't he?" he asked.

"Of course he was, Akiza! What else would he be doing? He doesn't work, he doesn't help out around here, all he does is waste the money that I earn!" Crow yelled, infuriating Jack and their argument intensified.

"Huh?" Akiza let out, furthering her confusion. Why had Crow just called Yusei by her name?

'I see. So then they seem to think I'm Akiza, and I would assume that they think that Aki is me. That would explain why they didn't react to what I am wearing.' he thought. He then glanced at the card in his hand. Ever since the flash of light, he had been holding the blank card. Somehow, it had switched him and Aki's places. "'Yusei.'" he said to Akiza as he put his hand on her shoulder, getting her attention. She was confused at first as to why he had caled her by his name but quickly caught on. "Lets leave these two to themselves for now. How about you and me head somewhere else. I was wondering if you could help me with something.

"Uh, o-okay." Aki replied.

Leaving Jack and Crow to their argument, the two made their way out of the garage. As they did, Yusei didn't really pay much attention his feet as he walked, so he didn't realize something. Despite never having worn shoes with heels before, he had no problem walking in the 3" pumps that were now on his feet. He stepped perfecty in them as if he wore them every day; he walked the exact same way that Aki had when she wore them, one foot in front of the other and his hips swayed.

They walked outside and started to head away from the garage, though they weren't heading anywhere in particular. "So what are we going to do, Yusei?" Akiza asked.

"I'm not really sure." Yusei said. "But from what I can tell, we've switched places. People think you're me and I'm you, and our clothes have been switched."

"How did this whole thing happen?"

"I'm not really sure, but I think it has something to do with the card you found." Yusei said, holding up the blank card in his hand.

"I feel like this is my fault. If I hadn't found that card and showed it to you, none of this would have happened."

"Hey, don't blame yourself." Yusei said. "Its not your fault."

"Anyway, what should we do right now, Yusei?" Akiza asked.

Yusei thought about the situation. They would need to try and find a way to fix this. But they didn't really have any leads on that, only the card that had caused it, and didn't know how to make it work again. They could try to find out more about the card. But without really knowing much about, they wouldn't really know where to start. They could just take it easy for now, but that had its own problems.People thought that they were each other, so they would have to pretend to be one another for now. Meaning he would have to go back to her place and act like he was her in front of her parents while she went back to the garage and pretended to be him with Jack and Crow. He didn't really want to, but if they couldn't fix the problem today, it would eventually come to that whether he wanted to or not, so it might not be a bad idea to start sooner than later.

As the light died down, Yusei groaned as he rubbed his head.

"What on earth was that...?" he muttered, as something suddenly had occurred to him; he was sitting down. That wouldn't be a cause for alarm, if everything didn't seem to be at the same height.

"Wh-wha...?" Yusei began, as he glanced around. Something was wrong, his chest feels off. Gulping he tentatively glanced downward.

And found himself staring at Akiza's impressive chest.

"WAAAH!!" Yusei screamed as he jumped to his feet... and promptly fell over, not used to his new center of balance. His scream, on the other hand, woke up Akiza, who immediately sat up.

"What is it? What's wrong?"

Spotting Yusei, Akiza's eyes grew to the size of dinner plates, when she saw his head perched atop her slender, shapely body. Her mouth quivered for a bit, as she tried to form words, before finally looking down at herself. And her fears were confirmed as she saw, a MALE body clad in Yusei's clothe, below her neck.

Unable to come up with anything to saw, Akiza's eyes rolled to the back of her head as she fainted.

"Great..." muttered Yusei as he quickly glanced around. Good, no one could see them. What to do now...?

As the flash of light died down, and their vision cleared, and the two looked around in confusion.

"Uh, that was pretty weird. What just happened?" Akiza wondered aloud. She spoke in a much different tone that she usually did, sounding more excitable and childish.

"I'm not quite sure." Yusei replied, also speaking with a tone different from his normal tone. In place of his generally impassive and reserved tone, he now used a gentle, soft and innocent tone.

"Well, whatever." she said as she crossed her arms as she walked over to the couch. "Nothing seem to have happened, anyway." she said as she sat down and put her her hands behind her head as she leaned back. Her posture and mannerisms were also different as well, being much more, for lack of a better term, 'boyish.'

"Well, it does seem that way." Yusei agreed as he walked over and took a seat next to her, and placed his hands in his lap. Like with Akiza, his mannerisms were also different as well, only in his case, his were now much more feminine and girlish.

"So, now what do we do? I'm bored now." Akiza moaned.

Yusei sighed. "Well then, want to go for a walk instead of being cooped up in the garage?" Yusei suggested.

"Sure, why not?" Akiza agreed, and with that, the two left the garage.

Unknown to the two, the card had actually done something, giving them a different personality in place of their own. Yusei now had the personality of Luna, while Akiza had Leo's. However, despite their strange behavior, neither Yusei nor Akiza noticed anything strange with how they were acting.

13133222222122221112.content:
As the light died down Yusei took his arm away from his face. Opening his eyes he was going to ask what happened, but instead was stopped by another question, what happened to his arm? Looking at his arm after lowering it from his face he saw not his regular blue jacket sleeve with amber orbs on the elbow and shoulder but instead a clean, tight suit sleeve. The smell of perfume filled his nose as he smelt it and realized it was coming off of him. Looking around for a second he realized that he was in an office. He was seated at a desk at the end of the room, but as he looked at his hand, he realized something wasn’t right.

Instead of his normal hand that was slightly tan in color he saw an almost ghost white feminine hand with long fingernails and dainty fingers. “What, how did I- Yusei cut himself off as he covered his mouth with his new girl fingers, realizing his voice was now womanly, completely womanly with no sign of masculinity in it at all. Looking to his right he saw a flock of blue hair hanging above his eye. Lifting a finger to touch it he realized that it was his hair.

Looking down, Yusei could see that his, or now her, chest was no longer covered by his signature jacket and his legs in jeans, but in a dark blue blouse that went down to the thighs over a white undershirt and skirt. The blouse also had a cape on its bottom that covered the back of her new legs. Feeling the weight on his chest he felt his new breasts. He saw that they were covered by his/her blouse’s v-neck.

On her feet she no longer wore her white socks and boots but was now barefoot in a pair of blue heels.

Finally Yusei felt something dangling on her ears. Touching his ears he felt an earring.

Yusei knew all of these traits looked familiar to him somehow. Whoever he became was familiar to him. It then hit him. He was Mina Simington. He realized that somehow his mind transferred with Mina’s body.

Moving Mina’s hand up and down it was clear that he was now in her body.

“That card did this” he said in Mina's voice with anger.

Getting up on her heels, Yusei practiced moving with Mina’s feet.

13133222222211112.content:
As the light down, Yusei instantly noticed that he was in a whole new location. No longer in his garage, he appeared to be outdoors, and in a field with a forest nearby. He also noticed that Akiza was nearby, and that she was no longer wearing her usual clothes, with them having been replaced by white and blue armor with a cape and a sword sheathed at her side.

"Akiza?" he asked, getting her attention, and she looked over to him, her eyes widening with surprise as she saw him.

"Yusei? What are you wearing?" she question.

Looking down, he saw he was wearing a large assortment of strange, and feminine garments and accessories. On his shoulders were small horned pauldrons worn over a floor length white and gold cape. He was also wearing a sleeveless white top with long, decorated gloves and a large belt that held a dagger on his side. He also wore gold and pink braces on his knees and light purple ankle boots. And though he couldn't see his face, his crminal mark was gone.

"Where are we and how did we get here? And what are we wearing?" Akiza questioned outloud.

"I don't know, but lets stay calm for now." Yusei said, sounding relaxed as he tried to think of what could have happened.

13133222222211222112.content:
As the flash of light died down, and Yusei's vision cleared, he found that he was standing in a different location. No longer in his garage, he appeared to be outdoors, and not anywhere he recognized as a part of New Domino City. The surrounding area looked nothing like it. It was seemingly in the middle of nowhere. Looking around, he spooted Akiza nearby, though he also instantly noticed that her attire had completely changed. Currently, she was dressed in a bluish-purple sleeveless shirt with matching pants, and a pair of boots on her feet. She also wore a pair of gloves, and a steel pauldron on her left shoulder. However, the most striking thing about her appearance was the huge sword strapped to her back. And strangely, she didn't seemed burden by its weight, when it was sure to be extremely heavy.

"Akiza." he said to get her attention.

"Yusei?" she said as she turned to look at him, and he saw confusion in her eyes. However, that confusion instantly changed to surprise when she saw him. "Um, what are you wearing?" she asked him.

Deciding to find out what she meant, he then looked down at what he was wearing, and discovered that he was dressed in a white tank top that exposed his midriff and black miniskirt. He also had on gloves that went up to his elbows, with a metal eblow guard on his left one, and a pair of boots. And though he could see his face, his crimal mark was absent from it, and he had a pair of teardrop shaped earings hanging in his ears.

"Just whats going on here?" Akiza asked him. "Why are we dressed like this?"

"I'm not sure." he replied, staying calm like he usually did. He knew it wouldn't do any good to panic. "But lets stay calm."

"Well, I guess it would be safe to asume that the card you found is responsible for this." Yusei said.

"I'm really sorry, Yusei..." Akiza responded.

"No, don't worry." Yusei reassured her. "Its not your fault. You didn't know."

"Yeah..." she said, a bit unconvinced.

"Anyway, ist possible that if the card did this, it can undo it." Yusei explained. "Unfortunately, it doesn't appear that we still have it on us."

"So then, now what do we do?" Akiza questioned.

"Well, lets look. We should find out just where we are."

"That sounds like a good idea." Akiza agreed.

Looking around, there didn't appear to be any towns in the immediate area. Yusei then looked down at himself once more. He would have to admit, he looked ridiculous in his current attire. They were clearly clothes meant for a woman, though he clearly was not one. Though it was a bit strange that they seemed to fit him perfectly. "Anyway, we should try to find a town. There, we should be able to learn aout where we are, and I can hopefully change out of these. Plus, we should try to find that card. If it brought us here, then hopefully it can send us back."

The two of them weren't aware just yet, but they had been affect by the light the card had emitted. And now, while they themselves wouldn't change, the world around them would. 1313322222222222111222.content:
Yusei and Akiza were quite shocked by what had happened to them. Just minutes ago, Yusei had been 19 and Akiza had been 17, and now, here the pair was, reduced to 12 years old. It was so strange, changing so drastically in such a short period of time. And to their four friends, nothing appeared to be any different.

They also hadn't noticed, but their clothing had changed. Yusei's resembled his old clothes almost exactly, only missing the orange "gems" that decorated his clothes. It was exactly what he used to where when growing up in Satelite. Akiza was wearing a magenta t shirt with floral patterns and a red skirt.

Akiza looked over at Crow and Jack who had walked upstairs. She still couldn't believe that this was happening. "Yusei? What should we do now?" she whispered.

Looking around, Yusei saw a picture of the six of them together. He recalled when it had been taken, though his memory of it and what the picture actually showed now were quite different. Previously, it had been a picture with the group standing in front of their four Duel Runners, with the twins holding their Duel Boards. In it now, there was only two Duel Runners, those being Jack and Crow's. And like their current situation, Yusei and Akiza had also changed, and were now in their new 12 year old bodies. Yusei was also holding a red Duel Board and standing next to him, Akiza was holding a magenta one, with the two boards vaguely resembling their former Duels Runners in some aspects. He also caught sight of a new picture next to it. In it, he saw his and Akiza's new younger selves standing with Leo and Luna, and several others children. The four of them, and all the rest, were all wearing the uniforms for New Domino's Duel Academy. It was most likely a class photo from the looks of it. 'I guess I'm a student there now." he thought to himself.

As if answering his thought, Leo spoke up. "So, Yusei, Akiza. You two wanna come back to our place and work on our homework? We'll all get done faster if we help each other out." he said.

Luna sighed. "Leo, you just want to try and copy Yusei's like usual." she said, and Leo laughed nervously at the accusation.

Giving it a moments though, Yusei replied.

13133222222222221122121.content:
As the light faded, both Yusei and Akiza checked themselves over and were revealed to find that they seemed perfectly fine.

"What was that Yusei?" asked Akiza, hoping her boyfriend would have some answer.

"I don't really know Aki," replied Yusei as he checked over the card. What really concerned Yusei now was that the card was now completely blank. He feared that whatever energy the card had was now lost forever. Only time would tell what would happen.

"Well, hopefully it was just a trick of light or something," said Akiza as she looked over the card with Yusei. "So, Yusei, what would you like to do now?"
13133222222222221122121.title: Yes.

131332222222222211221211.content:
"Why don't we head over to Leo and Luna's place? I promised Leo I would duel him if he managed to get a decent grade on a recent test," said Yusei as he started putting a few things away and preparing to leave the garage.

"Sure, sounds like a fun idea. If he loses, I can make him dress like Luna," said Akiza as she started up Yusei's duelrunner and waited for him to get on.

Yusei smiled at Akiza's statement, "Yeah. That'll definitely make him want to win the duel then." The two duelist laughed as Yusei finished his clean up. Sliding on his famous red helmet, Yusei jumped onto his bike and the two were off.

The ride to Leo and Luna's condo was a pretty quick one, though it did involve a few quick turns. The only annoying part was once Yusei entered the city limits, the hectic of traffic always frustrated him, like any normal human being. The continuos sound of car horns, the occasional shout from a late driver, Yusei had half a mind to go off the street and take a few side allies to get out of the oppressive traffic. Thankfully, Akiza was there and noticed his irritation creeping onto his face. With a quick squeeze, Akiza returned to Yusei's mind and he could not help but smile at the girl he was riding with. However, what Akiza did not notice was the slight extra material in Yusei's shirt, of course how could she with all the noise and traffic.

Eventually, the two duelists made it to Leo and Luna's parking garage. There, upon turning off the engine, something strange occurred. As Akiza turned to slip off the bike, one of her red high heeled shoes slipped right off. Akiza only noticed this when her socked footed touched cold asphalt,causing her to squeak in surprise.

"What is it Akiza?" asked Yusei, surprised by the cute sound that had just popped out of his girlfriend's mouth.

"My shoe just slipped off is all," said Akiza who was about to reach for her. Yusei, however, was already there and picked up the red-haired girl's shoe. Deciding to play with Akiza a bit, Yusei knelt on one knee and extended the shoe to Akiza. Taking the role of the princess, Akiza straighten herself up and extended her foot waiting for the glass slipper. As Yusei slipped on and fastened the shoe, he found it odd that Akiza's shoe was probably a size or two too big for her foot.

"Akiza, are these shoes new?"

"Yes," answered the girl as she stood up and took Yusei's hand. "Why do you ask?"

"Well it looks like they're a little big for you."

"That's odd," said Akiza as she and Yusei made their way down the garage corridor to the elevator. "I do tend to buy my shoes a least a size bigger, in case I get that extra little growth spurt." As Akiza walked, she was indeed surprised at how loose her shoes felt. She could practically lift her entire heel before her shoe's backing would catch and allow the shoe to lift. "This is really odd," continued as struggled for a few more feet. Finally, getting tired of struggling with her shoes, Akiza abruptly slipped her feet out of her shoes, grabbed her shoes in her left hand, and grabbed Yusei's right, not noticing the extra material nearly covering Yusei's hand. "There, much better."

Yusei accepted Akiza's simple response and the two continued on their way to the elevator. Thankfully the elevator seemed to be waiting for them, and the two took it to the top floor where they quickly found and knocked on Leo and Luna's door.

Will Leo and Luna be there when Yusei and Akiza arrive?
131332222222222211221211.title: Head over to Leo and Luna's Condo.

1313322222222222112212112.content:
With no response coming from the other side, the two duelists concluded that Leo and Luna must still be out somewhere, probably at school.

"Well, what do we do now Yusei?" asked Akiza as she reached down and adjusted her stockings, noting that they seemed to be slightly longer than usual.

"We go inside and wait for them. Leo gave me an extra key they had in case we ever wanted to come over and just hang out," answered Yusei as he pulled out the key card and swiped it through the reader. A few seconds later, Yusei and Akiza were standing in the entry way of the impressively nice condo. Wood floors throughout, fully stocked kitchen, plenty of space, this was a place Yusei could only dream about when he was a child. He only hoped that when the time came, he could give Akiza something similar if not better.

Placing her red heels in the shoe rack and hanging her red coat on the rack, Akiza quickly stepped up into the kitchen and opened the refrigerator. "Yusei, would you like something to drink? There's some lemonade here, as well as a few other juices."

"A glass of lemonade please," called back Yusei as he hung his coat and stored his gloves in the pockets. He then took a seat on the entry step so he could take off his boots. Yusei looked down at his boot, grasped it, and prepared for the tug of war that was about to commence. As much as he liked these boots, they were always a pain to get on and off. However, in the name of politeness certain things must be done. Returning his thoughts to his boot, Yusei heaved, and then fell backwards almost knocking his head on the floor. Sitting up quickly, Yusei looked down in shock. There was his foot, white socked and everything, and his boot off with not so much as a struggle. Sure, his white sock was a little loose on his foot, but it always was whenever he had to yank his boots off. Yet, this time there was hardly any yanking at all, let alone difficulty. Placing his boot on the floor next to the shoe rack, Yusei turned to his other shoe. Moving his foot around in his boot, Yusei could tell there was plenty of space in it, probably too much space. Yusei paused for a second and then set the heel of his boot against the floor. Using his other foot as a break, Yusei easily manage to slip the boot off. Puzzled, Yusei set the boot aside and was about to notice how loose his other sock was when he felt a warm presence wrap around him.

Akiza gave her boyfriend a big hug and a quick kiss on the cheek. "Something wrong Yusei?"

"Possibly, my boots were loose and easy to pull off, but they weren't that loose yesterday."

"Maybe some of the bindings in the boots decided to loosen? You have had those boots for a long time. Maybe you've finally managed to break them in."

"Yeah that could be it."

"Oh come on," said Akiza with a little complaint in her voice. "So what, you're shoes were loose. Big deal. we could either spend our time between now and when Leo and Luna get home mulling it over, or we could have some fun." Yusei felt Akiza's warm arms let go only to hear a few seconds later a light yelp and a thud.

Turning quickly, Yusei saw Akiza on the wooden floor. Rushing to her side, Yusei asked, "Akiza are you okay?" However, Yusei's slippery sock could not gain traction on the wooden floor, causing the boy to slip, crashing and sliding right next to Akiza. The red haired girl burst into laughter saying simply, "I am now." Standing up, the red haired girl offered her boyfriend a hand up. He gladly accepted it and was soon on his feet... only to suddenly feel a shove from in front of him. Landing on his butt with a thud not unlike Akiza's first fall, Yusei looked up at the now high and might Akiza, failing to notice that instead of her usual 16 almost 17 look, she now looked barely 15 if not 14, "Why'd you do that?"

"Because I knew it would be fun," said Akiza as she skated away, her stockings acting like skates on the polished wooden floor. Passing by the couch, Akiza grabbed one of the many pillows and threw it at Yusei. Yusei rolled to dodge and succeded, allowing him to stand up. He was about to protest, but another thrown pillow silenced Yusei. After that, it turned into reflex training. Akiza would throw, Yusei would attempt to dodge and sometimes succeed. He was quickly getting into the fun of things, no doubt why he did not notice how his white socked toes were now the only thing that were able to be seen peaking out from the excess jean material. Although Akiza was focused on Yusei, she was far too centered on aiming to notice her boyfriend's lighter skin tone and softer expression giving him a look closer to 15 instead of his usual 18.

After a few minutes, it was Yusei's turn to return fire which he did sometimes throwing two or three pillows at a time. Akiza was able to dodge most of the barrage, but still took some hits. She had to find a way to get back on top of this match. Just then, as Akiza went for a catch, she saw what she could use. Ducking behind her side of the couch, Akiza soon emerged with her arms bare and her black sleeves tied together into a loop. Not seeing a problem with this new tactic, Yusei quickly threw another pillow at Akiza. However, Akiza was ready for this. Grabbing the opposite sides of her loop, Akiza turned the loop into a sort of cradle and easily caught the thrown pillow. With a quick spin, Akiza then sent the same pillow back at Yusei, who had to dive away from his stockpile of pillows to avoid getting pummeled. Now was her chance. Skating forward, Akiza managed to cover just the ground she needed to slam Yusei with another pillow. Knocked off balance, Yusei grabbed for the only thing he could and hoped it would prevent him from falling. Unfortunately, it was Akiza so it did not. The two duelists fell into a heap of human limbs and slightly oversized clothing. The two landed with an all to common sound that was quickly followed by laughter and smiles.

"Looks like you got me Akiza," said Yusei through his laughter.

"Yeah I did." Akiza then sat up and helped her boyfriend to his feet.

"I cannot remember the last time I had fun like that," said Yusei as he began to pick up pillows, his face now looking younger maybe closer to 14. Akiza grabbed a few herself and then sat down. The pillow fight had taken quite a lot of energy plus she had to fix her stockings. Reaching for the clasp that held up her stockings, Akiza adjusted it to the shortest it would go. She then stood up and reached for another pillow, however her attention returned to her stockings. Even at the shortest length, the stocking still felt big on her. She began to wonder, but quickly came to the solution that the stockings were probably just old.

Returning the last of the pillows to the couch, the two duelists sat down and sighed. Reaching for the TV remote, Yusei turned on the TV and began to search for professional dueling programs. It was not a long search as every channel wanted some sort of card game related TV show to pull in viewers. Settling for a broadcasting of the Olympic dueling trials, Yusei leaned back his arm almost missing Akiza as he pulled her close. Had the twins gotten a bigger couch since last time he was here?

"Oh bad move," commented Akiza as she watched an Olympic hopeful fall to a simple trap card. With a yawn, Akiza's feet curled up onto the couch as she rested her head on Yusei's lap.

What happens now?

131332222222222222222221.content:
As the light died down and their vision cleared, Yusei and Akiza immediately realized two things were wrong. For starters, rather than standing on their feet, they were both hunched over on all fours. Secondly, their location had changed, and rather than Yusei's garage where they had been moments before, they were now in the middle of a park. And finally, and the most important of the differences, their clothes had disappeared, leaving them both completely naked.

Blushing brightly, Akiza attempted to cover herself, but found that her arms weren't working right. Trying to get up, they also found that they couldn't stand up properly; they could balance on their feet for a few moments, but it was shaky, and they both ended up falling back onto their hands.

"Yusei, what's going on!" Akiza screamed with fear, "Why am I naked?! Why can't I stand up?! Wha-" She cut herself off as she realized something else. Despite her screaming, she wasn't hearing her words - she was hearing barking.

Yusei meanwhile noticed something else. While he clearly heard Akiza barking, he found that he somehow undersood exactly what she was trying to stay. "What is going on?" Yusei gasped, and was greeted by a "Woof!" of his own.

"Yusei, why are we barking like a dogs?! And why can we understand it!?" she screamed in another series of barks.

"I don't know." Yusei said as calmly as he could. "But lets try to stay calm here. We can't panic." His words were still coming as a series of barks and woofs.

"Hey, look at that," a voice spoke up. Somehow managing to blush even harder, Akiza's head whipped up - and her eyes widened in further shock. There were some people walking towards her, except they were also naked and walking on all fours. More to the point, they were being led on leashes by dogs - dogs that were walking upright and wearing clothes.

As the two continued to stare in shock, the dog wearing jeans and a shirt said, in perfect English, "Looks like a pair of stray humans."

"Are you sure?" the dog wearing a dress asked, "Better check to see if they have a collars."

The two of them were frozen in shock, unable to move as the male dog handed his leash to the female, walked over to them, then one by one pulled their hair back to check their necks.

It was a seemingly peaceful and ordinary day in New Domino City, and as usual, Jack was currently at his favorite coffee place. Taking a sip, he enjoyed its taste. As he set down the cup, someone called out to him. "Hey! Jack!" Glancing in the direction of the voice, he saw Carly waving to him as she came jogging up to him.

"Hello, Carly." he replied. "What brings you here?" he said before taking another sip.

"Well, check out this weird card I just found. I was doing an interview for a scoop, and as I left I found it on the ground." Carly said as she handed Jack the card.

"Its blank? What a useless card." he said before handing it back to her. "Whats so interesting about a blank card?"

"No clue, but I'm gonna investigate it. Maybe I've found a great scoop!" she said.

Just then, the card began to glow, and there was suddenly a bright flash of light that engulfed the two of them.

Jack now wore a long sleeved white and blue striped shirt under an open orange vest, and blue jeans that only went down to his knees. He also had on orange sneakers, and a belt with a pack. Her hair went all the way to her knees, however they were gathered together into two main strands about mid-torso level. Her hair had white streaks in them. Luna's body definitely aged, for now she sported D cup breasts, maybe even a bit larger. She had a thing waist and a round behind, along with long slender legs to compliment her body. Her outfit looked more like a dress than anything. She had a nice long white dress, a slit near the neck that exposed a bit of her cleavage for everyone to see. However she also wore a nice pink jacket, one that covered her arms a decent amount but was left open from her chest. She wore sandals and in her hair seemed to be a flower pin.

Like before, each twin did have something that they wore that was the same. They each had a wristband, same as they were kids, on their wrists. Both twins looked at each other in complete shock. "Leo..." Luna spoke with her new voice, "What...what is happening to us?"

"I am not sure" he replied in his deeper voice. "But wow Luna, you look really beautiful as a young adult." A blush came from his sister that made him smile. "And look at me!" He flexed his arms a bit, "I'm not sure whether to be stoked or excited!"

"Well I think we should check with the others" Luna spoke, "They might be able to help us."

134332222221222222121.content:
As the flash of light died down, it took a moment before the twins managed to get their bearings. When they did, they saw that they were in some kind of shining white corridor.

"Woah; where are we?" asked Leo as he looked at their new surroundings. "This isn't New Domino City, that's for sure. Do you think that Card brought us here?"

"I don't know, Leo," answered Luna in a slightly scared tone, "but it did do something to us. Just look at what you are wearing!"

Leo looked down and saw that he indeed wasn't wearing his usual clothes anymore. Instead, he was wearing some kind of green suit, a white flight jacket and some kind of odd-looking white boots. There was also a red scarf around his neck and a holster on his right leg, which held some kind of high-tech pistol.

Looking over at Luna, he saw that she wore an almost identical outfit; exept her suit was orange, her boots were silver and she didn't have a scarf.

"Wahhh!" yelled Leo. "What's going on?!? Why are we wearing these crazy clothes?!?"

"I have no idea," said Luna, "But freaking out won't do anything, Leo."

Leo took a few deep breaths to calm himself. "You're right, Luna. Panicking won't help at all. I have to stay focused." He paused. "So, uh..... What do we do now?"
134332222221222222121.title: Leo swaps with Fox and Luna swaps with Falco

choices: Leo and Luna arrive at the hangar
How are Fox and Falco doing in the twins' lives?
1343322222212222221211.content:
"I think we should look around this place," said Luna. "Perhaps there's someone here that could help us get home."

"Good idea, Luna," said Leo. "But, which way should we go? There's two choices." He pointed down the two ends of the corridor, discovering in the process that he was also wearing a pair of black, fingerless gloves.

"Let's try going the way we were facing when we showed up here," said Luna. "That would be the best option right now."

"Yeah, that sounds like a good plan," said Leo. "Let's go."

The twins started walking down the corridor. While they were walking, they noticed that the strange clothes they were wearing felt really comfortable; like they had been tailor-made for them.

"It's really strange, Luna," said Leo. "These clothes are very odd, but they fit us perfectly. How do you think we ended up wearing them?"

"I think it had something to do with that strange card that we found," replied Luna. "I remember that I saw some text appearing on it as it began to glow, but I can't remember exactly what..." Luna looked in Leo's direction and gasped.

"Luna; what's wrong?" asked Leo with concern.

"Look at our shadows, Leo!" said Luna in a frightened voice. Leo turned his head to look at the shadows and gasped as well; their shadows weren't their own!

Although they were still humanoid, they were not human shadows! For one thing, they were disproportionally bigger in comparison to the twins' sizes; almost like the shadows of adults.
For another; the shadows had obvious non-human features! Leo could see that his own shadow had a tail and dog-like ears, while Luna's shadow had a bird-like tail and a beak!
There was no doubt that it was their shadows; they followed all the movement that the twins made!

"Okay; this is freaky!" exclaimed Leo. "Why do our shadows look like that?!?"

"I'm not sure," said Luna hesitantly. "At least, I think I'm not..."

Luna suddenly gasped. "Wait a second! I remember now!"

"Remember what, Luna?" asked Leo.

"It was the Card that did this! That strange Card we found!" replied Luna.

"Wait; what?!?" sputtered Leo. "The Card did this? What exactly did it do, sis?"

"It's hard to explain, Leo," said Luna. "If only there was a mirror nearby..."

Luna suddenly looked like she got an idea. Much to Leo's surprise, she closed her eyes and appeared to be in deep concentration. After a moment she opened her eyes again and said: "Follow me; hurry!", before she sprinted down the corridor.

"Hey; wait up!" yelled Leo, running after her.

Luna kept running until she reached a white door on the side of the corridor. Leo came up close behind her, completely out of breath.

"What's... the... deal... Luna?" he huffed.

"It's easier to explain when we enter this bathroom," said Luna.

Leo looked at his sister with a puzzled expression.

"How do you know that this is a bathroom?" he asked.

"I will explain everything, Leo," said Luna, "but it will be easier to explain in there." She opened the door and went in, Leo following close behind.

It seemed to be an ordinary bathroom to Leo; a couple of toilets, sinks and a large mirror on one wall.

"Geez, Luna. If you wanted to go so badly, you should have said so," complained Leo.

Luna shook her head. "It has nothing to do with that," she said. "I told you that I know what's going on, but I had to find a mirror to help explain it."

"Err...why?" wondered Leo.

"It's easier to show you," said Luna as she went over to stand in front of the mirror. Puzzled, Leo went over to stand next to his sister, looked into the mirror... and screamed.

The reflections in the mirror were not their own, human reflections! Instead, Leo was looking at the reflections of two humanoid animals!

Luna's reflection was that of an athletic, blue-feathered bird-like creature with long blue tail feathers and red patches around it's blue eyes.
Leo's reflection was that of a green-eyed, fox-like being with orange-brown fur, with white fur on the muzzle and the tip of it's tail.
What was even stranger was that the two reflections were not only wearing the exact same clothes that the twins were wearing, but that they were also bigger than the twins were!

Leo stared in total shock at his altered reflection. And he was sure the fox-thing in the mirror was his reflection; it had the same shocked expression as he had and it mirrored all of his own movements.

"Luna... What's going on here?" asked Leo nervously. "Why do our reflections look like that?"

"Like I said, it's because of that Card we found," answered Luna. "I remembered the name of the Card. It was called: Cross-Dimensional Life Exchange. We've swapped lives with two beings from another dimension!"

"Err....What do you mean by that?" asked a confused Leo.

Luna sighed and looked her brother straight in the eyes. "Okay; let me explain. We currently have the lives of those two beings whose reflections we now have. We still see ourselves as ourselves, but everyone else will see us as our current reflections. And since we're currently in their lives, they must be in our lives back in New Domino."

Luna turned towards the mirror again. "You currently have the life of that orange one; Fox McCloud," she said, as she pointed at Leo's new reflection. "He's the leader of a group of Spaceship pilots known as Star Fox."
She then pointed at her own new reflection. "And I have the life of his teammate; one Falco Lombardi."

"Woah... That's freaky," said Leo, as he moved closer to the mirror to see his, or Fox's, face close-up. "So, does this mean that this dimension is full of these animal-people?"

"Pretty much," said Luna, as she looked at Falco's reflection which was now hers. "The reason why I know all this, is because we also got the memories of these two, since it's a part of their lives..... Hey; are you listening?!?"

Luna huffed as she saw that Leo had stopped listening and was now occupied with making funny faces in the mirror, which Fox's reflection copied perfectly; something that looked really silly for an adult fox-man to do.

"You are so immature, Leo," she complained.

"Come on, Luna," grinned Leo as he turned to face her. "You have to admit this is awesome! We get to be space-heroes! How cool is that?!?" He struck a superhero pose.

"You don't get it, Leo!" Luna almost yelled. "This isn't some kind of TV show; it's real! This isn't some kind of duel! There's real danger here! We could get hurt; or worse! Try accessing the memories of Fox; then you'll know!"

"Uh...okay," said Leo, now mellowed out. Closing his eyes, he tried really hard to think about his adventures in the past.
Suddenly, a bunch of memories came rushing in; not just his own, but also those of Fox. He saw dangerous dogfights between starships, skirmishes against invading armies and, to his horror, a climactic battle against an enormous, disembodied head!

As Leo opened his eyes again, the expression on his face told Luna that he now understood how serious the situation was.

"Whoa..." muttered Leo. "The Star Fox crew has been through a lot."

"Now you get it," said Luna in a careful tone. "It's not as fun as it looks on TV."

"Yeah, that's for sure," admitted Leo. "But I do know something that is fun." He grinned at Luna. "The fact that you swapped lives with a dude!"

As Leo sniggered, Luna became red in the face from both embarrasment and frustration.
"I already know that, Leo," she huffed. "It's bad enough that I had to swap lives with a male bird-guy, but you don't have to rub it in!"

Leo stopped sniggering, but still grinned at her. "Sorry," he said. "I just realized it after viewing those memories and it was too funny to not be said."

Luna sighed again. "You really are immature sometimes," she said, "but you can't act like that while we're in these lives."

"Uh... why not?" asked Leo.

"Because we shouldn't draw attention to ourselves," replied Luna seriously. "Fox and Falco are grown-ups, so it won't do for you to act like that. We still see ourselves as us, but everyone else sees us as Fox and Falco, so if you act silly, it will look like Fox is acting that way and other people might get suspicious because of it."

"But, we're just kids, Luna," complained Leo. "How are we supposed to act like grown-ups, when we don't know how to do it?"

"Well..." said Luna, "We could try to look into Fox' and Falco's memories again and then try to act like we see them do."

"Sounds like it could work," said Leo slowly," but you know what I'm like. Sometumes, I just can't resist letting loose with a joke. And when we pretend to be famous Duelists, I always end up being overdramatic." Leo sighed. "I don't think I can pretend to be that fox-man well enough to avoid suspicion."

Luna walked over to Leo and put her hand on his shoulder. "It's okay, Leo," she said, comforting him. "We'll get through this together; like we always do. And we will find a way to get back to our own lives. I'm sure of it!"

Leo perked up a bit at those words. "Thanks, sis," he said. "I needed to hear that." Smiling again, he continued: "So; what do we do now?"

"According to their memories, Fox and Falco were walking to the hangar where their Starfighters are," said Luna. "So, let's go there first."

"Great!" exclaimed Leo as he opened the bathroom door. "Let's go! I want to ser those starships!"

Luna managed a small smile as she followed her brother into the corridor.
1343322222212222221211.title: New Dimension; New Lives!!!

13433222222222222212.title: Both Girls

134332222222222222122.content: What about Carly and Mina?
134332222222222222122.title: Another option

1343322222222222221221.content:
Once the light died down, the twins were staggering a bit before they pulled themselves together before losing their balance. After blinking for a few times, the two, still a little dazed adjusted their eyes back to the light.

"Ugh, what was that?"

"I am not sure Leo. I haven't seen a card do that before."

"Not even when you were in the Spirit World?"

"No. Regulus didn't mention anything about that. And since it was a Spell Card, and not a Monster, it makes it even more strange as to how it activated, as it doesn't have any conscious I think..."

"If you say so sis... Huh? Wait, where is it?"

Luna dropped the card when the light hit them, but it was nowhere to be found near them.

"Did it... disappear?"

"I think it did. I did feel a some of energy when I touched it, but I don't sense it anymore... so I guess it's gone now. Should we look for it and show it to the others?", asked the girl, to which Leo shook his head.

"Nah, I don't think we have to. I mean, nothing happened right? Maybe it was a dud, or someone decided to pull a prank on us or something like that. I doubt it's anything serious since there wasn't a spirit around anyway. Maybe it was something a magician had or something. As far as we now, maybe it was supposed to be a trick.

"I guess you're right..."

"And besides, would the others even consider this something serious? I can already picture Jack grinning and saying we act like little kids at how worked up we got over a card that shined and didn't do anything else."

"He isn't that mean to do that. But I guess he does dismiss us from time to time quite easily. I mean, I get that being around younger people isn't his thing, but he could be a bit more caring sometimes."

"Right? I know he was called the King once, but that doesn't mean he should just act high and mighty so often. And other than Yusei and Crow, he doesn't really talk too much with others like they are on the same level. I guess we and Akiza got into that group, but I would just want to understand him better and why he is so boastful at all times. I kind of wish both of us got closer to him, so that he will treat us better."

"Me too... Although, I think that's the way he is normally. He isn't really such a bad person, but he has a hard time acknowledging his faults. But Carly managed to get closer to him somehow after he lost the title, and he a little mellow around her, so maybe we should ask her how to make him be nicer to us."

"Really? I would've personally asked Mina. She was his manager at one point, right? So she must know him better. And they are still a bit close even now, when she is helping Trudge as the new chief of Special Investigations...", said the young boy before blinking and realizing something. "Wait, did we just spend the last five minutes talking about Jack? Man, we are already late to meet with the guys. Let's just go!"

"Okay... And the card?"

"We'll talk with Yusei with it in private so that Jack wouldn't start snickering."

"Like I said, he really isn't that bad of a guy."

As the twins walked away, the two didn't notice how their bodies were covered by a faint light disappearing. Along with the light, Luna's Signer Mark and her connection to the Spirit World also disappeared. One thing was certain though, Leo's wish is going to be fulfilled in a way neither sibling would've expected....
1343322222222222221221.title: Yes

13433222222222222212211.content:
"Why are you so keen to defend him? Is he really that great in your eyes?", asked Leo with a frown.

"It's not about that. But he isn't as bad as you make him seem to be. Sure, he can be a bit mean sometimes, but he is still our friend, isn't he? He may talk big, but he is quite soft, if you think about it. Why would he try to act as nice as he could around Yusei and Crow if they weren't close? He isn't bitter about him losing the title, and in fact was happy he could start back from the ground to make a name for himself again. And he is kind from time to time such as when he took us to that restaurant. He may look very boastful, but at heart, he is a little bit like Yusei isn't he?"

"Well... I guess that he wouldn't be screwing around as much as he does if he was a very pompous guy that only cares about his reputation. And Crow does say from time to time that he is still pretty much the same Jack that lived with them in Satellite, but with an inflated ego added on top of it..."

Seeing that her brother was slowly warming up, Luna gave out a small smile as Leo put his hands behind his back as he pondered more about the former King. They didn't notice how the boy's hands slimmed down and his fingers became slightly longer, looking similar to his sister's while the golden designs they both had on their shirts completely vanished.

"I am happy to see that you are starting to see how great Jack is, brother. We sure are super lucky we got to meet him and.... uh..." Luna began to praise Jack, sounding almost ecstatic in doing such before realizing what she was doing and stopped herself as her cheeks reddened. In response, Leo could only look at her in slight confusion as he raised an eyebrow.

"Sis, where exactly were you going with that? I know you defended him before, you almost sounded like one of his fans there for a second."

"S-Sorry, I don't know what made me say those things. I just felt like... I had to say those things."

"You did? Never thought you would be such a big fan of his."

"I am not really one, but... I guess he is kind of cool, so maybe that's why... But it came out of nowhere... Sorry, I think I blanked out there for a second, so don't worry."

"... Okay, if you say so."

Neither of them were fine with that answer, but Leo thought it was just his sister going off tangent to try and make Jack look better in his eyes. "Weird... Why would she go so far? She made her point, and I admit, Jack isn't such a big jerk after all. He isn't as good as Yusei, but he's okay I guess. Still, saying that we are lucky to meet him? Way too much, sis, way too much..."

On the other hand, Luna was bewildered by her own words, as she couldn't understand what made her speak the way she did. "Why did I sounded so excited all of a sudden? And what made me say those things? This is so strange... Whatever it was, it appears to be gone now, so there shouldn't be any problems... I hope."

As they walked, they slowly began to raise in height as their bodies started to lengthen, their clothes growing along with them. Luna's pigtails also rotated so that they were now facing backwards while Leo's hair smoothed out, losing all of its greasiness and becoming as silky as Luna's, yet neither sibling seemed to notice any of these changes.
13433222222222222212211.title: Talking about Jack

134332222222222222122111.content:
Luna was still thinking about her earlier words, but decided to put them aside them for the moment to not ruin hers and her brother's mood. Normally, Kuribon or Regulus would've tried to talk with her whenever she was feeling confused or conflicted, but with her link to her Monster Spirits gone, she was now unable to hear them anymore. And yet she still remained blissfully unaware of the fact, not even questioning why her spirit friends remained silent after her outburst. This was because her memories were slowly changing, adapting themselves to suit her current self.

Their pants also began to change, as Leo's white shorts started to become silkier and smoother to the touch, while Luna's were becoming rougher instead as they also started to gain a faint bluish hue.

"By the way, have you seen the teams that will take part in the Grand Prix?", asked Leo to try and take his sister's attention away from what happened before. "Some of the groups are pretty much newcomers, but quite a lot of them are a little famous. I wonder which ones will they fight against."

"I am not sure. It wouldn't be impossible to fight a strong team from the start, but I think Yusei and the others will manage. All of them have gotten a lot stronger lately."

"Yeah. I am sure it will not be a walk in the park, but after the whole thing with the Dark Signers, they've got this. And besides, chances are a lot of them will get a bit intimidated by the fact that they're fighting both the current and former King. And with... Yusei's skills of course they'll win."

Luna noticed her brother paused a bit, but didn't think too much of it, while Leo was now having his turn at being confused by his thoughts. "Why was I ready to say "Jack" instead? Yeah, he is strong and all, but still not on Yusei's level. But I guess he is quite talented and smart, not that his pride isn't blinding him anymore. And he has been a bit more tactical with his plays lately, so he is getting better... Great, now I start to praise him more than I wanted. I guess a bit of Luna's enthusiasm is rubbing on me...", said the boy to himself with a frown.

Their thoughts regarding Jack Atlas were slowly improving, his more abrasive and sometimes mocking behaviour not bothering them as much, and began to see his more positive traits, such as his courage and respect for his opponent, to be more defining of his character. Neither seemed to be bothered by this, and instead actually welcomed them, as they wanted to see him in a better light, for a reason they really didn't get at the moment, but to which they weren't against.

As they neared the group's apartment, their bodies grew once again as they also became older, both now being fifteen years old. This made Luna's small curves to become a little more apparent, as her hips and chest grew a bit as a result. As for Leo, he didn't gain any major muscle mass, as his body remained overall slim. However the changes didn't stop there for him, as his calves shifted a bit, their appearance now being more shapely and slim, and also a bit more toned, while his feet shrunk the same way his hands did and also gained a pedicure, making his legs look more like his sister's.

As they approached the door however, they noticed that it was unusually quiet. Normally, the guys would work on their D-Wheels, but there wasn't any sound coming from inside. Peeking inside the garage, they were surprised to see only one person in the garage.
134332222222222222122111.title: They get to the garage

1343322222222222221221112.content:
Surprisingly enough, the place was empty. There were no D-Wheels or no equipment laying around, and most importantly, their friends weren't present. Only Zora, the landlady, was the only one there, sweeping the floors before she noticed the twins opening the door.

"Oh hello, Lio and Lana. Is there any way I can help you?"

The two were confused a little by the way the older lady called them. They simply believed she mispronounced their names, although a small part of their brains instead didn't seem to acknowledge that something was wrong with the way they were addressed. Not paying too much mind on, the two shook their heads before Lio replied to the lady.

"We were looking for Yusei and the others. He said we can come here and check out how they work on the D-Wheels."

"Oh, I'm afraid they already left. Yusei went with Bruno to look for more parts, while Crow went for his deliveries. As for Jack, he said he'll go to his "usual place", wherever that may be."

The news immediately brought down the siblings' morale. The fact that they missed them meant they will most likely have to wait for them to return, and knowing how long it takes Yusei to find the best pieces he could find for his D-Wheel, given his high standards, it will most likely take awhile. But with Bruno joining him, maybe the shopping would be done quicker, so there was hope they won't be gone for too long. And Crow might actually be done with his work quite quickly, if he didn't had too many orders to take care of. But for some reason, despite not knowing when he will return, or they were that keen to talk with him in particular, both wanted for some reason to meet Jack more than the others.

Lio's socks disappeared during their conversation while Lana's shrunk to the point where they weren't visible anymore through the shoes. As for their footwear, the latter's didn't changed too much as they morphed into a pair of yellow and white sneakers, while Lio's changed into a pair of brown slip-on shoes become a three inch heel grew from them. He had a few issues keeping his balance in his new high heels, but in a matter of seconds, he quickly grew accustomed to them, as he had no issues walking in them anymore.

"When exactly did they leave?"

"About an hour ago. Yusei said he plans to not have you wait for too long, and Crow said he will try and finish his orders as quickly as possible."

"Can we wait for them until they return?"

"You can wait them here if you want, but promise me you'll keep quiet. It is usually so noisy here whenever they test out their engines, so I would like to be cleaning in quiet if you wouldn't mind."

"Don't worry, we won't make much noise.", said Lana as both she and Lio went down their stairs, the boy trying his best not to make any noise with his heels, looking like he had years of practice in walking in them, not seeing anything wrong with his footwear.

As they walked, Lana's hair started to grow a bit as her pigtails were slowly coming undone, while Leo's ponytail instead began to grow smaller. The twins didn't register the changes, instead feeling a slight each that didn't bother them too much to notice something was off. They both took a seat at a table in the corner of the room, while Zora returned to sweeping the floors.
1343322222222222221221112.title: It was Zora

13433222222222222212211121.content:
After a few minutes passed, the two were starting to get a little bored. There really wasn't much to be done on their own and they already promised Zora that they will behave themselves. They could wait for her to be done cleaning and then look around the place to maybe check the blueprints or spare parts of the D-Wheels the guys had, but they didn't want to be scolded for snooping around their stuff without their permission in case someone returned. And speaking of returning, they both knew that the chances of Yusei or Crow returning so fast after they left would be quite slim, unless they were lucky.

"This is getting boring Lana. Kind of wish we took our Duel Disks with us if I knew we would have to wait. I thought we'd come here and check out what the guys were working on, not sitting on a chair doing nothing."

"It can't be helped Lio. We couldn't have known the guys' schedule anyway. And besides, we can still Duel each other even without our Disks. Want to have a match?"

Neither of them noticed they called each other by the misspelled names Zora called them earlier, nor did the names themselves sounded wrong for them anymore. They also didn't see how their pants changed further with Lio's losing all of its pockets while Lana's began to grow out, now reaching her knees as the material continued to soften and toughen respectively for both of them.

Normally Lio would accept any time to Duel instead of doing nothing, but now while his interest in the game didn't wane, he didn't feel as motivated to play right now. Lana seemed to have similar sentiments, as her proposal was lacking a bit of her usual energy when she would ask for a Duel, but it wasn't as bad as it was in Lio's case.

"Sorry sis, but maybe not now. I don't feel like it right now. And besides, without the Duel Disks, it kind of loses a bit of its charm anyway."

"If you say so... The offer is still up if you feel motivated though."

"Gotcha... By the way, I was curious about something."

"What is it?"

"Where do you think Jack went? Not even Zora seemed to know.", asked Lio genuinely curious. Normally he wouldn't care too much where the former champion would spend his free time when not working on his D-Wheel, but he was starting to feel an increasingly amount of interest in him, despite the fact that he just told himself earlier not to think about Jack too much. A part of him still agreed with that statement, but it didn't really stop his curiosity.

"Well... I am not really sure. I didn't had too many opportunities to talk to him lately... But I think I should know of at least one place he went at least during the weekends."

"Did he ever tell you?"

"Not really... But I recall a bit a time when I saw him at a café... Although I am not really sure when I saw him."

"Maybe you saw him when we were strolling around. Or did you see him on your own free time?"

"I think it's the latter... I don't know why I feel so confused about this all of a sudden. There is something that makes me think that I know the place."

"Don't be bother by it. It's not like it really matters. And besides, maybe it was just a one-time thing for him too."

"Perhaps it was..."

During their conversation, Lana's hair started to darken a little bit, now being a darker shade of green while Lio's was slowly turning into a light olive-green color instead. On top of that the bangs that were framing their faces were slowly receding and growing back into their scalps.
13433222222222222212211121.title: They wait

134332222222222222122111212.content:
"... Anyway, leaving that aside, do you think the Ghost will crash the tournament?", asked Lio with a frown, which surprised Lana for a second, before her expression turned a little worried. "I know there weren't many attacks lately, but I am almost sure they will at one point they'll just get on a lane and start attacking."

"Trudge said something about raising the security level during the tournament and began tracking down the Duelbots that were stolen, but... I can't help but think that you are right. We still know too little about who the guy in charge of the Ghosts are or how they even got their hands on the Duelbots. Yusei thinks that whoever took them is an expert programmer or a hacker, but even so, I can't really think a reason as to why they would do this."

They both became silent as they recounted the events of the past few months. It started not too long after beating the Dark Signers, when Yusei Dueled against Ghost and realized that the mysterious Duelist that took out so many others was in fact a machine. What was even more shocking was the fact that it had a Deck which contained Monsters that could actually absorb Synchro Monsters, something which was never seen before. Then there was the incident when an impostor Jack tried to get rid of the real deal, with him having multiple copies of Red Dragon Archfiend, a Card only Jack should have, and then again, it was revealed that it was another bot. But as they were remembering the events, some parts of their memories were slowly changing.

"Whoever is in charge of the Ghosts, must have some reason to do all this. A vendetta against people who just use Synchro Monsters is way too childish. Especially because they left the Duelists in the state they were found afterward. After seeing how bad Trudge was, I must believe there must be a deeper reason for this... Wait. I saw Trudge only in a cast, right?... No I remember I was there when he was hospitalized and saw how bad his injuries were. Those lacerations are hard to forget... But what was I doing there? I don't recall needing to see a physician at the time. Did Yusei pick me up, or I got there with a cab? I am not really sure...And was Lana there? I don't think I remember her being with me..."

"I wonder why they would go so far? Stealing the Duelbots is one thing, but inflicting so much harm on regular people is too cruel. And what was that guy masquerading Jack about? How did they manage to make a copy that played so similar to the original is definitely scoop-material, since I doubt you can just mimic someone's Dueling style like that. They sure must have some futuristic machines with them... And it's weird how much he looked like the real deal, and he even talked a bit like him. I am lucky I managed to be there and take pictures of the whole thing... Huh? Was I there? I don't think I was. But I swear I saw someone who looked like Jack and had 3 Red Dragon Archfiends... I am not misremembering, right?"

As the two were trying to sort their thoughts out, they felt like their chairs were getting comfier, but didn't bother to ponder too much on it. This was because their butts began to slowly grow in mass, and while Lana's would be explained by the fact that she was going through a accelerated puberty, the fact that Lio's was undergoing a similar process with his rear growing to match his sister's was certainly a little strange. In addition, Lana's shirt started to tighten a bit on her, revealing a bit of her figure while her brother's short sleeves were starting to lengthen together with his jacket, as they currently reached the middle of his arms.

There was also a certain event that was erasing itself from the twins' minds without them noticing. Their Duel against Lester, who used a similar Deck to the Ghost that Yusei fought, was slowly getting forgotten. While they still know that he is an enemy and how dangerous of an opponent he is, their battle was starting to fade from their memories, and were starting to think like they weren't the ones that fought Lester in the first place, but someone else entirely.
134332222222222222122111212.title: Recalling recent events

1343322222222222221221112122.content:
"It appears like they are running a little late." The twins' attention was drawn by Zora as she called to them. Upon looking at the clock, they saw that almost 45 minutes elapsed ever since they arrived. This surprised them a little, as they didn't expect time to go by so fast while they were deep in thought. "I know Crow might be busy today as it's Saturday, but it is a little unexpected for Yusei to be running late. Although the young man did say something about finding a new place to shop for parts, and knowing him and his friend, they are bound to spend more time looking than actually buying."

"And Jack?"

"A mystery, as always. Only Yusei and Crow know where he is right now."

"Did you call them to ask them where they are?"

"I would, but I am afraid I need to close the place for a bit. Me and my son need to go shopping ourselves, and I would be mad to let this place unlocked."
"Oh... So we also need to leave?"

"You can, but you may wait for them in front of the shop if you wish. They have the keys, so you will be able to get inside when they get here."

The two were accepting to the idea of them waiting in the front, but something seemed to stop them from accepting the proposal. Suddenly, a certain location popped in their heads, one where a certain person seemed to visit frequently, and through him, the two also became familiar with the place as well. The place was Café la Geen, a coffee shop which was known for selling very good, but also expensive coffee. And there was one person they knew that loved going there.

At the same time their began to lose their color, as they both were beginning to turn white, but there was a big difference between the way this was happening for each. For Lio, the material of his top was also becoming thinner and softer to the touch, while Lana's was turning white only partially, as some horizontal lines with the regular red coloring seemed to remain unchanged. They also began to feel a small pressure in their hips, as they were becoming wider. While the process wasn't as prominent for Lana, Lio's were actually stretching out to proportions that were now slightly bigger than his sister's.

"Actually, I was thinking of going after Jack.", said Lana, which surprised her brother, while Zora raised an eyebrow.

"Really? Do you even know where he is right now?"

"I might have an idea as to where he is. If Yusei returns, please tell him I'm sorry for leaving..."

"Hold up.", said the boy, drawing his twin's attention. "If you know where Jack is, I am coming with you."

"Why?"

"Because I also want to meet him. And it doesn't seem fair that you get to see him and I don't. Besides... there are also a few important matters I wish to discuss with him."

Lana began to pout as both began to glare at each other a bit. Normally, there shouldn't be any reason for them to get angry at each other like this, but this time, both were starting to see each others as rivals of sorts, the other acting as an obstacle in their way to talk with Jack. While the main reason they were acting like this was a little foggy for them, another one was the fact that they started to not see each other as siblings anymore.

"Ahem.", said the older woman to the two, breaking their staring contest. "If you two wish to argue, please do it outside. I will not bother you with your problem, as it's none of my business, but I would appreciate if you didn't start a fight over something as trivial as this."

"We understand", said both siblings in unison with a grumble.

"Very well. I will close this place in a few minutes. If you think you know where Jack is, please tell me next time we see each other. I need to know where exactly he is lazing off all day, while his friends are working." The stern tone she took, made the two sweat a bit, and feel bad for the old King a bit as they stood up and began to leave. As they were climbing up the stairs, Zora sighed to herself. "I swear... Rivals in love are a lot more common these days, but it wouldn't hurt if those two would get along better. They showed before they can compromise, correct? Certainly, there must be a way to resolve this peacefully between them..."

Outside, they were ready to start walking, when they noticed something near the house.
1343322222222222221221112122.title: Deciding to leave

13433222222222222212211121222.content:
In front of the building there was a Sector Security car, and it seemed that no one was inside. The twins didn't see the police car when they arrived, so they assumed the officer that was driving it left somewhere. But a few seconds later, their bodies aged up once again, as they quickly went through the years, turning eighteen as of this moment. Lana's figure matured further as her hips and butt grew proportionally with her, if not becoming a little bigger than average, while her chest grew to B-cup breasts. Her pigtails snapped as it straightened along with the rest of her hair, as the color continued to darken. As for Lio, his figure was resembling Lana's quite a lot, as his body didn't put on any muscle, leaving him quite slim, while his ponytail disappeared completely, his mane now touching only just below his neck. Along with the age progression, a few mental changes happened as well, which helped Lio realize who the car belonged to as he took a out a set of keys from his pocket.

"Did you bring your car Lia?"

"Yes. I thought that it would help me find Jack faster. Now, if you excuse me..."

"Wait, I'll come with you."

"Huh? Why? Can't you drive own car Cana?"

"I do, but I left it at a car service today, as the engine got overheated."

"And is there a reason for me to take you? I don't recall there being a reason for that."

It should've confused the pair upon Lia refusal to go with Cana, and while they were a little scared deep inside, their relationship was already changing, which made the two didn't ponder too much on it. The memories they shared together were starting to differentiate, as they were slowly remembering different childhoods, in which they were apart from each other. This had an effect on their familial bond, as while they still considered to be a family at least for now, they no longer thought they were twins. In addition, they both got a few new interests, with Lia getting into management and police work, while Cana now enjoyed photography and writing reports.

With a sigh, Cana replied back: "Because I know where he is right now."

"You do? Is it Café la Geen?"

"Yes. I've been there before with Jack before, so I know where it is."

Lia frowned at his sister's claim, and got a little irritated as he saw a small hint of pride in her smile. But while Lia knew Jack would be there, he didn't know the address, as he never was there before. Seeing that he needed someone to show him where it is, he reluctantly accepted. "...Fine. You may come. But don't try and make me take a detour. We are going straight there."

"I am alright with that."

There was still a little tension between them, but they managed to find common ground, at least for now. The main reason they were acting the way they did was because of their desire to meet Jack in private for a more personal reason, which they didn't quite understand right now. Once both got in the car, Lia felt like his seating was a little more cushy than he remembered, but didn't think too much of it, unaware that his rear not only became a nice bubble-shape, but it actually was a little bigger than Cana's, something which he took a bit of pride in. With his new age, he also gained a driver's license, which made him perfectly capable of driving, and thus the two took off.
13433222222222222212211121222.title: A police car

134332222222222222122111212221.content:
Just as the car got on the main road, Cana turned to Lia. "By the way, I know a shortcut through the city, so you don't need to take the highway."

"Really? Are you certain we will get there faster this way?"

"Yeah, I've tested it myself. We might encounter more traffic lights, but it's not as roundabout. With a little bit of luck we might get there 15 minutes quicker."

"You don't say.... Fortunately, the traffic isn't so bad during weekends, so maybe it is worth a shot..."

Lia followed Cana's suggestion and followed her directions without objecting to it. He knew he could have used the GPS to find a faster route to the café, but thought that it wouldn't be so bad to know the usual way to get to there. And he knew this would be a good opportunity to ask his sister a few questions.

As the car took a right, their jackets color slowly transitioned from pink to red for Cana and from white to a faded blue for Lia. Their appearance also changed, as the former's sleeves retracted completely, leaving her shoulders only covered by the shirt, while the fabric toughened a little, and for the latter it continued to grow alongside his shirt, as the material looked a bit softer and more expensive.

"By the way... I wanted to ask you a few things."

"They are not personal are they?"

"No, I just wanted to know a few things...", began Lia as he took a few glances at his passenger through the rear-view mirror before he went back to driving. "First of all, why exactly did you go to see Jack's Duel with that impostor? It was quite dangerous from what I understood..."

"Because I was worried. It's not like I doubted Jack will win, but after I heard that copy had almost the same Deck he had, I knew I had to make sure he was fine. We both know he can get a little reckless when under pressure..."

"I understand the feeling...", mused the boy, somewhat satisfied with the answer.

"And besides...How many times do you see someone with Red Dragon Archfiend pretending to be Jack Atlas, and having a carbon copy of even his D-Wheel? You know that this is a scoop that any decent reporter would dream of. You saw how big it was in the paper the next day, right?"

With Cana's increased interest in journalism and even recalling a few times where she helped around for a local newspaper within her memories, it was becoming visible that she is eager in working as a reporter, and with her finishing high-school, she is happy to already learn the basics.

"Your dedication sure is... something..."

"Thanks. But in all honesty, I just wanted to be there for Jack. I know I can't do too much, but I am trying to offer my support. I can't be as reliable as Yusei when it comes to Dueling, but there's no way I won't be there to cheer for him if I can."

Lia said nothing as he listened to the girl's declaration. He didn't want to admit it, but the fact that she cared so much about Jack, and because she seemed to care about her work were both qualities he respected. During this time, their waists slimmed down quite a bit, with Lia's feeling a slight discomfort as his abdomen compressed down to be around the same size as Cana's, but he wasn't too bothered about the feeling to distract him from driving.

"But what brought this about? It is a little strange for you to bring this up. Did you want me to describe how the Duel went? I wasn't there from the start, so I don't really know how it went down before I got there..."

"It's not that... I just wanted to know your thoughts regarding the whole event, and what made you want to be there as much as you did."
