Ever since I started working for Rex Goodwin, I haven't spent much time on regular relationships and instead focused on my work. Even after I became Jack's manager, I didn't really open up to others, except for him. It wasn't until recently after I was named the new chief of police that I managed to socialize more, but even so, I can't help but feel that I am too stiff around others. But you... you can talk so openly to people. I don't know if it is in your nature, or it is something you learned after you became a reporter, but despite the fact that you are a little awkward sometimes, you have a much more pleasant personality and..."

Mina's words were interrupted by Carly's soft giggle, which made her a little confused as to what she found amusing, before she replied: "Thanks for thinking about me like that. I am sure that we could go on and on with this conversation, where we will just try to compliment each other while finding another flaw in ourselves... But let's be honest, we are both not feeling sure of ourselves because of Jack, right?" As she was met with silence from her companion, Carly continued. "We are thinking that we are not up to standard in terms of relationships, and we let that influence the way we see ourselves. But given that we just countered a bad trait with a good one for each other, I think it's safe to say that we aren't that unsuitable in having a relationship with Jack... So listen up!"

Mina fortunately had to stop at another traffic light when she had a finger pointed towards her. "I don't plan to give up on Jack! There's no way that will happen, at least not without a fight. And you should think the same. We don't plan to just surrender our potential boyfriend to someone else on a whim, do we? But I don't want to hear anything about being unfit or unworthy. No one is perfect in this world, and neither is love. When Jack will make his decision, I will respect his decision, but until then... don't ever put yourself beneath me just because you are a little too busy with your work to talk with him. I wouldn't be satisfied if my "love rival" let me win because of a lack in confidence."

The declaration stunned her for a second, before a fire started to burn in her eyes. Carly's words and her earlier decision made Mina realize that she shouldn't underestimate herself anymore. If even Carly thinks that she should be more assertive, then that meant only one thing for her. "Don't worry. I don't plan to give up. Let's settle who gets to win Jack over fair and square. But don't worry, I will make sure to offer you support when you might be feeling down."

"Oh, so you now get overconfident? Well, we will see who wins in the end.", replied Carly with a small grin as they both looked at each other intently, before they heard a honk from behind. Seeing that the light already turned green, Mina quickly drove off, the pair giggling a bit at how distracted they were as they drank from their coffee.
134332222222222222122111212221112221211.title: Love rivals

1343322222222222221221112122211122212111.content:
Ten minutes later...

"Mmm... The pleasant aroma surely is relaxing..."

Jack was slowly taking another sip from his Blue-Eyes Mountain, a beverage he considered to be worthy of its renown and price. While it was true he considered it a little expensive, for him it wasn't really a matter of money, but rather taste. And besides, compared to the liquor he drank back when he was still a champion, the coffee was a lot more affordable.

"I can never really get tired of this taste. It's so exquisite and yet so delicate at the same time. I don't expect Crow to have such well-developed taste buds to make a difference between this and his cheap instant coffee. If he did, he wouldn't admonish me for paying as much as I do...", said Jack under his breath as he enjoyed both the taste as well as the quiet atmosphere of the café. Since it was a Saturday, most customers would rather come later in the afternoon, thus he was currently on his own right now. He was a little curious where Stephanie, his waitress, disappeared. She said she wanted to show him something, and ran back inside, but five minutes passed and there was still no sign of her. Not that he really paid too much attention to, as between sips, he mind went back to his earlier dilemma.

"Now where was I...? Ah yes, something to do about those two..."

Ever since the Dark Signers have been dealt with, the former champion had plenty of spare time to himself, now that he no longer held his title. That's why other than his time spent working on his D-wheel, relaxing and drinking coffee, he noticed something regarding Carly and Mina. They were fighting a lot. At first, he didn't really understand why. He never thought the two really hated each other, so to see them argue so often was indeed strange for him. It wasn't until one day when he accidentally eavesdropped on one of their arguments, he realized why they fought.

"Why are you bothering Jack so much lately? Didn't he say he wants to relax before the tournament?"

"Bother? I just want to talk with him. Now don't take it out one me just because you're jealous I get to spend more time with than you."

"W-What? That's untrue! I don't want to disturb him, that's all!"

"Well he never said anything that I was a nuisance, so I guess he might like me a bit more than you huh?"

From that exchange, and from what came afterward, Jack needed a minute to digest the information. It was quite obvious what it was all about, and even now, he was not sure how to take it.

"To think those two like me... Even now I find it shocking..." The tabloids did lie when they said he was someone who understood a woman's feelings, but he was able to pick up at least that much. While he did feel a little flattered and proud of himself, he was nonetheless more than a little lost.

Mina was the one that helped him climb the stair to success. She was also the most dependable person he ever met back then, and despite a rocky beginning due to how strict she was, they managed to form a relationship based on mutual respect and trust. Meanwhile, Carly was the individual that was right next to him after his defeat against Yusei and helped him a lot in seeing past his pride. And after all she was put through, the fact that she is able to smile like that makes his day a tiny bit better.

"Hmm... Where to even begin... They both have their flaws, obviously, but it is hard to find their company unpleasant. However, I am not experienced enough to know why or how they might've fallen for me. And unfortunately, I can't really think of a way to ask them outright about it. On the other hand, I really wish they would stop arguing all the time. There must be some way for them to not always be at each other's throats..."

"Hey Jack!"

Upon hearing his name being called, he looked to his side and saw Carly waving to him, and Mina walking next to her. What was a little surprising was the fact that they both had a smile on their faces, and seemed more focused on him rather than bickering. "Well... This ought to be interesting..."
1343322222222222221221112122211122212111.title: Meeting Jack

1343322222222222221221112122211122212111.content:
Both women took a seat next to their crush, with Jack noticing that even when they were this close to him and to one another he couldn't really sense the same tension that usually existed between them whenever he was around.

"So what were you doing? I hope we don't interrupt you."

"Not at all. I only arrived here a few minutes ago. Me, Yusei and Crow were supposed to further work on our D-Wheels this morning, but we found out we were still in need of some more equipment, so Yusei and Bruno went to look for the parts we are missing, while Crow went back to focus on his deliveries. As for me, I decided to use my time on a bit of relaxation. Thus I decided to take a stroll around town and check up on a few things before I came here. By the way, do you girls want some coffee? It is very good."

"No, actually, we each had one on our way here."

"But us aside... are you sure you can spend this much money? Didn't Crow get mad at you last time you did this?"

"Well he says that, but he quite a cheapskate, given he at times, he has us eat the spare fried chicken he has left after the deliveries. While I can appreciate the taste, it sure gets a little repetitive lately...", said Jack as he took another sip, while the girls gave a small nervous laughter. "But that aside, you two look like you are in god spirits. Don't get me wrong, I am glad there doesn't seem to be any animosity for one another anymore, but I am curious if something happened that I am not aware of."

Both Mina and Carly nodded and smiled at each other a bit, before the latter began talking. "Well, on our way here, Mina was nice enough to pick me up from your place, as my car is under repairs right now, and we had quite a lengthy conversation."

"We decided that we should stop with our childish banter for the moment, and instead would spend more time knowing a bit more about each other. The two of us came to the conclusion that it would be a good starting point to overcome our previous feuds."

"Oh, you don't say.", said Jack now more than a little intrigued. For them to be able to bury the hatchet would seem improbable, especially after seeing how heated some of their arguments were, but for them to act so casual meant that whatever they talked about was something quite important. "And how are you going to progress from now on?"

"Well, for starters, I was thinking of spending a bit of time to see what the other does on a regular basis. And honestly, I kind of like Mina's work ethic, and I want to find out if I can implement it. I need to please my boss a lot after all."

"And I want to be able to talk more freely around people, and learning from someone who has taken a few interviews before might be a good opportunity... And also... We agreed to help each other out with some of our more personal goals... Or rather a goal we both have."

"Yeah. We both want the same thing, and it is kind of like a race of sorts. It might be a competition, but we decided to try and aid each other and have a fair and square battle, where both have equal chances. It might not be the best way to achieve what we want, but it is what we consider to be the most honorable way."

The pair both nodded at each other in acknowledgment of their decision. They both loved Jack and were not willing to have their romance unfulfilled in any form. But to accomplish this dream, they still had to be themselves while doing this. Despite the fact they will always be at odds when it came down to making any advances, when it came down to personal support and encouragement over not only their love affair, but their lives in general, they both decided to become friends and to possibly remain close even after one of them officially wins. While they both were now looking peaceful, beneath their gazes lied a fire that said "I will win! So no hard feelings." that would make their future interactions quite interesting.

As for Jack, who realized what the whole conversation was about, brought to cup to his lips and closed his eyes, trying to cover his inner turmoil. "Help each other? Are they serious? I didn't think they would actually find common ground over something like this. I guess I am happy for this development, as now they won't be bickering... Wait, does this mean I have a love triangle? And that I have to make my choice soon? If I had Mina's stubbornness with Carly's nonchalance... Oh boy... Well, I have to figure out how to deal with this as soon as possible. I can't really make up my mind which one is better for me without proper thinking. I am just glad there isn't another one...", he murmured under his breath as he finished his cup and began to chat with the two women.

"Ugh...." Next to the door, Stephanie was growling as she stared at the newly arrived pair. "I just went upstairs for a few minutes to show Jack this new dress I bought, and I return to this?! How am I supposed to make myself noticed by him if they are here?!"

The rest of the day was fairly normal for Jack, with his only slight surprise being that Leo and Luna didn't come to the garage anymore today after the boy made such a big fuss about coming to check on their work after they got a little sick. But that wasn't really on his mind at all, as he went to sleep wondering about his romantic future...
1343322222222222221221112122211122212111.title: A peaceful conversation

151.content:
It was a normal day in Domino City, and at the Kame Game shop, Yugi was minding the store while his grandfather was out running errands. An unmarked package had just arrived on the doorstep, and as a curious Yugi opened it, he found that the only thing it contained was a blank Duel Monster card. It was green, which marked it as a spell card, but there was no picture, no title, or anything else to identify it.

"Huh? What kind of card is this?" Yugi asked. Suddenly the door opened and Yugi's friends Tea, Joey, Tristan, Mai, Serenity, Duke, and Rebecca walked in.

"Hey Yugi," Tea greeted, before noticing the card, "What's that?"

"It's some card someone left on the doorstep," Yugi replied, "But there's nothing on it."

"That's weird," Joey said.

"Yeah, what kind of card doesn't have anything on it?" Mai agreed.

Suddenly the card started glowing, and a burst of light enveloped the group.

It was a seemingly normal at Duel Academy, and Jaden was making his way to class. Suddenly, he noticed something lying on the ground, and picked it up to see that it was a card. It was green, indicating it was a spell card, but other than that, it was blank. No picture, name, or text.

"Whats with this weird card?" he wondered out loud.

"Be careful." Yubel said. "It doesn't feel normal. There is something weird about it..."

Jaden was examing the card when he heard someone call out to him. "Hey Jaden." Alexis said as she walked up to him, accompanied by the rest of his friends; Syrus, Hassleberry, Chazz, Blair, Jesse, and Alexis's friends Jasmine and Mindy.

"What are you doing alone?" Blair asked.

"I don't know. I just found it." he responded.

"Sure looks weird." Syrus remarked.

"And useless. Its completely blank." Chazz said.

Then suddenly, the card began to glow, and emitted a bright light that engulfed the group.

Where Chazz had stood was now a girl with her black hair styled at the top like Chazz's, but now was much longer, and went down her back. She wore the standard Obelisk Blue girl's uniform, but over it was Chazz's signature black coat, and black boots versions of the standard blue ones.

Nearby, Jesse had now wore a white dress with with short sleeves, a larger version of her previous vest that was closed. She also had black stockings that went up to her knees and a pair of white shoes. Her hair hadn't grown much, and was now much neater as it was pulled back into a high, short ponytail, with a a pair of bangs framing her face.

As for the now female Syrus, she had on what appeared to resemble the Obelisk Blue girl's uniform, but what was blue on the normal uniform was instead yellow on her new attire, showing that it was apparently a Ra Yellow version of the girl's uniform. Her hair was now much longer, and was tied into a braid that went down to her mid back.

With Hasslberry, in place the once muscular boy was now a tan girl who was on the tall side, who was the tallest amongst them by a few inches. Her hair had evidently remained the same, still in dreadlocks, and she still wore her dinosaur bandana. Her sleeveless Ra uniform had remained the same, abut her green t shirt nw showed her midriff, and his cargo pant had become shorts that went to her knees. And on her feet were still the same combat boots, though apparently now made for smaller feet.

Blair's transformation into a male had given him a bit of height though he was still the shortest on there, and his blue hair had lost length, and become much shorter. He was wearing the regular Slifer Red uniform with the blazer open revealing a yellow t shirt.

As for the now male Jasmine, his brown hair was much shorter, not going past his ears. Strangely enough, rather than the Obelisk Blue girl's uniform that he had been wearing becoming the boy's uniform like with Alexis, he instead wore the yellow blazer for the Ra dorm. As for Mindy, his black hair had lost the area she had kept tied together behind her his head. Like with Jasmine, he now wore a uniform for a different dorm, and was wearing the Slifer Red blazer.

"Wh-what happened to us?" Jaden asked worriedly.

'You all changed genders.' Yubel stated.

"Well, obviously..." Jaden said under her breath. As she took in her new body, as her hands went up and hesitantly touched her new breasts. "Yep, they're real." she said. They weren't as big as Alexis's former ones, being only a b cup, but they were still strange for her. Similarly, all the othe other boys turned girls also checked their new pairs. Syrus's was little more than an a cup, while Hasslberry's was also a b like Jaden. As for Chazz, her new pair were a nice c cup. As for Jesse, she was definitely the bustiest of the new girls, possessing a pair of perky d cup breasts.

"This is so weird!" Jesse said, giving her new breasts a few more pokes and squeezes.

"Okay everyone, lets just stay calm." Alexis said, just as much for himself as anyone.

Hesitantly, Mindy reached down to feel his crotch, and upon confirming his worst fears of the situation, was apparently the final straw for him. "Calm!?" How can I stay calm!? We just suddenly changed gender! I'm a boy!" he said. The new boy was obviously freaking out. "I've got a-!"

"Mindy, calm down!" Jasmine said, grabbing his friend by his shoulders and giving him a few shakes, cutting him off and causing him to calm down a bit, ij just enough to become more rational.

As for Chazz, she ran over to Jaden, and grabbed her by the collar. "This is your fault!" she accused furiously, only to be pulled away by Syrus and Hassleberry.

"Hey, leave Jaden alone!" Syrus said.

"Yeah, its not like e knew this would happen!" Hassleberry said.

"Just relax, Chazz." Blair said. "Flinging the blame isn't gonna solve anything."

"Yeah. We need to figure out how to fix this." Jaden said. However, before they can talk, they spotted their friends approaching them
152131.title: Instantly

choices: They decided that they might as well get to class for now
They decided ro start looking for a way to fix things as soon as possible
1521312.content:
"So then, now what are we going to do?" Jesse asked.

"Yeah, how are we going to change back?" Mindy asked. "I don't want to be a boy!"

"And I don't want to be a girl!" Syrus said.

"Lets all just try and stay calm for now." Alexis said. "Freaking out isn't going to help us figure anything out."

"Alexis is right." Jaden agreed. She then held up the strange blank card, still in her hand. "This card somehow did this to us, so maybe it can change us back."

"Okay, but how do we make it work again?" Chazz asked. "Because you just holding out that thing isn't turning on the light show again."

"Hes got a point." Yubel said. "I still sense something strange about the card, but it feels different now. 'Smaller,' somehow."

"Well, I say we should try to find out more about that card." Hassleberry suggested.

"It is our only clue for now." Blair said. "So we might as well investigate into it."

"Its not like theres anything else we can do about this mess right now." Jasmine said. "But how are we gonna look into things?"

"Thats a good question..." Alexis said. "We don't really know where to start."

Jaden thought for a moment. 'Maybe I could ask Professor Banner.' "Well, lets head back to my room for a moment."

"Huh? How come?" Chazz asked.

"Well, I figured maybe we could look into this by asking Professor Banner." she explained.

"Well, that might be a place to start." Alexis said. And with that, the group of nine gender swapped teens made their way to the red dorm.

As they did, most of the the new girls were having a bit of difficulty walking in their new footwear. Jaden, Chazz, Jesse, and Syrus were all unaccustomed to walking in footwear with heels, and they tripped more than a few times. Hassleberry snickered at their difficulty. Lucky enough for her, only the size of her shoes had changed, leaving her without the same problem. "Man, how do girls walk in these things?" Chazz complained.

"Well, you get used to it." Jasmine replied.

"Well, I'd rather not get used to it." Syrus said with a sigh. This thing was all so weird. Suddenly being a girl and all that came with it. The clothes, the body, and all. She still wasn't used to her new, higher-pitched voice. She really disliked how much like a young girl she sounded like.

"Man, this is so weird..." Jesse said, once again giving her new breasts a few pokes. "These things are way too big."

"You know, if I wasn't so worried about suddenly being a boy, I might normally be really jealous of Jesse." Mindy whispered to Alexis, Jasmine and Blair.

"It is pretty annoying. Hes a boy, and yet hes got breasts like that." Blair agreed. "But like you said, I'm more worried about changing back."

Eventually, the group all reached the red dorm, and headed up to Jaden's room to check for Pharaoh. Unfortunately, it didn't look like he was there. "Lets all look for him." Alexis said.

"I hope it just doesn't take too long to find that cat." Chazz complained.

As they all looked around the room, Jaden found something that caught her attention. They were a pair of photos that she kept, both from the last days of the school year from the previous two years. However, there was something much different about them. The first picture had been taken for Zane's graduation at the end of his first year after their match, and in it had been her, Zane, Syrus, Alexis, Chazz, Bastion, Atticus, Jasmine, and Mindy. In it was still all the aforementioned people, but rather than as she remembered, there was a variety of differences, chiefly among them being that other than Zane, Atticus, and Bastion, they were all a different gender, the ones that they now were. The photo was now her and Syrus, who was wearing a red version of the usual female uniform, standing with Zane and Atticus, with her and Syrus both at the forefront. Nearby were the male Alexis, Jasmine and Mindy, the latter two whom had been standing close to Atticus as they fawned over him in the original, their new male forms now stood laughing at the male Alexis, who appeared to be flustered by something. On the other side was Chazz and Bastion. The other picture was from the previous year, with similar differences, with all of them in the picture now the opposite gender, though Jesse wasn't in it, as they didn't know her then.

"Uh, guys, you might want to take a look at these..." he said as he held out the pictures for everyone else to see.

"What the...?" Syrus let out as he looked at the picture.

"Why do we look like this in those pictures?" Mindy asked.

"You don't think..." Alexis let out.

"Think what?" Jasmine asked.

"That when that card did this, it might have also somehow altered reality to make it seem like we were always that way." she explained.

"What but thats gotta be impossible!" Blair said.

"Well, about as impossible as turning somebody into the opposite gender." Jesse said. "'Sides, we've seen some crazy stuff before."

"Hes got a point." Chazz said.

Mindy sighed. "Things just keep getting worse..."

"Hmmm..." Jaden out as he inspected the room some more. He came to a pile of papers, some past school assignments. They were his, but written on it was the name 'Jadey Yuki' instead of 'Jaden.' Nearby were where Chazz, Jesse, Syrus, and Hassleberry had left theirs, the five of them having done their homework together the other night. The names on those were instead 'Chassidy Princeton,' 'Jessie Anderson,' 'Sydney Truesdale,' 'Tyranna Hassleberry.' "Alexis might be right. Check these out." he said, showing the papers to them.

"So then, as far as everyone else knows, we really have always been like this..." Blair said.

"It sure looks that way." Hassleberry said.

"Now what are we going to do? We can't really get anyone else to help us if they think we've always been like this." Syrus said.

"Maybe we should go to class for now. Its going to be starting soon." Alexis said. "I mean, its not like we have any other ideas for now."

"I say we should just keep looking into this." Chazz said. "This is a bit more important than class for now. The sooner we get back to normal, the better."

The group then exited the room as they stood outside to think about their situation, and what to do next. As they did, Blair started to walk away. "Hey Blair, where are you off to?" Hassleberry asked.

"Well, I'm gonna check my room real quick while we're here." he replied, and Hassleberry, Syrus, Jasmine and Mindy decided to follow, leaving Jaden, Alexis, Chazz, and Jesse to talk about what to do next. Walking over to it, she opened it, and inside he found that it had greatly changed. For one, it now looked like there was a second person staying there instead of just him. Checking where he kept his schoolwork, he saw that the name that he seemed to go by was now 'Blaine Flannigan.'

"Hey guys, check this out." Jasmine said, calling the others over.

"What did you find?" Blair asked.

"Well, I think your new room mate is Mindy, or as this paper seems to call her, 'Mikey'" Jasmine said, holding up a paper that had Mindy's surname, but the first name was just as Jasmine had said. Nearby the papers were a few photos that showed the trio of male forms of Jasmine, Mindy, and Alexis. There was even some notes that she had borrowed from Alexis and Jasmine, or 'Alex' and "Jazz.'

"Well, I guess that does make sense. She is wearing a red uniform now." Hassleberry said. "And at least we're learning our new names."

"How reassuring..." Mindy said sarcastically.

"Anyway, lets get back to the others." Syrus said. As they exited the room, they found the others waiting outside.

"Well, we talked it over, and decided what to do now." Jaden said.

"Well? Whats the plan?" Blair asked.
1521312.title: Everyone else believes that they have always be...

choices: Skip to the end of the school day, and they head back to their rooms
15213121.content:
"We decided that since we don't really know how long we're gonna be stuck like this, we might as well go to class." Alexis said. "We are still students here, so we do still have to class."

"I guess that makes sense." Blair agreed.

"Well then, we should probably get going there now." Jasmine said.

And with that, the nine of them made their way towards the main building of the Academy. "So, I wonder what else has changed." Jaden said as the group left the red dorm.

"Who knows?" Alexis replied. "I don't know if anything would surprise me at this point."

"This is all just so annoying..." Chazz said, once again tripping in her new heels.

"You're telling me..." Syrus growned.

"Hey, at least you don't have a big pair of these." Jesse said as she put her hand on Syrus's back and gesured to her chest.

On the opposite spectrum, with Jasmine, he appeared to look uncomfortable as he walked. "Ugh, how do guys deal with this thing down there." he growned. "Its just... dangling down there. Its so weird and uncomfortable."

"Don't remind me..." Mindy said.

"Man, this is all just so weird." Blair said with a groan as she listened to all the complaints.

"Tell me about it." Hassleberry agreed.

After a while of uncomfortable walking, they all eventually reached the academy main building. As they entered, no one there paid them any more or less attention than thy usually did. Entering their classroom, they all took seats together. Not long after class began, Jaden soon had her head down, and was already falling asleep.

"Whether Jaden is a boy or girl, I guess some things never change." Alexis remarked with a smile.

"Wish I could be that relaxed about this sistuation." Jasmine said.

"Yeah, I know." Mindy agreed.

"Man, I wish I was that lucky." Jesse groaned. "With these things on my chest, I just can't seem to get comfortable."

Other than their new genders, class went by relatively normally up to the end.

As they filed out of the classroom, they all started to make their way to their next class. I'm really not looking forward to gym today..." Mindy groaned.

"Yeah, I know..." Syrus agreed.

Almost all of them did. They didn't want to get undressed, as it would only serve as another reminder of their situation. As they all filed into the gym, their teacher, Mrs. Fonda Fontaine made an announcement.

"Attention everyone! I've got a nice surprise for all of you!" she said cheerfully. "Since its been pretty hot lately, I've decided todays class will take place by the pool, so everyone get changed into your bathing suits!"

The nine of them all exchanged nervous glare between them.

As the two groups made their way into the separate locker rooms, and they eventually found their new lockers. Thankfully for the boys turned girls, the academy issued swimsuit wasn't revealing. It was just a primarily white one piece with a secondary color, red for Jaden's, yellow for Syrus and Hassleberry's, blue for Chazz and Jesse's. As they got dressed, they mostly kept to themselves.

As for the girls turned boys, they were currently wearing bathing shorts that corresponded to their current dorms, with Alexis wearing blue, Jasmine in yellow, and Mindy and Blair in red. Like the former boys, they mostly kept to themselves.

152322121221.content:
As the flash of light died down, and Jaden's vision cleared, he found that he was standing in a different location. He appeared to be in a training ground of some sort, and didn't appear to be anywhere on the Academy's island that he recognized, if he was on it att all. He then looked around, and nearby, he spotted Alexis, though a bit different that she had been a few moments ago. She was now dressed in and orange and black jacket with matching orange pants,and around her forehead was a black headband with a metal plate with a leaf-like design engraved on it.

Next to her, he was surprised to see none other than Yubel, standing there with a physical body. She was also wearing clothes, and was dressed in a short black jacket a gray high collared shirt that exposed her midriff, black pants, and black gloves with her index and thumb fingers exposed. Like Alexis, she also now wore a simillar headband around her head.

He then look downward at his own appearance, and was once again surprised. Like his friends were dressed in strange clothes, he was as well. He was dressed in a red sleeveless top, black shorts with a pinkish skirt-like cloth over them, and black sandals with heels. If he could have seen his head, he would have seen his hair had a red headband similar to the one Alexis and Yubel had tying it up.

"Jaden? Whats going on here?" Alexis asked as she looked around.

"I'm not sure." Jaden replied and turned to Yubel. "Do you have any idea whats going on?"

"No." she replied. "I'm just as surprised as you. I don't even know how I have a body of my own again."

"Yeah, I didn't think so." Jaden said, then looked down at his new attire again, and then to Alexis and Yubel's. "And what are we wearing?" he asked. He wasn't sure, but the clothes he was wearing looked like they were girl's clothes to him.

"No clue." Alexis replied.

"Just what is going on, anyway?" Yubel wondered aloud.

"Your eyes."

In yet another location, the blinding flash of light began to die down for the last two, as Syrus and Mindy's vision cleared. Looking around, it was obvious that they were no longer on Duel Academy's island, and they weren't even outdoors anymore. They both appeared to be in some sort of office, with Syrus sitting at a desk, with Mindy standing nearby. Nearby was a window, and they saw a strange village outside.

"Huh? Where are we? How did we get here?" Mindy asked as she looked around.

"I don't know..." Syrus replied, then noticed something. "Uh, what are we wearing?"

"Huh?"

Sure enough, their clothes had changed, and their uniforms replaced by clothes that they had never seen before. Syrus now wore a green robe, and nderneath it was a grey, kimono-style blouse with no sleeves, held closed by a broad, dark bluish-grey obi that matches her pants. The blouse was closed quite low, revealing a portion of his chest. On his feet were open-toed sandals with high heels. As for Mindy, she now wore a green short shirt kimono and matching pants; under which was mesh armor that showed out of the sleeves and legs of the outfit. Her new attire was completed with hand guards, a simple black belt, wooden sandals, a red cloak with two simple yellow circles, and a scroll on her back. She also had red lines going down from her eyes.

"How did we get into these things?" he wondered.

"I don't know..." Mindy replied as she looked over herself, then at Syrus, and noticed something as she did. "Syrus, are you wearing makeup?" Mindy asked as she took a look at his face, and sure enough, there was pink lipstick on his lips. And both his fingernails and toenails were also painted with red polish.

"Huh? How'd that happen?" He wondered as he looked over his hands and feet. Seeing a mirror in the ofice, he walked over to it, wobbling a bit in his heels. When he looked into, he nearly stumbled back in surprise. Instead of his own reflection, he instead saw a beautiful woman with blond hair in the mirror. "What the heck!?" he said, the woman in the mirror moving in perfect sync with him.

"Whats wrong, Syrus?" Mindy asked as she walked over to the mirror, and was met with simillar shock. Instead of her relection, she saw an older man with long spiky whte hair. "Whats wrong with my reflection!?" she let out in surprise, the man in the mirror mimicking her movements and words.

choices: Elsewhere, one of the others assumes their new role
There is a knock, and Jaden has to fight as Chun-Li
1523222122121.content:
As the flash of light died down and his vision cleared, Jaden found himself in a completely new location. "Where am I?" he wondered aloud. Looking around, he didn't know where he was, but it appeared that he was in some kind of dressing room.

Not knowing where he was or how he had gotten there so suddenly, he then looked down to inspect himself to make sure he was okay. As he looked down, he saw that his clothes had changed, and he was no longer in his usual uniform. He was now wearing a blue chinese dress with brown sheer pantyhose and large spiked bracelets. He also wore a pair of white boots and in his hair he was wearing white hair bun covers. "How did I get in this?"

Hen then saw a nearby mirror, and in it he expected to see himself dressed strangely, but that wasn't the case. Instead of his own reflection, there he saw an attractive asian woman wearing the same clothes he was wearing. He then raised his hand and waved it, and the woman in the mirror did so as well in perfect unison. He looked down, seeing his own male body, but the mirror showed the asian woman instead.

"What is going on here?" he wondered. It was then that he realized that he couldn't sense Yubel's presence inside of him. Ever since they had fused, he had always been able to feel her there, even when she didn't make her presence known. But now, it was as if the two had been separated.

"Just whats going on here?" He thought.
1523222122121.title: Jaden is Chun-Li

As she looked around, she then looked down to inspect herself, and was onceagain met with a surprise. Her clothing had changed! Instead of her usual uniform, she instead now wore a white gi, with red gloves and a red headband was tied around her forehead. "How did I get in this?"

choices: Elsewhere, one of the others assumes their new role
Jaden sees a crime, and goes to stop it
15232222111.content:
As the blinding flash of light died down, and Jaden's vision cleared, he quickly noticed a variety of differences. First and foremost being that he were clarly no longer on Duel Academy Island. Where he had been nearby the the forested area of the island mere moments ago, he was still outdoors, but was now evidently in a city, standing near the top of a large building. "Where am I?" he wondered aloud.

The other difference was that his friends were nowhere to be seen right now. Whatever had happened, it seemed he had been teleported here without his friends. It was also then that he noticed that he also couldn't sense Yubel's presence within him. Ever since they had fused, he could always feel her there, even when she didn't make her presence known. But right now, he could feel even a trace of her. It was like the flash of light had separated them from one another. With even Yubel gone, he was now separated from all of his friends.

And the third major difference was his clothes. No longer wearing his usual attire of the red blazer, black shirt, and jeans that he always wore, he was now dressed in a strapless red camisole with a gold area resembling two "W's" on his chest, a golden belt around his waist, and blue briefs with white stars on them. On his feet were red heeled boots with a white stripe on the top, and a silver bracelet around each of his wrists. And finishing of things was a golden diadem with a red star on his forehead. He also ha a golden lasso hanging from his new belt. "What the hell am I wearing!?" he let out in shock.

It was then he turned to a window nearby where he stood to get a look at himself in this costume. However, rather than his own reflection, he saw instead a beautiful woman with long black hair. As he waved his hands a bit, it was a sureal experience, watching the woman mimic all of his movements perfectly. He glanced down, seeing his regular own male body dressed in this new attire, but looking back at his reflection was that of the woman. The costume they wore was fitted perfectly for their bodies, with it looking ridiculous on his male body, but much better on the beautiful woman that was now his reflection.

"Geez, whats going on here...?"
15232222111.title: Jaden is an Amazing Amazon

choices: Elsewhere, one of the others assumes their new role
Alexis sees a crime, and goes to stop it
152322221111.content:
In another location, for Alexis the blinding flash of light began to die down, and her vision cleared. She quickly noticed her location had changed, and now found herself standing atop a building in the middle of a city. "What the heck? How did I get here? And what about the others?"

As she did, it didn't take her long to notice that her clothes had changed, and now instead of the Obelisk Blue girl's uniform she normally wore was something completely different. She was now dressed in a blue skintight uniform with a red-and-yellow S shield on her chest, red trunks, a yellow belt, red boots and a red cape to finish things off.

"What am I wearing?" she said as she looked herself over. It was then that she caught sight of herself in a nearby mirror. But instead of her own reflection was that of a muscular looking man with short hair. "What the hell?" she let out in surprise, and watched as the man's mouth moved in sync with her words. She made a few more motions and watched as the man mirrored them perfectly. Looking down at her body, still her own, female one, she was confused by just what was going on.

"First I'm teleported somewhere else and put into these tight, and now I've got the wrong reflection as well. Just what is going on?"
152322221111.title: Alexis the Man of Steel

choices: Elsewhere, another of the others assumes their new role
Chazz sees a crime, and goes to stop it
1523222211111.content:
In yet another location, the blinding flash of light began to die down for Chazz, and his vision cleared. As it did, he found that he was somewhere completely different, and was now in a city, and was standing atop a building, high above the ground. "Huh? How'd I get here?" he wondered aloud.

He then took a look down, and it was then that he caught sight of what he was now wearing. No longer in his usual clothes like his signature black coat, he now wore a white leotard with a hole at the chest, a red belt, blue gloves and heeled boots, and a red cape. "Huh? How did I get into this weird getup?" He felt ridiculous as he looked at the costume on his body. Turning to his side, he saw a window. Normally, he would see his reflection in said window, but right now that was not the case. Instead of himself, he saw an attractive woman with a bob of blond hair.

Chazz flinched in surprise, and was still surprised as he watched the girl in the window mimic his action. "Huh?" Stepping forward, the woman he saw did as well. Placing his hand on the glass, the woman mimicked his actions perfectly. "Whats going on here?" he questioned, watching the woman lips move to his words. Other than his clothes, his body was still exactly the same, but his reflection was completely alien to him. Looking her over, he saw that the hole in the leotard gave him a glimpse of the woman's breasts, and with a blush, he looked away.

"What the hell is going on here?" he questioned as he looked down at the city.
1523222211111.title: Chazz is a Power Girl

choices: Elsewhere, another of the others assumes their new role
Syrus and Mindy see a crime, and they go to stop it
15232222111111.content:
In yet another different location, the blinding flash of light began to die down for two people together this time, and their vision began to clear. Syrus and Mindy were both together, and instead of where they had been just moments ago, they were now in a city standing atop abuilding. "Where are we?" Syrus let out in confusion.

At that, Mindy turned to him, and was surprised by what she saw. "Uh, Syrus, what are you wearing?" Mindy asked as she looked over the shorter boy

Syrus turned to her in confusion, and was also met with surprise. "What am I wearing? What about you?" Syrus returned.

In place of his usual Academy uniform, Syrus was now dressed in a black, one-piece bustier-leotard combination with a blue jacket, and black choker. On his hand were a pair of black gloves, and his legs were clad in fishnet stockings and black high heeled boots. Curiously, his glasses were gone as well, but he didn't seem to have any trouble seeing without them.

As for Mindy, instead of her usual uniform, she was now wearing almost all green. The shirt, pants, shoes, gloves, and hood she now had were all green. The only part of the costume she now wore that was not green was the black mask over her eyes. She also had a green bow and a quiver full of arrows on her back.

"Whats going on? How did we get here?" Syrus asked.

"And why are we dressed like this?" Mindy asked.

As the two looked around, they saw a window with a reflective surface, but instead of themselves, they saw something completely different. Instead of the short boy's own reflection was that of a beautiful woman with long blond hair that was much taller than Syrus, and instead of Mindy's was that of a man with blonde hair and a mustache and goatee. 15232222111112.content:
Suddenly, Chazz started levitating in the air twenty feet from where he was standing, which caught him entirely off guard. He made a loud cry for help, but after a while he realized that he wasn't going to fall and that someone (in all probability) wasn't controlling his actions. Looking around the city, turning 360 degrees, he took in the wondrous panorama, seeing all the sites and hearing all the sounds and smelling all the smells of Metropolis. All at the same time. The wind swept across his chest, bare at the moment because of the hole in his new shirt. His red cape was flapping.

"Oh god, do people see me as that woman in the mirror?" he asked himself out loud.

Slowly, Chazz began moving towards the edge of building, and began descending to street level, slowly gaining speed as he got closer and closer to the ground as he got more confident in his control over...flying. He couldn't believe it. Chazz never would have believed that he would have been able to levitate like this, the way he was right now. He wondered if he could fly too, but his heart beat was pumping just too fast for him to try it out now. When he reached the ground, many different pedestrians looked in awe and shock at him as they saw the superheroine "Power Girl" just standing there on a busy sidewalk, looking scared stiff with an exhilarated look on her face as if she had never flown before. A little girl in a purple jumper and brown pigtails ran up to Chazz, saying "Can I have your autograph, Power Girl?"

"Power Girl?" breathed Chazz silently. What kind of a name was that? How egotistical this woman must have been to have named herself something like Power Girl!

"Um...sure. Do you have a pencil and paper?"

"Daddy, she needs something to write with!"

"OK" said the bemused man, searching his jacket pockets and pant pockets for his daughter to treasure forever.

"Sorry honey, I don't have anything" he frowned.

His daughter pouted even worse than his frown.

"Don't worry" said Chazz. "I'll just go inside this building and ask for some."

"Ok!" yelled the girl, her smile beaming at him.

So Chazz looked quickly at the lettering above the entrance of where the three of them were standing. It was a major bank chain. Chazz knew that they must have paper and stuff inside there. He walked inside, being careful not to get his cape stuck in the revolving door, and as he went up to the teller, he heard a loud scream- the little girl's- as outside, a man who liked like a giant crocodile threw a big rock through the ground floor glass window. Stepping through shattered remnants, he pushed Chazz out of the way, as he was focusing solely on his mission to break open the bank vault with his bare hands. He didn't have a gun, but he didn't look like he needed it.

Oh, Chazz wished he had one of his decks right now.

The crocodile man did indeed break open the vault with his bare hands, and he looked up and down at what was inside. No one tried to stop him.

"Bags. I need bags to carry all these monies in" he growled.

Meanwhile, a bunch of people were looking straight at Chazz oddly, as if they were expecting him to take care of the robber. Like hell he was...but wait, he was supposed to be a famous superheroine, right?

Walking up the the crocodile man, he...
15232222111112.title: Chazz sees a crime, and goes to stop it

choices: He Answers Them, Pretending To Be Wonder Woman
He Asks Who The Heck Wonder Woman Is, And Reveals His True Identity
152322221112.content:
Jaden got over his shock quickly enough when he heard a loud noise, several gunshots firing through the air and the scream of a terrified couple. Looking up immediately from his bizarre reflection, Jaden ran to the side of the tall building where he saw a young man far below, maybe a few years older than him, holding onto a slightly younger woman who looked somewhat like Mindy. They were in an alley with no escape route.

Jaden ran to the other side of the building, his rather awkward boots not slowing him down one bit, where he saw the strange sight of several adult men in clown masks holding AR-15 semi-automatic rifles and rounding the corner from the sidewalk towards the frightened young couple. Meanwhile, cars and other people on streets adjacent to this one were busy going about their day, either oblivious to what was going on or apathetic to it.

Jaden wanted to somehow help these people, but what was he to do!? He was in a strange town, somehow summoned away from Duel Academy, and who knows, maybe this couple had it coming to them for some reason? Jaden looked down again. They were holding each other tightly as one the men in clown masks began to speak.

"Money. Cards. Amulet. Ring. In the bag now, please."

The young woman grabbed onto her ring finger with her other hand, stroking it."

"I...I can't."

"Would you rather die? You can't use it. Give it to us."

"Yeah!" chorused the other clown men, who were more like petty gangsters than children's entertainers,

Jaden had had enough,

"Hey!" he shouted from the rooftop. "Leave those two alone, or you'll have to face me!"

Suddenly, two of the clown gangsters suddenly started looked up in Jaden's direction and instinctively started to blow off their rifles in his direction. They were doing so in order to pelt him with bullets, perhaps to try and kill him. They knew they didn't have a shot against Wonder Woman, but they at least wanted to put up a good fight.

The surprisingly well trained marksmen they were, the clown's bullets were all aimed towards Jaden's chest. But somehow, as if he had been doing this since he was born instead of dueling, Jaden's forearms caught and blocked every single bullet via Jaden's new silver bracelets. All of the casings fell back to the pavement in an amazing ballet of martial artistry. It was almost as if he were moving at superhuman speed.

"Oh ho, Wondy. What are you doing in Batman's hometown?" asked the apparent leader.

Wondy? Batman? thought Jaden. He didn't know who either of them were. They sounded like superhero names, from comics or the movies or TV.

When Jaden didn't answer them, the clowns started firing again, and sadly, one of the many spraying bullets(but only one) hit Jaden directly in the stomach area, causing him to lose his balance and fall down the building to the pavement below. It hurt like a mother______, but to his surprise, Jaden wasn't dead. In fact, he got right back up. The camisole was covered by an armor of some kind, which Jaden rationalized must have helped him break his fall.

The clowns suddenly looked agitated.

"Put the rifles down, please" said Jaden, trying his best to sound intimidating. He would have to wait to find out who this "Wondy" was and give her her cloths back, and maybe get an autograph. Apparently, she was a tough broad enough for a hoods to listen to her.

The clowns did in fact drop their rifles, careful to not set any of them off, and all ran away down a corner with their suit tails flapping behind them.

"Thank you Wonder Woman" said the girl, genuinely grateful.

"Yes" answered the out of breath man in turn. "Thank you, Princess".

Jaden turned around and saw the two shaking lovebirds.
152322221112.title: Jaden As Wonder Woman- Day 1

choices: Jaden Continues Asking The Couple Questions
Jaden Decides To Move On, Trying To Find Out Where His Friends Are
1523222211121.content:
So, his full name was "Wonder Woman". And apparently he was a princess too. Oh jeez, as if Yubel being inside of him wasn't bad enough, he now had to deal with people calling him "Miss" and "Ma'am" and all that. Jaden was never too comfortable around girls or femininity in general, so while some people might find turning into an amazing amazon a wonderful fantasy and a treat to enjoy, these bracelets which had saved his life fit more like chains of bondage to him. To make it worse, to top it all off with a cherry and whipped cream, he was pretty sure that he wasn't in the same reality that he was used to living in anymore. It made Jaden feel all uncomfortable in a really bad way inside to think that he was so far away from home, but he tried to keep a straight face.

Smiling, he answered the couple this way: "Don't mention it! All in a day's work. So,,,what were those guys trying to do to you two anyway?"

"It was some of The Joker's gang. Who knows what's up with them, they always cause chaos for the sake of chaos" answered the man bitterly, looking down at his shaking girlfriend.

"No, no. Why were they wearing clown masks?" asks Jaden. "That's like the silliest costume ever." Thinking back, Jaden recalled this one costume party that he went to where someone dressed up like a giant old fashioned rotary telephone. Now THAT was silly too, but at least Kyon had the excuse that it was a fraternity rite(in order to get into the fraternity).

The man looked at Jaden with an odd look, his face suddenly cocking to one side. "You don't know who The Joker is? He's like the most infamous criminal in the world. A terrorist if you ask me, but he gets off just because he's 'insane'." The man used those little finger quotes when he said the word insane, indicating that he didn't really believe it.

"And his gang all wear clown masks?"

"For the most part. Except for Harley Quinn, as she dresses up like a harlequin."

"Who's that?"

This time the man looked at him even stranger. "I swear to God that I saw you arresting The Joker and Harley Quinn on the news once, princess. Don't tell me you don't remember."

"I...guess I don't" answered Jaden, not knowing what else to say. Apparently, Wonder Woman was a big deal in this world. He would have to learn more about her as he looked around for his friends and maybe a way out of here.

"Brad, leave her alone. Superheroes go through like a hundred criminals and terrorists a week. Hell, sometimes a hundred a day. She can't be expected to remember everyone."

"One of the gang members said something about an amulet?" asked Jaden to the couple.

"Oh yeah" answered the female, pulling out a necklace from her purse that was indeed an amulet. It was one of the most beautiful things that Jaden had ever seen. It felt...almost magical.

"That must be worth a lot of money."

"Oh, it sure is" said Brad. "It belongs to her grandmother, and her grandmom was a witch. I guess they were trying to summon or extract whatever power is in it."

"How did they find out about it?"

"No idea" answered the female. "We were just minding our own business, coming out of a pizza joint, and then suddenly we were being chased down."

"And the ring?" Jaden asked.

"My engagement ring. It's worth $2,000."

Jaden shook his head. This all seemed to be shaking out and making sense. Well, at least as much sense as Jaden could make out of this weird world. The couple seemed fairly rich, and of course rich people were more high profile and likely to be targeted for thefts and kidnappings than poorer people.

"Next time", he suggested, "don't bring such valuable property in public with you if you can't protect it. I won't be around to save you forever."

The couple shook their heads in agreement. "Thanks again, Wondy" said Brad's girlfriend.

Syrus wished his brother Zane were here. Or Jaden. Or Tyranno. Or any of his friends, really. He didn't care if they saw him in this ridiculous outfit. Or hell, he didn't care even if they saw him as this sexy catgirl cosplayer that was his new reflection. He just didn't want to be alone because he had a bad feeling that Duel Academy was a long way from home. Deep inside his gut, he even had a feeling that he wasn't in the same universe he was in a just a few moments ago.

Snowflakes began to fall from the evening sky. The large, monolithic buildings set below the dark visions of the nighttime clouds gave a claustrophobic, closed in feeling, and Syrus had a feeling this wasn't the best of areas to be in at night. Pulling on an invisible strand of long hair that existed only in the window reflection, Syrus then stuck out his tongue to catch the snow. The sweet taste, oh how sweet it was! Maybe this wasn't such a bad place afterall...

"BEWARE THE POWER OF NIGHTFIST!"

"Huh?"

Syrus turned around to his direct right where he saw four people in a scuffle behind a nearby brick building below. Walking closer to the scene, near the edge of the building, he saw what was going on. One man, dressed in a ridiculous costume like himself, was screaming obscenities and dodging the other three as they attempted to dog pile him.

Syrus pulled the sunglasses down on his face even though it was dark, in order to protect his identity. "I might as well, it's part of the outfit it seems" he reminded himself. To his surprise, the sunglasses were actually night vision goggles, and really good ones at that. The sky was almost as bright as mid morning through the lenses, and Syrus could see the four individuals much more clearly than he did a second earlier. The man in the costume had a crazed look on his face, and the other three seemed more desperate looking, as if they just wanted to get out of the alley. Syrus couldn't really tell who the "good" guys and the "bad" guys were in this fight. There seemed to be bags of a white, powdery substance in the alley to, which Syrus immediately deduced must be cocaine.

"So it's a drug war? Hmm...I probably shouldn't do anything about this. But then again, I usually am a coward in dangerous situations, and that's the wrong thing to do. I..."

Syrus decided just to see what would happen if he just made his presence known. 9 times out of 10, people won't want to fight about drugs in the middle of a witness. And if things got out of hand, thought Syrus, he always had this cool looking bullwhip at his side. Syrus took the whip off of his belt, and uncoiled it.

"Now how do I work this thing?" he said out loud. With a flick of his wrist, the limp whip suddenly rattled like a rattlesnake, so he did it again. *Snap* *Snap* *Snap*

Perfection. Somehow, Syrus could use the bullwhip like a natural. Being more daring all of a sudden, he decided to come crashing in on the other guys like Tarzan did in the old movies. There was an escape ladder attached right next to the building where the fighting was going on. The whip was long enough to tie it around the ladder. So that's what Syrus intended to do. He couldn't explain how he was about to go about it, but he would try his best. He knew that Jaden would do the same in this situation. Syrus flicked the whip in the direction of the ladder, and...

The bullwhip somehow tied itself perfectly against the metal ladder at the front of the building, almost as if Syrus' muscle memory had recalled doing this a thousand times before. Quickly doing the sign of the cross with his right hand, Syrus walked off the edge of the building and held on tightly to the whip as he came crashing down right in front of the fighting men.

Skiding across the pavement in the strange costume's black heeled boots, the screeching noise alerted the men to Syrus' presence.

"Oh shit, it's Catwoman! Run!" said one of the three men fighting the masked vigilante, so he ran in the opposite direction.

"Huh? These guys see me as a woman too?" thought Syrus. "How odd...how embarrassing," His musing was cut short as...
1523222211211112.title: Syrus As Catwoman- Day 1

choices: Batman Rescues Syrus, Thinking He's Catwoman
Batman Rescues Syrus, Knowing That He's Not Catwoman
15232222112111122.content:
"...you interrupted true justice from being set forth on those criminals, cat whore! Now feel the wrath, and the fist, of NIGHTFIST!"

Nightfist began to charge wildly at Syrus, who tried his best to get out of the way and evade the man's bladed punches. The man was very athletic, almost like someone who just missed out on qualifying for the Olympics. Syrus, to be fair, was also quite athletic and good at evading the man. For some reason, he didn't feel like he was in his own body, as his own body wasn't so nimble and graceful. It was almost catlike, the way he could easily somersault over the charging lunatic with ease, and could run up brick walls like it was nobody's business. As he continued to battle, Syrus was beginning to get the feeling that he was switching lives with this woman- whoever she was. And whoever she was, she apparently was feared enough for people to run at the sight of her. Catwoman. That must be an alias. Who was she really?

Just as Syrus dodged another punch, Nightfist went out of his way by a few feet to extract three knives from a hidden compartment in one of his gauntlets. He tossed the first one with deadly accuracy, and through only God's good and this woman's equally athletic prowess was Syrus able to dodge it. The second time, the knife came even closer to killing him, almost reaching his heart, but Syrus deflected it away with a garbage can that he was using as a shield. On the third try, just as Nightfist was about to throw again, a man from behind suddenly grabbed his gauntlet laden wrist and twisted it into an uncomfortable position.

"You're under arrest Nightfist. You too, Catwoman" he said, making clear at last that he was actually a cop.

Syrus panicked and turned around, where there were four other cop cars with policemen and policewomen outside pointing semi-automatics at him to make sure he didn't get away. Syrus was screwed. What was he going to do? This lady may have been fast and nimble, be he wasn't exactly sure that she could outrun or out-dodge an array of gunfire. Syrus hypothesized in his head that he potentially could have gotten away had he saw the blinking lights in the distance fast enough a moment or two earlier, but when he was struggling to avoid this crazy guy without hurting him, his time was too preoccupied to notice what was down the street. Syrus didn't want to give up, but he couldn't think of any other options but to go quietly into one of the police cars.

"OK" he said. "I give up."

"Alright then" said one of the officers. "Put your hands behind your back."

Syrus did so, and was then cuffed. He was led to the back of one of the police cars, but not before the officer discreetly patted Syrus hard on the ass, to which Syrus became hot with embarrassment. Then the cop tried the oldest trick in the book.

"Watch your head" he said, shoving Syrus against the top of the car, indeed banging his head roughly, before lowering him not anymore gently into his seat.

After a few minutes, Syrus and the crazy man known as Nightfist were driven away in separate cars to county lockup in the center of Gotham.
15232222112111122.title: Wanted: Catwoman

(Authors Note: After checking out the DC Comics Database, it appears that Carol Ferris wasn't entirely in control of her actions during her time as an enemy of Hal Jordan. Nevertheless, the entity that inhabited Carol WILL eventually show up in this story, just not now. Currently, Chazz is in the body of the superheroine version of Carol who's in the Star Sapphire Corp., which is very similar to the Green Lantern Corp.)

*Rumble*

*Rumble*

*Rumble*

Chazz looked up from the ground and saw a fire breathing, twenty story dragon much farther down the avenue, destroying cars and asphalt with his massive feet, and knocking over buildings with the sweeping of his massive tail. It's heinous breath expelled the fires of a thousand suns, welding many of the doors below shut.

Chazz looked at the dragon, with it's beady yellow eyes, which he could somehow see with crystal clarity, and wondered "Where the hell is Godzilla when you need him?"

Chazz didn't know.

He had no idea where he was, had no idea who he was supposed to be, and had no reason to not just try and up sticks and find out where all his friends were. There was nothing he could do to help these people in this strange city. The dragon didn't come from any deck he was familiar with, despite him being exposed to a number of different decks over the long period of time he has been at Duel Academy. Just as Chazz was pondered where to go, a violet light that emanated from a ring that he was wearing on his right hand enveloped Chazz.

"What the-?"

And just like that, Chazz disappeared again

15232222222212221.content:
After a moment, the blinding flash of light began to die down, and Jaden found his perspective had shifted, and he was in a whole new location. While he had been near the Academy's forest, he was now indoors, and lying down in a bed as well. For some reason, he also let out a yawn, feeling as if he had just woken up

"Huh? Where am I and how did I get here?" he wondered aloud as he sat up from the bed and took a look around. The room was large and clearly belonged to a female based on such things as the open closet that revealed itself to be full of clothes, the vanity tables full of makeup supplies, and other such feminine stuff. He also saw that there was another bed on the other side of the room, one that from the looks of it, had an occupant asleep under its covers, though he couldn't make the person out as they had the blanket pulled over their head.

Deciding to get out of bed, as soon as he pulled the blanket off of himself, he was met with another surprise. His clothing had changed, and replacing his uniform was now a pink nightgown. "Huh? How did I get in this?" he questioned with surprise. He then noticed a picture nearby, and saw a pair of blond, nearly identical girls in it, with the only difference other than their clothes being their hair, with one of them having longer hair than the others. He realized that this room must belong to the twins in the picture.

It was then that he saw the person in the other bed began to stir. Figuring it was the girl whose room this belonged to, he was worried what she would think, seeing a strange boy in her room instead of her sister, and dressed like he was. He knew he wouldn't have time to hide, so he was about to brace himself for the innevitable when suddenly a very familliar person's peaked out from underneath the blanket.

Yubel let out a yawn as she stretched her arms, appearing to have just woken up. Jaden was surprised by this, as it appeared that she was no longer in her spirit form now had a physical body again. "Jaden?" she questioned, letting out another yawn. As she gained more awareness, she saw what Jaden was now dressed in. "What are you wearing?" she asked with an aumsed amirk.

"Uh, I'm not sure..." he replied. "But what about you? You have a body again."

"I do?" It was then that she started to notice that he was right. Her body was solid again, just as it had been in the other world before fusing with Jaden. As she sat up in bed, she then saw that her body was also clothed, wearing a feminine pajama top and pants. Her wings stuck out of the back through a pair of holes. "Huh? How did I get in this?"

"I don't know." Jaden replied. "Probably the same why everything else happened.

As the two looked around the room for a moment, they discovered something strange. As they looked into the full lengthed mirror near the closet, they were met with another surprise. Instead of Jaden's male body and Yubel's non-human one, they instead saw a pair of regular teenaged girls, the same ones that Jaden had seen in the picture. Jaden's reflection was now that of the twin with the longer hair, and Yubel's was the other. Jaden placed his hand on the mirror with the girl in it doing the same in perfect unison. "Well, things just keep getting weirder and weirder." Jaden said, the lips of the girl in the mirror moving with his own words.

Before the two could discuss what was happening, there was a knock on the door, before the door opened and a woman looked right at the two, and they guessed it was the mother of the twins' whose room this was. However, rather than react to the strange sight of a boy and a monsterous figure in her daughter's room dressed as they were, she didn't even bat an eye. Looking right at the two, she ten said "Amber, Nina, You two girls better get ready for school. Once you're done, I'll take you.." After saying that, she left the room and closed the door behind them.

"...What just happened?" Jaden asked.

"I'm not sure." Yubel replied. "But I think that maybe somehow, we've replaced the two girls whose reflections we now have. So now, everyonre else appears to actually believe that we are them."

1523222222221222221.content:
After a moment, the blinding flash of light began to die down, and Jaden found his perspective had shifted, and he was in a whole new location. While he had been near the Academy's forest, he was now indoors, and lying down in a bed as well. For some reason, he also let out a yawn, feeling as if he had just woken up

"Huh? Where am I and how did I get here?" he wondered aloud as he sat up and looked around the room he now found himself in. He could easily descripe the room with one word: Pink. The walls and carpet of the room were pink, and decorated with a variety of girly decorations. The floor also had various dolls, stuffed animals, and other stuff that were clearly girl's toys.

It was then that he realized that he had been holding something close to him, and saw that he was holding a stuffed doll. This also caused him to notice that it appeared that his clothes had changed, and when he got out from under the blanket, he saw that he was wearing a pink, frilly and girly nightie that looked like something an little girl would wear. "How did I get in this?" he let out in surprise.

As he got out of bed, he looked over at a nearby full length mirror, but insead of seeing his reflection, he saw a little girl where he should be. Walking over to the mirror, the girl did too. He still had his own body, but the mirror showed a different image than it should. It was weird, as the girl in the mirror that was now his reflection was much shorter than him, so he had to kneel real low to get a look at her. She appeared to be about 7 years old, and had brown hair.

"What is going on here?" He questioned. It was then that he realized something else: He couldm't sense Yubel's presence within himself. Ever since they had fused, he could always feel her there, even when she didn't make herself known to him. But now, it was like they had been separated again.

As he got up, he was about to try to think about what was going on, when suddenly the door open, and in walked a woman. Now, rather than being surprised by the sight of the boy dressed in a little girl's nightie, she didn't even bat and eye, and looked right at Jaden. "Erica, its time to get ready for school." she said sweetly.

Confused, he thought about what just happened, then glanced back at the mirror and saw his new reflection again. 'Does she think that I'm really the little girl whose reflection I've got now?'Jaden must get ready for school as Erica
1523222222221222221.title: Jaden swaps lives with a little girl

choices: Elsewhere, another of the others assumes their new role
Alexis must get ready for school as Billy
15232222222212222211.content:
Elsewhere, Alexis found herself in a similar situation. When her vision had cleared after the flash of light, she had found herself now in a whole new location. She was now lying down in a bed, and for some reason, she felt a bit tired, as if she had just woken up, which she found strange since she had been wide awake moments ago. As she sat up in the bed, she took a look around the room she was now in. From the looks of it, the room appeared to belong to a young boy. There were action figures and other toys littering the ground. The blanket over her also had a variety cartoonish robots and machines. "Where am I, and how did I get here?" she wondered.

As she sat up in the bed, she looked down at herself, and was surprised to see that her uniform had been replaced, and she now wore a baggy blue shirt with a cartoon character on it, and a pair of pajama pantts decorated with similar pictures. "How'd I get in this?" She then stood up and looked down at the clothes. It was odd, as despite looking like they were the kind of pajamas that a young boy would wear, they fit her older and female body as if they had been made for her.

She then saw mirror, and walking over to it, she was shocked to see instead of her own reflection, that of a young boy dressed exactly like her. The image in the mirror, despite appearing to now be her new reflection, was much shorter than herself. He appeared to be 7 years old, and he was mimicking all of her movements perfectly.

Before she could wonder further about what was going on, the door of the room opened, and in walk an older woman. Now rather than be surprised by a teenage girl being in a young boy's room dressed like one, the woman didn't even bat an eye. She then looked right at Alexis and smiled. "Billy, its time to get ready for school." she said sweetly.

Alexis was surpised by this. It was like the woman really believed that she was actually the young boy that was now her reflection. 'Is that the case?' Alexis wondered to herself.

153.content:
It was a seemingly normal day, and Yusei was currently working on Duel Runners in the garage. Along with his own, Crow's and Jack's were there as usual, as well as Akiza's, and even Sherry had come to him for some help. As he was working on them, Crow, Akiza, and Sherry stood nearby. Jack meanwhile was enjoying a cup of ramen.

As he was working, he heard the sound of the door opening. "Yusei? Are you here?" he could Luna ask as the twins entered.

"Yes, I'm here. I'm just working on the Duel Runners." he replied.

The twins came into the main area, Carly with them. "Hey Yusei, on our way here, we ran into Carly, and then we found this really weird card." Leo said as he held out the card for everyonre else to see.

"Its blank?" Sherry questioned as she examined it.

"Yeah. We just found it lying on the ground and picked it up and figured that We'd show it to you guys." Carly explained.

"I don't see whats so interesting about it." Jack said. "If its blank, its not a very useful card."

"It is weird, though." Akiza said.

"Yeah. I wonder where it came from."

Then suddenly, the card began to glow, and emitted a bright light that engulfed the group.

153311.content:
As the bright light died down and their vision had cleared, the group quickly noticed several changes. For one, their positions had been moved around, and everyone was standing somewhere else. Somewhere that someone else had been standing before the flash of light.

Other than their scrambled positions, there was another noticable change: Their clothes. Somehow, they had all swapped clothing amongst themselves. Yusei was now dressed like Akiza, Jack like Carly, Crow like Sherry, Leo with his sister Luna, and vice versa for all of them. But despite size differences between them, their new clothes fit comfortably, as if they had been made for their new wearers. There was also other strange differences, such as Yusei's crimnal mark not being on his face, and instead was on Akiza's.

"What just happened?" Leo asked with disbelief. wondering why he was dressed in his sister's clothes.

"I don't know. Why are we all wearing each other's clothes?" Luna questioned looking down at herself in her brother's clothes.

"Uh, guys." Carly said, getting everyone's attention. "You might want to see this." she said and everyone gathered around her. What she had wanted them to see was a photograph of Team 5D's. However, there was a big difference in this picture compared to what they remembered. For one, their positions had completely changed. At the center of the picture had originally been Yusei, Jack, Crow, and Aki in their racing suits, but now instead had Akiza and Yusei had swapped positions and clothes, now wearing each other's racing suit, Carly where Jack had been dressed in his, and Sherry in place of Crow. Off to the side stood stood the twins like before, but had also switched postions. The poses of those in the picture mirrored those of those they had swapped places with.

"What is wrong with this picture?" Jack demanded, taking off Carly's glasses from his face, only to reluctantly return them when he saw that his vision blurred without them.

"Its not just that one." Sherry said. "All of the other picture are just like it."

"But why?" Crow questioned.

"Hey, the picture aren't the only things different." Akiza said. "Take a look at this." she said, holding up her arm to show her Signer Mark. However, instead of her own claw mark, it was instead Yusei's head mark. Everyone else looked over to their arms. Jack and Crow no longer had any marks, while Yusei had Akiza's claw mark, Leo had Luna's claw mark, and LUna had his heart mark, and Carly had Jack's wings mark while Sherry had Crow's tail mark.

"Just what is going on here?" Sherry wondered in confusion.

"I'm not sure." Yusei said. "But its almost like we've all somehow switched places with one another. Like we now have the lifes of each other instead of our own."

"But thats impossible!" Leo said.

"It should be, but somwhow, it looks like thats the case." Crow said. "I mean, its hard to deny all the proof."
153311.title: Yes

15331211.content:
"So then, what are we going to do?" Leo asked, looking down at himself, at the strange sight of his own young body dressed like Akiza.

"I don't know." Luna said, looking down at herself dressed like Yusei, and then over to Yusei dressed in clothes like her normal ones.. "Maybe since that card did this to us, the card can fix this?"

"Theres a problem with that." Yusei said. "We were so busy taking this strange turn of events that we didn't notice right away, but the card is gone."

"What!?" Akiza said. "But, what if we're stuck like this?"

"I don't want to be Akiza!" Leo said, pacing back and forth. He doesn't notice that despite having never worn heels in his life, he has no problem walking in what were once Akiza's pumps. In fact, his hips sway in a feminine fashion with each step, the way he was walking being the same way that Akiza did. In fact, none of them had noticed yet, but along with swapping lives, their mannerisms and posture were amongst what had been swapped as a result.

"I'm sure none of us wants to be each other." Sherry said. "But freaking out won't solve anything."

"Sherry is right." Crow agreed. "We've got to stay calm."

"But then what are we going to do?" Carly asked.

"We don't know." Yusei said. "Our only clue would have been the card, but it seems to have vanished."

"So then we should try and find that card again." Jack said.

"But how? We have no idea of knowing what happened, or where it went." Luna said.

"Or... if it went anywhere at all, and isn't just gone for good." Sherry said. They all shuddered at the thought of that.

"So what should we do?" Leo asked.

As they all think about what to do...
