1553222222211121.content:
"This sure is a nice day, huh Astral?"

Yuma Tsukumo asked his spirit friend as he was waiting for Tori on a bench in the new amusement park opened in Heartland city. Dr Faker made it in a way to apologize to the public for lying to them about the whole Duel Carnival. Not everyone knew the whole truth, but the people already forgave him nonetheless. The park had everything from roller coasters to a small shopping mall, and everything was relatively cheap. To enter you just needed a small fee and to make a registration tag for the day, which consisted of a photo of the person, his name and a few minor things to enter. It seemed strange for some, but in reality it was a security measure in case suspicious people came into the park.

Yuma and Tori made plans to visit the theme park for today, with the latter making sure Cathy or the guys didn't know about this. They both wanted to have an enjoyable Saturday. He was sitting on the bench for 15 minutes before saying:

"But Tori sure is late. I wonder if her work she had to do at her home is the thing that's holding her up. She said that she was quite busy."

"Probably... But by the way Yuma..."

"Yes?"

"Don't you think you should have put on something else?"

Yuma was wearing his typical outfit of a red jacket, a purple and green sleeveless shirt, white pants with orange designs and a pair of black and blue shoes. He also wore his brown fingerless glove and his bracelet as well as the trademark Emperor's key hanging on his neck alongside the ID tag. However, he didn't have his Duel Disk with him as he put in a locker at the entrance.

"You think so?"

"You said it yourself. This is a special occasion."

"It's not that special. Besides, having different outfits to change daily is something I am not too comfortable with. And let's not forget that there is the chance that I would dress with something she might not like. This one is the safest."

"I suppose...", said Astral calmly. "But now let's get back on the topic of the blank card."

"Oh, right...", said Yuma as he pulled a black dueling card from his pocket.

He found it on his way back from school yesterday on the ground. It seemed like an ordinary card, but Astral could feel that it had tremendous power in it. While he was unsure of its purpose or origin, he deduced that it could somehow grant wishes.

"You really think this wish thing is real?"

"By my analysis, it appears so. This card contains an energy which apparently has the ability to grant people's desires..."

"But it didn't work before remember? I wished for some extra cash for today and it did nothing."

"I believe the wish needs to be something more meaningful than something as simple and material like that."

"So if I wish the Barians to end their invasion, it will do it?"

"I doubt that. Despite the power, it isn't something found in either the Astral or Barian World. I doubt anything related to other worlds will matter in this situation. In fact, it seems more like it is imbued by spiritual power by a human more than anything..."

"Really? Do people like that exist?"

"That is beyond my comprehension. But as your friend, Anna Kaboom said, I believe it is something to do with "fighting spirit"."

Yuma sighed and grumbled a bit in annoyance, which prompted Astral to ask him:

"Is something wrong? Did you and Anna have a fight that I don't know of?"

"No, it's not that. It's just that... recently she has been really annoying."

"Was she?", asked Astral as he raised his eyebrow.

"She always comes whenever me and the gang want to do something and she always invites herself for said activity. The guys don't mind it, but me and Tori really have gotten tired of this. I understand her wanting to spend time with us after the time we dueled together, but she doesn't have to do it daily. And whenever I ask her why exactly she came, as I am sure she has her own plans for that day, she just fidgets and says she wanted to spend more time together."

Yuma really didn't hate Anna, but whenever he remembers the times she not only caused damage with her cannon, but also got a bit too clingy to him. He didn't mind her company, but her constant decision to invite herself in his plans and arguing with Tori about who knows what really began to irritate him.

"Don't you two have a duel scheduled with her tomorrow?"

"Yes, I do. Tomorrow I may ask her about why she wants so much to spend time together... And as for the "fighting spirit" thing, that means to be more passionate."

"I see..."

He then looked at the card. He wanted to know Anna better so that their relationship wouldn't be so awkward. He surely knew that there was something else to her. With the card in his hand, he then thought of something. He knew the chance for that to work was slim, but still, it was worth a try.

"Hey Astral, mind if I try another wish?"

"You may as well I suppose... I am curious to find out how this card works."

"Thanks." He then closed his eyes and when he opened them, he said to the card: "I wish I understood everything there is about Anna Kabbom, 100 percent!"

Much to the shock of the two, the card emitted a bright light that covered them. The wish was made, but it wouldn't be in a way Yuma ever thought...
1553222222211121.title: Yes

15532222222111212.content:
When the light dimmed out, Yuma opened his eyes... to find that nothing changed. He was still on the bench, and upon checking his thoughts, there was nothing new he learned about Anna. But there was something that disappeared...

"Huh? Where did the card go? Hey Astral, do you- Astral?", he asked around as the spectral figure was no longer next to him. When he went do check his pendant, he was in for a shock.

... okay, there were two things that disappeared.


"W-Where did the Key go?!", asked Yuma aloud, some people looking at him confused. "S-Sorry.", replied the boy he sat down on the bench, trying to keep his voice down.

"Okay, calm down. Was the card a trap? No, Astral said that it wasn't dangerous. And it can't be a dud as it made the Key vanish... How is this related to my wish in the slightest? It doesn't make sense. Anna even barely says anything about it whenever she talks, and she isn't even interested in Astral that much... What is going on here?"

As Yuma was trying to grasp the situation, his wish started to kick in.

His shoes suddenly lost their laces as they better conformed on their feet as the color was starting to fade from them, starting to get whiter. Speaking of his feet, they became a bit smaller as his toes gained a pedicure.

But he ignored the slight discomfort from his shoes as he decided to look for the key.

"It has to be here somewhere. I doubt the wish would've sent it somewhere too far... Just have to hope for the best I guess... All right. It's time to feel the flow!", said Yuma to himself.

He began looking around, checking in the bushes, under the benches or the grass. He believed the card wouldn't just get rid of something that important for no reason, so he hoped that it would be near. But he still couldn't find out how was this tied to the wish.

"Just why did it make it go away? I can't see the logic here. It me finding the Key somehow tied to the wish? I doubt it. And even so, there must be another way to do it... Ngh, this is starting to get on my nerves."

Yuma, while hot-blooded, wasn't the person with a short fuse. He didn't get angry over anything too easily and he got frustrated quite seldom, but mostly due to Astral's random comments or the gang's antics. But right now, he seemed like he wanted to just yell out his frustration. He grew increasingly impatient with him not finding the key or thinking as to why it vanished.

As he continued searching, his hair started to change. The back black strands that spiked upwards seemed to be starting coming together as the four spikes seemed to get closer, almost like they were trying to merge together. Also, his feet finished changing, becoming petite, but they didn't seem to have lost their strength, in fact, they might've gotten a bit stronger and flexible.
15532222222111212.title: The Key disappeared

155322222221112121.content:
Yuma was slowly getting more and more frustrated, his bottled up emotions being ready to come out. While initially he tried to restrain himself, after 30 minutes of searching around the area, and not finding anything, he stomped his foot on the ground.

"Damn it! Where the heck is that thing?", he exclaimed aloud.

Once again, some people turned at him, surprised by the yell and confused as to what happened. Upon noticing the stares, Yuma awkwardly walked away as he apologized for the racket.

As he walked, his shoes turned completely white but suddenly the soles started to turn dark-pink. Initially it was just a few spots of color but as he got out of the park and got near the shops, the whole bottom part was now pink. And it didn't stop there, as the color began spreading the sides of his shoes. Speaking of them, they seemed to get a tad sturdier as they also got a bit longer, now covering his ankles.

Once he got himself a good distance from the park, Yuma sighed to himself as he stopped.

"Man, that sure was embarrassing... As annoying as the whole situation is, I really need to keep my cool.", said Yuma to himself. "I am sure Astral would say that I need to think rationally about this and all.."

While he was thinking, his skin got a shade or two paler as his calves began altering. The muscles remained as strong as they were, but they got more shapely and slender in the process.

"... But honestly though... How am I supposed to find why the wish made the Key to disappear if that and making me understand Anna better are completely unrelated?", he asked himself, the more abrasive side from before reemerging, as he put his hands on his hips, not noticing how they were starting to shrink and slim down.

"Ngh... There is no point in trying to understand the wish right now. I just need to find Astral and the Key and then wonder about the whole wish thing."

Yuma knew that if he asked somebody for help and told them about the circumstances, they would just laugh at him as nobody would believe in cards that grant wishes. He had to ask his friends for their help... But he could also ask the workers of the amusement park about it, asking if they somehow found the key. It wasn't that great of an idea, and calling Tori seemed like a better idea... But a part of him seemed to think differently...
155322222221112121.title: A moment to reflect

1553222222211121212.content:
Despite knowing that contacting Tori or one of his friends was probably a better idea, a feeling that he should be more independent grew within him. He wanted to show that he could do things on his own... And on top of that, the idea of calling Tori seemed to be denied a bit, even if he didn't understood why exactly.

"Guess I'll go and ask someone then..."

He started walking around, hoping to find a security guard or a worker to tell them about the missing pendant. He could just lie and say he simply lost it somewhere in the park. He would then wait to see if someone finds it. If not, then he would call his friends for help.

As Yuma was walking around, more changes took place. His side bangs continued to get closer to each other as the upwards spikes were starting to straighten. As for his front spike, it also began to flatten backwards as the red on it became a bit lighter in color.

After a few minutes of not finding anyone, Yuma thought of something.

"Oh yeah! I can also ask an employee at a store for that as well... Duh, how come I didn't think of that sooner?"

He then entered a clothes store that was near him. At the counter there was a young woman in her mid-twenties with brown hair. She seemed kind enough to be asked about the pendant. Yuma however had to wait a little bit as she was currently busy with another customer.

As he was waiting, his thighs began to slowly get thicker. Some of the mass from his calves migrated upwards to them as they were gradually expanding. This put some pressure on his pants, but they also began to succumb to the changes. Firstly, they got a lot tighter on him and they also began to shrink, now leaving his ankles and reaching the middle of his calves.

After the customer left, Yuma got up to the counter, where the woman welcomed him with a smile.

"Good morning sir! You can I be of use to you today?"

Yuma smiled a bit at the woman's kindness before he asked a bit sheepishly:

"Good morning. Um, I am here to ask if you found a pendant around here."

"A pendant?"

"Yes, I kind of lost it... I went through here earlier and I was wondering if you found it by chance."

He was hoping the woman would buy his lie. It sounded a bit forced, but he was betting on the fact that the store was quite full all day long, and thus he didn't get noticed.

"Oh my. No, no one came to say anything about a missing pendant. What does it look like?"

As Yuma was telling her about how the pendant looked like, she was taking notes on it in case someone else found it to know how to recognize it.

"I see. Thank you for the details. Oh, I almost forgot. I also need your name for this."

"It's Yama Tsakomo..."

"Okay Mr Tsakomo. Once I find anything, I'll call you. In the meantime, you can look around the store."

"Thanks...", said Yama, as he left to look around, a bit confused at the name he called himself.

The woman then looked on her computer to check the security camera to see if Yama had the Emperor's Key with him, this being something he had not accounted for. This would be a great issue to him, as it would completely blow his lie off. However...

"So he was here... I didn't recognize him at first, but he seems to have come here before. He doesn't seem to be wearing the pendant though.. I think I should check up with Midori before I ask Tohru-san about it..."

Yama was indeed on the camera feed. He actually didn't even go in there today, but reality was warping around him. He was still unaware of the whole camera thing, but soon it wouldn't matter at all for him.
1553222222211121212.title: He asks someone

15532222222111212121.content:
"Why did I call myself that?", said Yama to himself. "That sounded so weird of a name... I hope the lady figured out that I said my name wrong, but what about my family name? I think I should clarify it later. But why did I spell my name wrong? Was it a slip of the tongue? Or I got flustered with all that happened and I screwed up?... Whatever, what's done is done. Maybe looking around a little might help."

Yama looked at the various clothes that were on display as he tried to forget a bit about the whole trouble. The entire floor seemed to be dedicated to men's wear, but there were some unisex clothes as well. There were some really nice jeans, hoodies and T-shits that he liked, all of them looking really nice in his imagination.

"Wow, some of these look really cool. Maybe when I get my allowance I may buy a few. The red ones look awesome. I wonder what else is there."

As he was looking around, his pants continued to grow smaller, now resting just below his knees. But there was something else that happened. The orange crescent marks that were at the bottom gradually faded out until they were completely gone. Also, the material seemed to darken a little bit, the immaculate white now being a faint gray as they seemed to get a bit more stretchy as well. In response to this, his shoes got higher on his legs as they covered his now bare calves, the pink line in the back extending as an orange dot formed on top of his feet. His socks didn't change much, as they stayed white, but seemed to also get more elastic in the process.

While looking around, a thought occurred to him.

"I wonder though... Should I try and change my style a bit? I mean, red is cool and all, but maybe something else might work... I don't know, maybe white? Kite seems to be rocking it quite well... I don't know, maybe once I see anything interesting I might consider it..."

He then began to look around for clothes that weren't as predominantly red as the ones from before. White, black and light-blue seemed to appease to him somewhat, but he still could feel like there might be some other color that would go better, thus he continued looking around. As he did, his hands finished becoming quite delicate and petite, but in reality they got a lot more grip strength than before. His nails grew a bit as well along with his fingers, but they didn't got any treatment, leaving his hands with a small sign of a rough look. The changes went up to his arms as they began following the same example as his hands: looking more slimmer, but getting a bit stronger in the process.

He soon got to the unisex area. Yama initially wanted to leave, but then...

"Hm... Some of these shirts look pretty cool... And I am digging the yellow and- Hold on!", said Yama to himself as he tried to get a grip. "I am not into these sort of clothes, and what was I saying about yellow? Actually, they might look better on Tori... Maybe I should look to see if there is something for her here as well... But there isn't as much as..." He stopped himself upon noticing a set of stairs that goes upwards. "This place has two floors? I wonder what is upstairs...", he wondered as went up.
15532222222111212121.title: Looking around

155322222221112121211.content:
Once Yama reached the second floor, he saw that it was a mirror image of the previous floor, except that this one had women's clothes instead.

"Oh, so the girl clothes are here huh? Well, there isn't much for me here... but I guess I should look a bit for Tori. Who knows, maybe she'll like what I found. She may even come here to see what else is in here."

Yama didn't have his wallet at him at the moment, but figured that in case he finds something interesting, he should make a mental note. He had a few options for himself downstairs. He still waited to find something that would intrigue him, but currently he decided to check out the girls' section.

There was a pretty diverse selection from dresses and skirts to various sport wear. Yama had a little trouble deciding what exactly he should look for, since Tori would swap outfits from time to time and each had various accessories and such. But he remembered that she would more often than not, wear pink. With that in mind, he started looking through the clothes, trying to find something that would look more interesting.

As he looked around, the red bang that was once his front spike completely fell back, not touching the rest of his hair. The red that got a bit lighter then started to leak onto the rest of his hair as the color spread. But interestingly enough, the process seemed to avoid the lower parts of his hair. His face also got more rounder as he continued looking.

But there was something else that was changing. While he was initially still concerned about the whole situation with the Emperor's Key and Astral, Yama didn't seem to be as alarmed as before. While he still knew he had to get back his pendant, a part of him wanted to get a bit more laid back and enjoy visiting the shop. Also, certain aspects such as Zexal, Astral's mission and the various names of the Number Cards seemed to get cloudier in his head, as he was slowly forgetting about them. But at the moment, he wasn't paying attention to these thoughts, as he found something.

"Well this looks nice.", said Yama with a smile.

He spotted a dark-pink blouse with a slightly frilly collar and some butterfly designs. It was quite honestly something that would appeal to any girl.

"The color, the design... it's all so cute!... I mean nice!", corrected Yama. "Geez, if I say something like that out loud people will surely get the wrong idea... But seriously, it looks so nice! How can anyone say it isn't?"

As he was admiring the blouse, his sleeveless T-shirt was also starting to change. The margins of the green "D" were fading, merging together with the purple as the overall color was darkening, some spots turning black as it began to slowly rise, currently just below his bellybutton.

Suddenly, while looking at the blouse, a thought came to his head.

"But it would be a shame to just give this to Tori... I mean, she can buy it herself if she wants it, she doesn't need me to tell her to. Besides, she already has all those outfits while I barely change mine. And on top of that, she also tries to impress others with that... If she wants to get it, then let her come here and find it.", said Yama with a huff, not noticing his voice was higher by an octave.

"I guess I should look for myself a bit more then. Downstairs wasn't anything special though... I guess I should check the unisex area too. Who knows, maybe I can find something."

He put the blouse the back on the hanger as he left to the unisex section. He looked back at it for a second, thinking that it still was cute and pretty, but he then walked away, not because he thought it was silly to think that, but just because he wanted to check what else was in the store.
155322222221112121211.title: The second floor

1553222222211121212111.content:
Yama didn't know exactly where that comment from before exactly came. He didn't dislike Tori, and thought it would be a nice thing to do. But he remembered she telling him once that he didn't have that great of a fashion sense. A bit upset with that, he looked at a full-body mirror on the wall.

"That's so untrue. I mean, just because I like to dress myself with one particular outfit, it doesn't mean it's not fashionable. I mean, I look at myself in the mirror and I see nothing wrong with what I am wearing."

While looking at himself, he didn't notice that his pants continued shrinking, now passing his knees as their color continued darkening, not being more of a dark-gray. The material also got more elastic as his pockets were starting to fade away. As for his shoes, they continued growing longer, now resembling boots, as the pink line from the back going back to the top section. The trailing pink line seemed then to converge in the top portion, the rest disappearing, as long with the one that crossed his ankles seemed to expand a bit the more the color accumulated.

"Besides, she always changes her outfits. It makes it hard to decide which style she likes most. I say having a main one with a few secondary ones is the best option.", nodded Yama to himself. "If she comes here and likes the blouse, then good for her. But I am not going to fill up her closet just because I want to be nice."

Pleased with his thought, Yama looked at the unisex section. There were some nice shirts and jeans that drew Yama's attention, especially the black and blue ones. His likeness to red still remained, but it was now mostly buried by his other favored colors. He then noticed something that intrigued him.

"Now this looks good."

He picked up a black training jacket with pale-green accents. The design was mostly simplistic, but it seemed quite attractive to Yama.

"Simple, efficient, and screams "sporty". I like it! It is perfectly for my morning jogs too!"

Yama was indeed an active person, but he usually wouldn't do many physical activities outside the ones at school if there wasn't a reason. But he seemed to want to keep himself more fit at the moment. He was quite well-build anyways, but he also didn't seem to want himself to gain weight. This was something that never bothered him before and seemed weird at first, but his mind calmed him down as he thought there was no disadvantage in a bit more training, as jogging, swimming and rock-climbing seemed more appealing to him.

As he was admiring the jacket, his thighs, which slowly grew all this time reached their final size, as they became quite large and looked a tad strange on him, but looked quite nice in his changing pants. The changes didn't stop there as his hips also started to get wider as his waist began to do the opposite, becoming a bit smaller.

"This would look great with my new sport attire. I just need a new pair of sneakers and I'm set... I wonder how much he'll like it...Huh?!"

Before he could have the chance to figure out where the last thought came from, a voice came from the speaker.

"Mr Yamna Tsakoom is asked to come to the front desk, please!"

Yamna recognized the voice as the woman at the counter, but was confused by the way she called him.

"Did she say my name wrong? Wait... That's the name I told her at the start, wasn't it?... Well, I'll tell her about that once I get down."

He put the jacket back on the rack as he went downstairs. He took one last glance at the jacket... and then at the blouse before leaving.

"That blouse was as cute as the jacket was cool... I guess I know what to spend my money on next time I get here. Just gotta pray no one buys them..."
1553222222211121212111.title: Finding something

15532222222111212121111.content:
Yamna returned to the counter, seeing that besides the woman from before, there also was a young man in uniform waiting for him. He seemed to be part of the park's security.

"Oh, Yamna-san you've come back. This is Batsu-san, a member of the security."

"Good morning. I am Batsu Takigawa. Are you Yamna Tsukoom-san?"

"Yes, that's me. Nice to meet you too."

Yamna was confused as to why he didn't correct himself over the name issue, but Batsu interrupted his thoughts.

"I've received a report that you lost something around this place. Is it true?"

Yamna nodded and wanted to clarify what it was, but he was having some difficulty.

"Huh? Why is my mind so muddled? I lost... my pendant wasn't it? Yeah, I think it was. Did it had a name too? Um... I can't remember... Why is it so difficult? Did I let my mind wander too much that I forgot?!... Calm down Yamna... You don't want to cause a scene in front of these people."

As he was thinking, his vest lost the buckles it had to close it. Instead, a light green zipper formed to take their place. Also, the white in his hood was starting to leak into the vest, gradually replacing the red. But despite all these changes, neither Yanma nor the others noticed it.

"Y-Yes... I lost it around here..."

"Can you come with me to the "Lost and Found" office? Sayaka-san already gave me a description of the object that you lost. We might have found it."

"R-Really?", asked Yamna. He didn't expect someone to actually find it so quickly. "Of course I'll come! Thank you very much", he exclaimed not noticing his voice went higher by an octave again.

"No problem. It is just our duty.", smiled Batsu.

"I am sorry we interrupted you. Did you find anything you like?", asked Sayaka.

"Yes, I did. I was wondering if you have more of the same thing in case someone comes to buy it."

"Sure we have. We have a few copies of each item in stock. You can come later if you want to buy something."

"Really? Thank you!"

"No problem."

After saying goodbye to Sayaka, Yamna and Batsu left the shop. She then took a glance at the note with Yamna's description of the object she lost and murmured to herself: "How in the world he did he lose something like that? Well, I am sure Tohru-san and Batsu-san found it. It would be impossible to find that.", before she went back to her work.

On the way, Yamna experienced a breeze of cold air, which made him to shiver a bit.

"Brr... Was it this cold when I came here? It sure feels like that... But it wasn't like this... Whatever, it's not that bad. I can take a small gust any day."

The cold was actually coming from his silky smooth skin, his body hair falling off, leaving him hairless everywhere except for his head as his skin got another shade paler. Speaking of his hair, the top part was now mostly ruby-red, together with the upper part of his side hair, his former spikes fusing together to form two side-points. But that wasn't all. His red side hair that once supported the front spike was gradually turning orange as the color began spreading to the lower half of his hair. Finally, his mane also started to grow, his hair getting a bit longer overall.

"Why can't I remember what I lost?", asked Yamna to himself. "I am sure it was a pendant... wasn't it? I mean, it has a lot of sentimental value after all... Grr... This is so frustrating! If I wasn't with Batsu-san, I would be banging my head to a wall, trying to remember... No, bad Yamna. I need to calm down. They already found the thing already. Most likely, after they bring it to me, I am sure I'll recognize it... But wasn't there something else I forgot? Was it about my name..? Did Sayaka-san say my name wrong on the intercom?... I don't recall..."
15532222222111212121111.title: Back at the front desk

155322222221112121211112.content:
"Excuse me Yamna-san...", said Batsu, snapping the boy from his thoughts. "Were you thinking about something?"

"O-Oh, yes. But it wasn't really that important. Is there something you wish to ask me?"

"Yes, there is. Regarding the item you lost, how exactly did you misplace it? It is quite hard to believe something like what Sayaka-san would be lost."

Yamna didn't predict to be asked so directly about how he lost his pendant, as he took a second to think.

"This is bad. I need to make a good story... But what did he mean by that? Is a pendant that hard to lose...? Wait... was it a pendant? I am pretty sure I lost it and Astral-"

His thoughts were interrupted as a small wave of vertigo took over him. It wasn't enough to make him lose his balance, but Batsu still grabbed his shoulder in case he would fall.

His memories were starting to change more than before. His childhood seemed to be gradually changing as images of fighting bullies were replacing the ones of him training with his father. What memory he had about the Emperor's Key was reduced to basic knowledge of the design as all of its abilities as well as other important knowledge about the Astral and Barian Worlds also disappeared. The name "Astral" still ringed a bell for him, but it didn't seem to be as personal as before. As for his catchphrase, other than the fact it sounded cool, it really didn't have that much of relevance for him anymore.

During this time, his boots finally finished their changes as the pink on top became an extension of the footwear that covered his legs, in a slightly softer material, up until his knees as a orange diamond formed just below it. The lower part became a bit bulkier as it became some sort of ankle protector. His arms also finished changing, becoming smooth and slender, but still brimming with power as his shoulders became rounder.

"Are you okay Yamna-san?"

"Yes... Sorry, I got dizzy there for a second.", said the boy as he was recovering.

"Do you need to see a nurse? The medical office isn't too far away."

"No, I am all right, thanks... As for how I lost it... I went into a store and spend a bit too much time in there I guess. When I got out, it was missing."

"I see... It is possible that a worker might have found it and thought it was unusual and took it to see what it was sine there was no one next to it."

"Most likely."

"Don't worry. We already brought it from the main office. You just need to pick it up using your identification tag."

"I will. And thanks again."

"No problem."

The two continued walking towards the "Lost and Found" office, with Yamna wondering where the dizziness from before came. He decided to put it behind at the moment, agreeing on resting a bit after the whole situation is over. If he would look at his tag, he would've seen his changed name, including his altered appearance in the picture. He wanted to check it out as well at first, but right now, any doubts about his name was gone, agreeing that "Yamna" was indeed his name and that he may have heard Sayaka wrong on the intercom. But there was something that caught his attention.

"Hmm? Was my right arm always this bare? Was I wearing something on it?... Nah, it must be my imagination."

In reality, his gem bracelet that he would always wear vanished during the time he was lightheaded. But he didn't remember wearing it anymore. Instead, it seemed to him that he saw it on someone else...
155322222221112121211112.title: Batsu asks him something

1553222222211121212111121.content:
The two arrive at the building, however they are a bit surprised when they see a small line of people already in line.

"Do all these people come here for their lost stuff?"

"No, not always. Some also come here to ask for information or directions. This place also acts as an info center too... But it is surprising that a line so big formed already. Forgive me for this."

"Not a problem... Say, do you know where the bathroom is?"

"Take the corner to the right. At the end of the corridor, there should be the restrooms. I'll be waiting here for you."

"Thanks."

Yamna goes towards the specified direction and enters a restroom. If he would've paid attention, he would've seen he entered the women's bathroom. But the lack of urinals didn't faze him, as he entered a stall. Once inside, he was ready to do his business, but a gut feeling that he should stay down formed in his head. He was confused at first, but obliged it nonetheless.

As he was sitting down, a cushy feeling was developing, giving him the impression he was sitting on a pillow, which was impossible, so he ignored it. His butt was gradually expanding, in a proportionate amount of fat and muscle, as his hips spread wider. Both of them still had a little more to grow, but they definitely didn't look like they should belong to a boy.

But he was preoccupied with something else.

"Okay, so mishearing my name and forgetting why I am here for aside... What was that thing of "dressing nice so that he might like it"? Who am I trying to impress? My father? Well, I want him to see me more like an adult. The blouse and jacket seemed more mature, but still... I don't think this is about him..."

As his memories changed, so did his family. A new father, and a new mother, who never went away in a trip that they haven't return yet from were appearing in his mind. Truthfully, they also looked quite different than the ones he originally considered as his parents, but that didn't faze him in the slightest, as pleasant memories of them spending time together filled his head.

"If it isn't about him, then who? A friend of mine?... Why should I care about their opinion about this? I mean, Bronk, Caswell and Flip are nice guys, but I wouldn't dress nicely for them. And Shark is way too indifferent to care about this... Well, I will surely make Cathy and Tori jealous, that's for sure.", grinned Yamna to himself. "Then who-"

A sudden growl of his stomach broke his train of thought as he put his hands on it. This was because his waist continued to compress, but for him it was a sign of hunger.

"I guess I should grab some grub after all this."

After he finished, he pulled up his underwear just as it began to change. His red boxers began to tighten as it started to blacken, shrink and get more elastic, but also softer as well. This constricted his groin a little together with his pants, but it felt much better against his larger hips and rear. His top also seemed to do the same as the boxers as it rose higher on his torso, getting more black by the second as the material changed again, becoming similar to his underwear.

But he didn't notice anything, as he left the stall, more concerned with his thoughts.
1553222222211121212111121.title: Bathroom break

15532222222111212121111211.content:
When he reached the sink to wash in hands, he took a glance at himself in the mirror. When he looked at his image, he wasn't shocked at his altered appearance, but rather confused.

"Huh? Is it just me or I look different in a way? Is it my hair?"

The orange was now covering most of the lower part of his hair as a red bang fell from the front a little as the mane continued growing. On the side of his face, two small bangs were starting to form, beginning to frame his face.

"Nah, it's not that. But I can't help but feel that something is different...", he mumbled to himself as he washed his hands.

A small itch on his face prompted him to wash it as well. As he rubbed it, his cheekbones became higher as his nose, chin and ears got smaller. His eyelashes also got longer while his eyes got bigger. After rubbing it off with a paper towel, he took a glance at his new face. He wasn't confused about that, but about something else.

"Is something wrong with my eyes?"

Indeed, his originally red eyes were now closer towards an amber color. The rest of the face however seemed normal to him however.

"Are they more orange than usual...? No, it must be my imagination. But..."

After he took another glance at the mirror and looked down, he found out that his vest was open, revealing his tank top. Seeing this, he blushed massively as he quickly moved his hands to the zipper, fumbling a bit with it due to how flustered he was.

"Gah! W-Why didn't anybody tell me about this?! Was this the reason why I was feeling cold? Did Batsu-san notice? No, he didn't say anything, so he didn't... Thank Goodness... How absentminded must I be to not notice?!"

While trying to zip up the vest, his hood was reforming around his neck, becoming the collar of the vest, with the same light-green edge from the zipper forming on it. The material of the vest became a bit softer overall as it became completely white. As for the top, it was now almost black, as it resided just below his torso.

His pants finished their changes as they reached the middle of his thighs and got tighter on him and darker once more, becoming a pair of black compression shorts. It hugged his lower body quite nicely, showing a little of his curves as his groin was feeling a little restricted, but nonetheless he found nothing wrong with said feeling.

After zipping the jacket up, he breathed a sigh of relief.

"Hah... I am so glad it went by unnoticed... I hope it did... No one turned around to look or even comment on it. Huh. I may be a scatterbrain, but some people need to pay much better attention to their surrounding."

Before he turned away, he noticed two round hairpins with a light-blue gem in the middle and silver edge. He put them on his longer bangs, not finding it odd in the slightest as he moved his hand through his hair, lifting the lower portion a bit upwards.

"There. Now I don't look plain anymore. Hehehe, not that it could ever be possible."

After a small giggle from the last comment, he left the bathroom. Just then, a pink diamond formed on the back of his vest.
15532222222111212121111211.title: Checking himself in the mirror

155322222221112121211112111.content:
Batsu caught glimpse of Yamna quickly and welcomed him back.

"Did you had trouble?"

"No, not at all.", he replied in a voice which was between male and female.

When he looked at the line, it was still there, but it surely got smaller than when he arrived.

"Now please wait in line. I'll go help out Tohru-san at the counter."

"Okay."

Batsu left, as Yamna got in line. Despite the outbursts from before, Yamna was quite calm this time, not trying to rush things up by skipping the line. He was going to get his property back after all.

As he was waiting, he rubbed his neck with his gloved hand. He felt a little discomfort in his throat ever since he left the shop, but it wasn't too unpleasant. However he noticed his voice sounding a bit off the more the feeling persisted.

"I should've drank some water. Do I have something in my throat?"

The more he rubbed his neck, the more his Adam's Apple was shrinking. By the time he found a bulge in the front, it was the size of a pea. He gently pushed it back and swallowed it.

"There. Much better.", he said quietly in a familiar, high-pitched voice. "Now with that out of the way, now I can just wait."

The minutes were passing a bit slow, but Yamna decided to let his mind wander a bit as he began thinking about Duels. As he did, more changes happened. His glove was splitting into two parts and changing color in the process. One part got tighter onto his hand, changing material from leather to something more elastic as it became pure black while the other seemed to cover the previous one, from just over the wrist to below his knuckles. As for the pink diamond on his back, it became quite large, covering a good part of his vest...but by this point, the material seemed to resemble a sturdier shirt. From below the diamond and around the shoulders, pink splotches similar to the diamond formed as they began extending.

In his mind, Yamna was recalling some strategies he used in some of his previous Duels.

"Hehe... That was a good final turn. If I knew he didn't had protection against Effect Damage, I would've tried to end the Duel with Gustaph much sooner..."

His Duel strategies were changing. His more composed style he learned from Astral, was replaced with one more reckless, but also more efficient in his opinion. And even the cards he used were different, with his ace Monster being "Gustaph Max" instead of "Utopia". He also seemed to get more fond of trains as this seemed to be the Deck he owned in his mind. By now, all of his knowledge about Zexal, the Numbers and even Astral were gone.

"If only I had a cool Number card... That would be so awesome."

"Next please!"

When he came down to reality, he was surprised to see that 20 minutes passed already and that he was already at the counter. At the desk was a man, a bit older than Batsu with a serious expression on his face.

"Your name please."

"I-It's Amna Tsaboom.", said Amna, too flustered by the man's stern behavior to see he called himself differently.

"Can I see your ID tag please?"

"Sure."

Once he got the tag and checked it in the database, a small chuckle escaped his lips.

"I see... So you've come to pick it up?"

"Y-Yes..."

"Please wait until I bring it back."

The man left, letting Amna wait a bit. This helped him try to gather his thoughts again.

"My did he smirk? What exactly did I lose? Was it... a pendant? No, it can't be that, I don't wear anything like that... Then what it is... Try to remember... I came here this morning, wanting to check the shops. I stopped at a ice-cream stand..."

As he was thinking, his shirt seemed to get longer as the material started to extend below his belt. Speaking of which, the silver buckle suddenly changed shape, becoming an oval as the color became orange. In the middle, a large blue button formed, which replaced the original one he had on the side. As for the belt itself, it became wider and a bit thicker turning from black to dark-pink. The belt also got a bit tighter on him, finishing making his waist smaller, giving him a nice hourglass figure.

"...Then I played that shooting game at the arcade... Heh, my aim sure is getting better... Then I flew over to that photo booth and- Wait, flew?"

Disrupting his thoughts, the man returned with the object he lost. Just then, the pink began to expand forming thick lines that started to circle around its arm holes and stretch upwards and to his sides from around his shoulders and from his back respectively.
155322222221112121211112111.title: He waits in line

1553222222211121212111121112.content:
The man brought back was something someone doesn't see daily. It was what looked to be a large, pink arm cannon with a handle in the middle. Amna was confused about it at first, but within 5 seconds, he immediately recognized it. But instead of asking about his pendant, he now knew in his mind that the cannon was his missing object.

"Oh! Thank you so much! Where did you find it?"

"It was near a photo booth. The workers believed at first it was some kind of prop, but soon they realized it was more than that. They brought it here afterwords. While this thing is quite dangerous and we normally we would hold onto any kinds of weapons, it has a safety mechanism that prevents people to use it as they please. This makes this thing much more harmless, unless you are its owner."

"I made that thing myself. Well, with a little bit of help, I am no mechanic. But yes, I went into that booth and then I quickly went into another shop, forgetting about it near the booth. I stood there quite a while, so I am not surprised about this."

As the two were talking, the pink lines from his shirt completely circled around his shoulders as the lines that came from his back were continuing going to the front, more specifically to his chest area. As for the section that spouted from the bottom of his shirt, it didn't give as much restriction as the shirt as it gently flew in a slight breeze that came from the window as pink stripes were forming on it as well.

"Please be more careful Mr Tsaboom. Even if it isn't remotely dangerous, there is a chance children might hurt themselves with this."

"I know, and I am sorry Mr..."

"Yamada. Tohru Yamada to be more precise."

"Thank you Mr Yamada. I promise I will not lose it again."

"With pleasure.", answered Tohru with a faint smile as he handed the boy his cannon.

He thanked once again before leaving with his contraption at his back as Tohru looked at him, with Batsu getting near as well.

"Kids these days sure get a lot of weird toys, huh Tohru-san?"

"Indeed. But it wasn't a mere toy. In fact, it could be really dangerous in the hands of other people."

"It wasn't that bad. Sure, kids might blow up stuff with that thing, but it has that safety on it, so it would be impossible for anyone to use it unless you own it. Besides, if he got it, that means he is responsible with it."

"I guess so. Still, to be called that a cannon was found is not something I here every day."

"Yeah.", laughed Batsu a bit as Tohru gave a small smile in response.

Outside, Amna got behind the building to check his cannon.

"Man, I really need to pay attention. I only noticed it was gone only after I got out of that shop. I am so happy I asked Sayaka-san about it the moment I realized... But how could I forget what I lost? What did I think was missing? A pendant? That's stuff Tori would have. She even has one in the shape of a heart too... Whatever, they are way too girly for me. Besides, I have my own charms. I don't need any jewelry to make myself look good.", said Amna proudly to himself. "Still, I wonder why my head was so cloudy today... Meh, I am sure it's nothing. I mean, everything is clear now.", he continued with a carefree smile.

As he checked the cannon, the orange bangs that were once just around his eyes now lowered down to his chin as a tuft of ted hair covered now his forehead. His hair was now a complete balance between red and orange, giving him a very familiar hair-style. Also, when he had to rub his eyes again, they completely changed color, being now a very distinct yellow color.

"So the hydraulic system seems to be fine... and so does the firing mechanism,... I am amazed they didn't say anything about the motor it has. They might just thought it was just a cannon, but it surely is a lot more than that."

After pressing a hidden button on the handle, the cannon opened up, with two propeller wings now being on its sides.

"I am sure these guys never thought it was also an aircraft.", giggled Amna softly.
1553222222211121212111121112.title: A pink cannon

15532222222111212121111211121.content:
He then positioned himself on top of the cannon as the gripped the handle like he was trying to pilot a plane.

"A little test run after the whole thing wouldn't be bad. Besides, it is much faster than walking."

He revved up the engine, making the propeller speed up and hot air came from the back of the contraption. After he strapped his legs on, he then moved the handle upwards.

"Aaaannddd take off- Whooa!"

He panicked a bit as the cannon lifted itself off the ground, but caught a gust of air, making him trying to reassert control as he began leaning on one side and then backwards. As he was doing this, his back was strained a bit by the constant movement. In this time, his spine curved, making a perfect arch. This made him have a slightly better control of the aircraft as he could bend much easier. After a couple more seconds, he managed to have the cannon under control as he reached the same level as the building's roof.

"... Much better now.", he smiled to himself as he flew away.

After fixing the speed, he then strolled through the air. He occasionally looked down at the people and the park, noting if there was something that would catch his attention while he focused on piloting. After a few minutes, he began thinking about what happened during the day.

"I never thought I would see the day I misplace my cannon. I don't know what possessed me today. Whatever it was, it sure had something to do with the brain freeze I had. Seriously, I forgot what I lost... I hope I am not getting dumber. That would be awful... I am sure it was just a fluke. There is no way it was anything else...", he muttered, trying to put behind the whole incident.

In the meantime, the pink stripes reached his chest area and stopped right to the sides of his zipper as the pink lines from below became indentations on his shirt, the lines expanding as they became another layer of material underneath the upper layer, becoming partially visible The shirt was split in front and in the back of his legs, partially showing the pink fabric.

"I should better keep quiet about all this. I don't want Yuma to think I am that clueless and forgetful."

At this moment, Amna no longer thought of himself as "Yuma", but as a different person all together. The strange thoughts about him trying to impress someone were getting clearer as the figure became Yuma.

"If only he would notice me more... I thought after the Duel with Brooke we might get closer, but he is as occupied as ever the whole Number business... I understand that it is tied with saving the world and such, but still... He should have some free time for me as well... I envy Tori. Not only does she gets a better grip of the whole Astral World or whatever, but she is also his childhood friend... I don't see what she has that I don't. A nice figure? Yeah, right. No one beats mine."

As Amna huffed with pride, his hips and butt grew one more time, completing his womanly figure. They were bigger than the average for a 14 year old, looking much bigger than the ones Tori had, especially his gorgeous heart-shaped behind.

"... I guess though she is more calmer than I am. And she doesn't get mad with him easily since they were friends since they were little kids.", said Amna a bit dejected. "Meanwhile I confused him with my school crush and nearly knocked his lights off. And then I barely showed up in his life until that last big Duel. I tried to hang up with him, but he is clearly uncomfortable... What I must do so that could be more likable?"
15532222222111212121111211121.title: He rides the cannon

155322222221112121211112111212.content:
As Amna was flying, still thinking, a prickling sensation sensation formed on his chest, snapping him back into reality.

"My chest feels itchy. I really need to scratch it... But I don't want to lose control and hit my head onto something again... I need to wait a bit until I find a nice place to land. I don't want to cause a commotion."

Amna tried to contain his desire to rub his chest as he was looking for a landing spot. The sensation was given by his nipples which pinkened and grew larger. They also became more sensitive as they poked a bit through his shirt, making it harder to keep focus. But the discomfort was slowly going away as his top finished shrinking stopping shrinking just below his pectoral area as it became pure black. His neckline plunged quite a bit as it lowered itself in the back as well, the material becoming quite elastic, without causing his nipples much discomfort as it seemed to contain the itchy feeling.

On the ID tag with his picture, his name family changed once again becoming "Taboom". The reason only his surname didn't change was because the wish was nearly done, as it was really little to change at this point.

Amna soon spotted a cafe, which at the time seemed to not have any customers at the time. Thanking his luck, he landed right next to the tables, making sure he wasn't seen by people. Once he landed, he deactivated the cannon's flight mode and then started to rub his chest.

"Mmm.... This feels better. I was a bit concerned that it was an allergy or something, but it seems to be going away."

The fading sensation was partly because his top, underneath his shirt became a black sports bra, protecting his chest from any potential contact with his shirt. The other was because his chest began to grow out, fat accumulating behind his nipples.

Just as he stopped rubbing, a waitress in a black and white uniform noticed him.

"Good morning! Welcome to our cafe!"

"O-Oh... Good morning... And thank you.", said Amna a bit awkwardly, not expecting someone to notice him so quickly. "I-I thought you were closed..."

"We aren't, it's just that people usually come here during lunch, so we just opened. Please take a seat."

"O-Okay..."

Amna took a seat at a two person table as the waitress asked him for the tag. Once she registered it, she gave it back to him.

"So Mr Taboom, do you wish to eat something?"

"N-No, I am not hungry yet. Um, do you have something healthy to drink?"

"We have included several smoothies in our menu. They are all really nutritious and healthy. But I recommend the kale, apples, cucumbers and grape one. It is one of my favorite."

"That sounds good. Then I shall settle for it."

"Okay, it will be ready in a few minutes.", said the lady as she left for his order.

"I just hope I have enough money. I didn't predict going to a cafe. But it is still better than to have people ask me what I am doing here... It's a miracle she said nothing about the cannon. She may have thought it was a toy, given how calm she seemed about it. I guess that's for the best.", thought Amna, as he put the tag on the table.

"I wonder where Yuma is right now... He said he would go to the park too. I wish I would just meet him here, as unlikely as it sounds... And maybe take him on a ride with the cannon... in the sunset... No no! Be realistic! That is not my style!"

Deep down however, he was still thinking about it. As he was imagining a romantic date flying through the sky, even if he didn't want to, his lumps on his chest began to grow larger, currently being at large A-cups and continuing to expand, as the bra was growing together with his chest. Down below, his boxers, which have been changing slowly ever since he left the bathroom completely lost their legs as they became a similar material as the bra, becoming a pair of black panties with a small red line of the top. This brought more discomfort for his groin, but it didn't feel as tight as it slowly began receding.

On the tag on the table, his current name, "Amna Taboom" was going through its final changes. The top portion of the "T" was breaking into two segments as they started to migrate to the side, while the "m" was starting to have his last leg removed.
155322222221112121211112111212.title: He lands at a cafe

1553222222211121212111121112121.content:
Amna was unaware of what was happening to him. Despite the fact that he should at least feel his chest getting heavier, he was too focused on his thoughts to notice.

"It would be great to go on a date with Yuma... But it's very unlikely. I mean, not only he doesn't notice my feelings due to how dense he is, but I must compete with Tori and Cathy for him too. And most likely, he would go with Tori, given how close they are... Although Yuma may be so clueless that he might not even now what a date is..."

His chest continued growing as time passed by gradually growing through the B-cup range, becoming bigger than Tori's. Also, his testes started to feel tighter as they seemed like they were ready to be pushed in, as his boyhood continued getting smaller.

"What can I do to draw his attention to me? I mean, the only thing he seems to like more than anything is Dueling. I know I asked for a Duel tomorrow with him, but I feel like I need to make it more interesting. I mean, I know I am better than Cathy, and definitely Tori, but how can I stand a chance if he became so good so fast?... I wish I had a Number. I know it's risky and all, but that would at least make me be close on even on par with Yuma... The perfect Number for me would be like "Gustaph Max" but more futuristic and with a larger cannon... Hehehe... It would surely look amazing...", giggled Amna a bit before an image came t his head. "Me and Yuma Tag Dueling, both our Numbers on the field... That would be amazing... I don't know about romantic, but-"

Suddenly, a dull pain manifested in his groin. He quickly moved his hands to see what happened, but was confused when the pain began to diminish as quickly as it came. His testes were pushed inside him, changing function as they became ovaries as they were linked to a newly formed cavity in his abdomen. The surge of estrogen made his breasts grow a bit faster, now being C-cups as they were almost done with their growth. Before he could question what was the cause of the pain, he started to feel a bit dizzy, as his mind got a bit muddled.

"Ngh... Not this again..."

His identity was almost done changing, as he now was getting confused as to what gender he was at the moment. On the tag, his family name was now "Kaboom" as the "m" in his surname had its last leg partially missing.

Just then, the waitress came back with his drink. Not wanting to worry her, he acted like nothing was wrong, despite feeling a bit woozy.

"Here is your drink Mr Kaboom."

"T-Thanks..."

"If you need something else, please call me."

"I will..."

The woman bowed before she left, leaving Amna with his drink. The dizziness seemed to be slowly going away, which was a relief for him, but he got a bit concerned nonetheless.

"Where is this coming from? Is it because I didn't sleep enough?... Argh! My head is still foggy. I should ask Mom what she thinks the cause is when I get back home.", grumbled Amna under his breath.

After another minute trying to clear his head, he looked at the smoothie he ordered. He was a bit turned off by how green it looked, but since the lady described it as being one of the healthiest in the menu, he compromised and took a sip. He was quickly amazed by how refreshing the drink was.

"Wow, this much better than I thought it would taste! It's fresh, and tasty and it's good for you... Maybe I should come here more often... Only if it isn't that expensive..."

As he was drinking, underneath his boyhood, which lost more than half of its original size, an opening was starting to form, as his thoughts about his identity were getting clearer the more he drank.
1553222222211121212111121112121.title: Lost in thought

15532222222111212121111211121211.content:
After drinking half the smoothie, Amna put the glass on the table, giving a pleased sigh.

"Man, this is good. I am not really in eating too much kale, but the cucumbers and the apples sure makes it taste a lot better. Perhaps I will come here another time. And maybe I will also invite Yuma as well then..."

He closed his eyes once he finished his thought, as his mind started to wander off again. His boyhood was now so small it became invisible through the tight pants. It was almost time...

"Hah... It seems I can't help it. I don't know since when I started to feel like this. It surely began after my first Duel with him, but it was merely a small feeling back then. I was too preoccupied with other things at the time. I was shocked that my childhood crush was someone else entirely, and that I confused him with someone else just because of the name... I don't know what was dumber... The fact that I got the name wrong or that I didn't even notice he was completely different than the boy I remembered... Then I tried to just wipe things away. But after I helped him against that gang at the tournament, I realized that I may have fallen for him. It became obvious after the Duel with Brooke as well... I know I have been away from him for quite a long while, but still... I-"

Another wave of drowsiness took him over, clouding his thoughts one last time as the changes reached the end. Between his legs, a young womanhood blossomed as on the tag, the last leg of the "m" completely vanished. Her new name and identity, Anna Kaboom, filled her head as her head got clearer, the new persona integrating in the world.

"Again...? Jeez, I hope I am not getting sick. It's been happening so random though... I should ask Mom to go to a doctor if this happens again.", murmured Anna, unaware that this was the last time he would feel like this, as the wish ended.

"Now where was I? Oh yeah. I will from now on try to be more active in this whole saving the world thing. I don't want to just be on the side, rooting for Yuma. This is to get stronger and also closer to Yuma... I know I have a lot to catch up with, but I hope he might be able to see that I am capable to fight by his side... Hehe, that would surely score some points for me. Tori might be his childhood friend, but I am the best of the gang at Dueling by a mile!", said Anna to herself with a proud smile, before making a meek expression, as her cheeks flushed slightly. "... I know I fell for you Yuma... I wonder if Tori feels the same as I do, but if she does, then I guess why she gets so clingy whenever I'm around... Well, I am not going to give up so easily... I need to take things slowly... then I could imagine ourselves piloting my cannon into the sunset."
15532222222111212121111211121211.title: The decision

155322222221112121211112111212111.content:
Anna heard some footsteps in the distance. She believed another customer came, as the lady said that they just opened, so they should receive more people. Indeed there were quite a few who began sitting at the tables as some servers began taking their orders. Anna was ready to finish her drink, when she noticed someone. Yuma was slowly walking over, with a slightly troubled expression on his face, looking for an open table. Upon noticing him, Anna stood up and waved to him.

"Hey Yuma! Over here!"

"Huh? Anna?"

A bit surprised by seeing her, Yuma walked in her direction.

"Is this seat free?"

"Yeah, it is. What were you doing here?", asked Anna as he took a seat.

"Well I was supposed to meet with Tori today and walk around the park, but she caught a cold and her mom messaged me about it. I already came here fully prepared for a day of fun, but it will surely be boring on my own."

Thanking her luck, Anna smiled and then offered: "Then how about we spend the day together?"

"You and me?... Are you sure? I mean, you must have already something planned.", said Yuma a bit concerned.

"Not really. I just came to check some shops, but if you want to have fun together, it will be perfectly fine with me!"

Yuma didn't know what he should do. He considered asking Astral, who was floating next to him, also assessing the situation, but he probably didn't had any helpful advice to give him in this situation. He really didn't want to deal with Anna's shenanigans today. But he wanted to do something about their Duel for the next day, so a little time together might be necessary.

"Okay, I will. But under one condition."

"What is it?"

"Please don't freak out when I show you this."

Out of his pocket, he handed her a card. When looking at it, her eyes opened wide when she read its name: "Number 81: Superdreadnought Rail Cannon Super Dora".

"Eh?! You're giving me a Number?!", asked Anna as she suddenly stood up, her small D-cups bouncing a bit at the movement.

"Shh! Be quiet! People will start watching!"

"O-Oh, sorry...", she said meekly as she sat back down. "But really, are you giving me a Number?"

"Well... in a way yes. Me and Astral fought this guy who had this card. It seemed super random to have it, but then I thought, that maybe you should try using it. I mean, you already have a full Deck with cards like these, and maybe you should try it as it would be constructive for your strategy development. I planned to use this for tomorrow's Duel and... Are you listening?"

Anna was in shock, as her cheeks became pink. She was ready to pounce Yuma and hug him for giving her a Number just like that. Especially since he thought of her when he saw the card. She wanted to kiss him as well, but she was snapped from her fantasy when Yuma waved her hands in front of her.

"Hello? Earth to Anna. Are you listening?"

"H-Huh? O-Oh yes, of course."

"You got bored at my smart talk didn't you? I told Astral people will not take me seriously when I do this."

"No, it's not that. So... can I really have it?"

"Yes, for the moment. Still, it is dangerous as people could get possessed by these cards. Tomorrow is a trial run in case something goes wrong."

"... Are you sure I'll be fine then?"

"I'm sure. I- I mean me and Astral thought about your whole fighting spirit talk from before and decided at would be a good try. I-We are sure you'll do fine."

Anna's face brightened as she she gave him a big smile. "Thanks Yuma. It really means a lot. Tomorrow it will be time that I should feel the flow, right?"

"S-Sure..."

Anna giggled as she went back to her drink as Yuma was laughing a bit nervously.

"After tomorrow, if everything goes fine, and Tori or anyone else doesn't see, I'll steal a small kiss at the right moment..."

As Anna was happily fantasizing, Astral approached Yuma.

"By the way..."

"What is it?"

"Why did you lie that I suggested her using that Card? It is true that I thought about it, but you were quite eager to have her try it."

"I-It's just out of curiosity. I mean, in a way, this seems like a Card made especially for her. I am amazed a random dude had it."

"I agree with how the card ended in that man's possession... But why aren't you just telling her it was a gesture out of your kindness instead. I am sure she already knows that."

"What?! Don't be silly. It is merely for the sake of testing the Number, nothing else."

"Hah... I can't do anything about yourself not really being honest with yourself, but be it as you say..."

Yuma frowned a bit at the specter's words, but in reality, he thought that doing something nice for Anna might make her spill the beans as to why was she following him all the time. That and... well, because he believed it was a nice thing to do. He still cared about her... she just had to calm down a bit with her "fighting spirit"...

Meanwhile, in a dark room, a magician was sorting through his things, when he noticed something.

"Hmm? Is one of my wishing Cards missing? Well, I guess someone will have a great day with their wish. There isn't a big problem for me. It only makes true the pure-hearted ones after all.... Whatever it is, it makes the wish become true in the end..."

15533.title: Yu-Gi-Oh! Crossover

155331.content:
Yugi Muto yawned as he made his way to school. Things had been normal lately, which was a rarity for him. But he was going to enjoy it while it lasted. As he made his way to school, he noticed something lying on the ground. As he got closer, he saw it was a Duel Monsters card. Picking it up, he saw that it was completely blank, other than being green which indicated it was a spell card. There was no picture or name on it.

"What a weird card." he commented.

As he looked it over, the card suddenly began to glow, and then emitted a bright light that engulfed him.

---

Jaden Yuki made his way to the Academy building from the red dorm. Things had been quiet ever since he had returned from the other dimension, so he was going to enjoy things and hope nothing else dangerous was going to happen. As he made his way to the building, he noticed something lying on the ground. As he got closer, he saw it was a Duel Monsters card. Picking it up, he saw that it was completely blank, other than being green which indicated it was a spell card. There was no picture or name on it.

"What a weird card." he commented.

"I agree." Yubel said as her spirit appeared next to him. "I feel a weird presence from it."

As he looked it over, the card suddenly began to glow, and then emitted a bright light that engulfed him.

---

Yusei Fudo was walking down the street, currently on his way to get some parts to work on his Duel Runner. It had been a few weeks since he had saved New Domino from Z-ONE, and things in the city had returned to normal. As he made his way to his destination, he noticed something lying on the ground. As he got closer, he saw it was a Duel Monsters card. Picking it up, he saw that it was completely blank, other than being green which indicated it was a spell card. There was no picture or name on it.

"What a weird card." he commented.

As he looked it over, the card suddenly began to glow, and then emitted a bright light that engulfed him.

Yuma Tsukumo was currently walking down the road, with Astral floating behind him. It was the weekend, so he was looking for something to do. As he made his way down the streets of Heartland, he noticed something lying on the ground. As he got closer, he saw it was a Duel Monsters card. Picking it up, he saw that it was completely blank, other than being green which indicated it was a spell card. There was no picture or name on it.

"What a strange card." Astral commented.

"Yeah, tell me about it." Yuma agreed. "Its completely blank!"

As he looked it over, the card suddenly began to glow, and then emitted a bright light that engulfed him.

15533122121221.content:
As the flash died down, the four duelist felt that something was different, and quickly found that their clothing had changed.

Yugi was now wearing a sleeveless white top with blue trimmings with a blue miniskirt, and a pair of blue boots with a low heel. He also had on the blue fingerless gloves that went up to his elbow. On his feet were blue heeled boots. He didn't recognize it, but he was now wearing the uniform for girls of Duel Academy's Obelisk Blue dorm.

Jaden was now wearing a pink coat over a white shirt, a blue bow, and a blue pleated miniskirt. On his legs were white knee-high socks, and brown loafers on his feet. He wasn't aware, but it was the girl's uniform for Domino high school.

As for Yusei, was now wearing a white blouse with a pink collar and miniskirt, and knee high black socks and brown loafers on his feet. Not that he was aware of it, but this was the girl's school uniform at Yuma's school. And though he couldn't se it, on his face, his criminal mark was gone and there was also a red ribbon tied on the left side of his hair.

As finally, Yuma was wearing an open burgundy coat, white button-down shirt, a black skirt, and a green tie. On his legs were black thigh high socks of the same color and red high heeled pumps on his feet. Around his neck was a red chocker and a necklace with an emerald crested golden cross medallion, and rolled in the front of his hair was also a silver device. Like the others, he wasn't aware that his new clothes were a uniform, the girl's uniform of New Domino's Duel Academy.

The four were embarrassed by their new, more feminine attire.

"W-what am I wearing? How did I get in this thing?" Yugi let out in embarrassment.

"What happened?" Jaden let out, just as embarrassed and confused.

"Well, don't you look cute like that." Yubel teased.

"How did all of this happen." Yusei wondered, managing to stay the calmest of the group despite his embarrassment.

"What the heck am I wearing!?" Yuma said, freaking out.

"This is a most peculiar occurance." Astral commented.

As the group stood in confusion, there was another flash of light once more. This light was teleporting them elsewhere, where they would assume the role of the life they now had.

155331221212212.content:
As the light transported them to assume the lives they had been swapped into, it also did something else. The four duelists had originally come from different times, and had now swapped lives with people from different time periods then their own. Now instead of transporting them to the different time periods, it did something else. It created a new time period, one that was a combination of the four different ones, and transported them to it.

---

As the light died down for Yugi and Yuma, and their vision cleared, he found himself in a new location. They were standing near a forest, and looking around, they spotted a pair of buildings, and over the forest they could see a city in the distance. In this new combined time, the Duel Academy of Jaden's time, and the New Domino Duel Academy of Yusei's time were both part of the same facility. In in this new reality of a combine Duel Academy, Akiza was also part of the same class as Jaden, Alexis, and their friends.

"What is going on? How'd I get here?" Yuma questioned.

Yugi then saw Yuma was with him. "Hey, you're one of those who was with me after that card teleported me to that weird place and changed my clothes." he said.

"Yeah." Yuma repled. "So uh, any idea whats going on?"

"Sorry, no clue." Yugi replied. As he looked around the area he had been transported to, he then spotted someone familliar to him. It was Tea! But she was dressed much differently than usual. She was now wearing an open red blazer with a black shirt under it, and jeans.

The two were standing in the middle of a sidewalk, and nearby they saw a pair of school buildings. In this new combined reality, the high school that Yugi, Tea, and their friend went to was right next to the middle school that Yuma, Tori, and their friends went to. It was also common for members of either group to walk to school with one another.

"You're Jaden, right?" Yusei asked.

"Huh? You know me?" Jaden questioned.

'He doesn't remember when we met? Hm, maybe this is a Jaden from a time before we met.' Yusei thought. "I've heard of you. Anyway, any ideas of what happened? Why we're dresed like this or what is going on?" Yusei asked.

As the two thought about what had happened, they spotted two people a distance away. The two people were familliar to them as well. They were Alexis and Akiza, both of which were dressed differently.

Alexis was wearing a loose white t-shirt and a blue jacket with matching pants , and Akiza was now wearing a white shirt with red-lined sleeves and collar, a red tie and blue pants. Around Alexis's neck was a goden pyramid-looking object, and ahanding from Akiza's was a strange golden object that was triangular overall.
